title: Casket Bearers Fold Flag During Former President Truman's Interment
Scopenote: During the funeral ceremony for former President Harry S. Truman, the pallbearers hold the flag covering Mr. Truman's casket as they prepare to fold it. The pallbearers are identified, near side, left to right: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Far side, left to right: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army (hands visible only). Father John H. Lembcke, Jr., the officiating minister of the funeral of Harry S. Truman, stands at the bottom right. Mr. Truman's burial is in the courtyard of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Pallbearers Fold the Flag During Former President Truman's Funeral
Scopenote: Honor guard member Sgt. Greg Kulick, US Army, holds the folded flag that draped over former president Harry S. Truman's casket during the interment ceremony in the courtyard of the Truman Library. Other pallbearers are identified, near side, left to right: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Far side, left to right: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; and Kulick.

title: Margaret Truman Daniel poses with her four sons
Scopenote: Left to Right: William Wallace Daniel, Margaret Truman Daniel, Harrison Gates Daniel, Thomas Washington Daniel, and Clifton Truman Daniel.  The Daniel family during a trip to Key West.    From:  Dr. Voss, possibly Dr. Carl H. Voss of New York City.

title: Portrait of H. Graham Morison
Scopenote: H. Graham Morison, Assistant to the General Counsel of the War Production Board, 1941-43; Captain, United States Marine Corps, 1943-45; Special Assistant to the Attorney General of the United States, 1945; Executive Assistant to the Attorney General, 1945-48; Assistant Attorney General and head of the Civil Division, 1948-50; Assigned to establish the Office of Economic Stabilization, 1950; Acting Deputy Attorney General, 1950; Assistant Attorney General and head of the Anti-Trust Division, 1950-52; and private law practice in Washington, D.C., 1952-76.

title: Truman with his grandsons, Key West
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman with his grandsons, taking a walk in Key West, Florida. From left to right: William W. Daniel; Clifton Truman Daniel; Harrison G. Daniel; former President Truman; and Thomas W. Daniel.  From: Dr. Voss.

title: Portrait of Karl Bendetsen
Scopenote: Karl R. Bendetsen, General counsel, Department of the Army, 1949; Assistant Secretary of the Army, 1950-52; Under Secretary of the Army, 1952.

title: Truman with grandchildren in Key West
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman walking through Key West with his grandchildren and son-in-law. From left to right: William W. Daniel; former President Truman; Clifton Truman Daniel; Harrison G. Daniel (partly obscured); Thomas W. Daniel; and E. Clifton Daniel.  From: Dr. Voss.

title: Funeral of former President Truman
Scopenote: Honor Guard around casket of former President Harry S. Truman in lobby of the Truman Library.

title: Harry and Bess Truman Wedding Party
Scopenote: Wedding party of Mr. and Mrs. Harry S. Truman in the yard at 219 North Delaware in Independence, Missouri.  From left to right: Helen Wallace; Harry S. Truman; Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman; Louise Wells  Hull (Mrs. Lee Hull).  Back row: Ted Marks; Frank Wallace.

title: Harry and Bess Truman Wedding Photo
Scopenote: Wedding photo of Harry S. and Bess Wallace Truman. They are in the backyard of the home of Bess' family at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri.

title: Truman Family Arriving for President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Inauguration
Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman (center), his wife Bess Wallace Truman (right), and daughter Margaret Truman arrive at the White House on Inauguration Day. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Roosevelt delivering Inaugural address
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivering his fourth Inaugural address from the White House.

title: Henry Wallace at Truman's swearing-in
Scopenote: Vice President Henry Wallace witnessing the swearing-in of Harry S. Truman as his successor (Truman obscured).

title: Crowd at 1945 Inauguration
Scopenote: View of the crowds on had to witness the fourth Inauguration of President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Lincoln's birthday celebration at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Lincoln's birthday, attended by Vice-President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman at Lincoln celebration
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (left) with unidentified others at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Lincoln's birthday.

title: Truman at Lincoln's birthday celebration
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (second from left) with unidentified others at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Lincoln's birthday.

title: Truman at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (left) with unidentified others at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Lincoln's birthday.

title: Birthday celebration at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Lincoln's birthday, attended by Vice-President Harry S. Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman taking the oath of office
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman taking the oath of office at the White House after the death of President Roosevelt. From left to right: Frances Perkins, Secretary of Labor; Henry Stimson, Secretary of War; Henry Wallace, Secretary of Commerce; Julius Krug, War Production Board Administrator; James Forrestal, Secretary of the Navy; Claude Wickard, Secretary of Agriculture; Francis McNamee, Department Chairman, War Manpower Commission; Francis Biddle, Attorney General; Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of the Treasury; Harry S. Truman; Edward Stettinius, Secretary of State; Bess Wallace Truman; Harlan Stone, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court; Sam Rayburn, Speaker of the House; Fred Vinson, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; Representative Joseph Martin, House Minority Leader; Representative Robert Ramspeck, House Democratic Whip; Representative John McCormack, House Majority Leader.

title: Men gathered outside of White House after Roosevelt's death
Scopenote: Gathering of unidentified persons outside the White House shortly after the death of President Roosevelt.

title: Hannegan and Vaughan after death of Roosevelt
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert Hannegan (third from left) and General Harry Vaughan (second from left) with unidentified others outside the White House shortly after the death of Franklin Roosevelt.

title: Perkins in car after the death of Roosevelt
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Frances Perkins in an automobile outside the White House after the death of Franklin Roosevelt.

title: Outside White House at Truman's oath of office
Scopenote: A crowd of people outside the White House around 7:09 P.M., the time President Harry S. Truman was sworn into office.

title: Martin leaving White House as Truman takes oath of office
Scopenote: Representative Joseph Martin, minority leader of the House of Representatives, leaving the White House around the time of Harry S. Truman's swearing in as President.

title: Stettinius leaving White House as Truman takes oath of office
Scopenote: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius leaving the White House at about the time of President Truman's swearing-in ceremony upon the death of President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Vice-President Harry S. Truman Preparing to Take Oath of Office
Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman is taking the oath of office, at 7:09 p.m., after the death of President Franklin D. Roosevelt. Bess and Margaret Truman are standing to the right of Mr. Truman.  Immediately behind Mr. Truman are (from left to right): Press Secretary Jonathan Daniels, Admiral William Leahy, Secretary of Agriculture Claude Wickard, unidentified man (mostly obscured), receptionist William Simmons, and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn.  All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified man arriving at Roosevelt's funeral service
Scopenote: Unidentified man enters the White House during the funeral ceremony for Franklin Roosevelt.

title: President Truman and Anna Roosevelt at Union Station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Anna Roosevelt, President Roosevelt's daughter, (foreground) at Union Station in Washington, D.C., after the funeral services at the White House for Franklin D. Roosevelt. Harry Vaughan is standing behind Truman to Truman's left. Others are unidentified.

title: Byrnes, Truman and Wallace at Roosevelt's funeral
Scopenote: From left to right: James Byrnes, President Harry S. Truman, and Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace at Franklin Roosevelt's funeral service.

title: Roosevelt's burial site at funeral
Scopenote: The funeral ceremony for Franklin Roosevelt at the burial site in Hyde Park, New York. President Harry S. Truman is on the left in the background, holding his hat in his hand.  Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right) and her daughter Anna Roosevelt are the two ladies in black in the foreground.  All others are unidentified.

title: Roosevelt's casket being transferred
Scopenote: Pall bearers put the casket of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt into a hearse during his funeral ceremony.

title: President Truman announcing victory in Europe
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman gives his radio address announcing victory in Europe over the Germans.

title: Truman announcing end of World War II
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at a desk before a microphone announcing the end of World War II in Europe. An unidentified photographer in the foreground is taking his picture.

title: Truman announcing the end of World War II
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at a desk smiling at an unidentified assistant at the time of his announcement of the end of World War II in Europe.

title: Truman announcing end of World War II
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at a desk before a microphone announcing the end of World War II in Europe.

title: Truman announcing end of World War II
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at a desk, lights on, cameras rolling, announcing that World War II in Europe has ended.

title: Crowd at White House awaiting announcement of end of World War II
Scopenote: A small crowd of reporters and others in the White House, their hats and coats piled on a table, gathered for the occasion of the announcement by President Harry S. Truman of the end of World War II in Europe. All are unidentified.

title: U.S. and Iraqi representatives standing on porch of White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right), Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (front row, left), and representatives of the government of the United States and Iraq, standing on the porch in front of the White House.  In second row are Major General Harry Vaughan and Captain James K. Vardaman.  Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is in the third row, fourth from the right.  Lieutenant George Elsey is next to the door on the right.  All others are unidentified.

title: Cabinet officers and others during Prince Abd al-Ilah's visit
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Attorney General Francis Biddle, and unidentified standing in front of the White House during ceremonies surrounding the visit to the United States of Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah during his U.S. visit
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (front row, left) and other unidentified representatives of the government of Iraq during the prince's visit to the United States.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah's visit to the U.S
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (second from right) and other unidentified representatives of the government of Iraq during the prince's visit to the United States. Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is fourth from the left. The prince and his party are probably in the garden at George Washington's home in Mt. Vernon, Virginia.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah in front of Mt. Vernon
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (fourth from the right) and representatives of the governments of the United States and Iraq, standing in front of George Washington's home at Mt. Vernon, Virginia. Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is in the front row, third from the right.  All others are unidentified.

title: Truman, Prince Abd al-Ilah, and others in front of the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right), Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (front row, left), and representatives of the government of the United States and Iraq, standing on the porch in front of the White House.  In second row are Major General Harry Vaughan and Captain James K. Vardaman.  Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is in the third row, fourth from the right.  Lieutenant George Elsey is next to the door on the right.  All others are unidentified.

title: Ickes, Wallace, and others in front of the White House during Prince Abd al-Ilah's visit
Scopenote: From left, unidentified man, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, and Attorney General Francis Biddle standing in front of the White House during ceremonies marking the visit of Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq to the United States.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah laying a wreath at a Washington, D.C. monument
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq laying a wreath before a monument in Washington, D.C.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah shaking hands with an officer
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (left) shakes hands with an unidentified American officer during his visit to the United States.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah signing a guest book
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (left) signing a guest book during his visit to the United States. The other man in the photo is unidentified.

title: Truman, Prince Abd al-Ilah, and others in front of the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right), Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (front row, left), and representatives of the government of the United States and Iraq, standing on the porch in front of the White House.  In second row at left is Captain James K. Vardaman.  Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is in the third row, fourth from the right.  Lieutenant George Elsey is next to the door on the right.  All others are unidentified.

title: Cabinet officers in front of the White House during Prince Abd al-Ilah's visit
Scopenote: Front row, from left to right, unidentified man, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Attorney General Francis Biddle, Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace, standing in front of the White House during ceremonies marking the visit to the United States of Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq. Others are unidentified.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah in front of Mt. Vernon
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (right) and Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes (left) in front of George Washington's home at Mt. Vernon, Virginia. Others are unidentified.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah exiting Mt. Vernon
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq, walking out the door of George Washington's home at Mt. Vernon, Virginia. Others are unidentified.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah walking down the steps of Blair House
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (left) and two other unidentified men, walking down the steps of Blair House.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah walking into a garden area at Mt. Vernon
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (left) and an American officer walking into a garden area, probably at George Washington's home at Mt. Vernon, Virginia. Others are unidentified.

title: Prince Abd al-Ilah at Mt. Vernon
Scopenote: Prince Abd al-Ilah of Iraq (fourth from the right) and representatives of the governments of the United States and Iraq standing in front of George Washington's home at Mt. Vernon, Virginia. Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes is third from the left.  All others are unidentified.

title: Christening by Bess Truman of airplanes
Scopenote: Two airplanes and a crowd gathered for the christening of the airplanes by First Lady Bess W. Truman.

title: Airplanes and speakers platform during christening ceremony performed by Bess Truman
Scopenote: View of two airplanes and speakers platform during the christening ceremony for the airplanes. First Lady Bess W. Truman performed the christening.

title: Bess Truman christening airplanes
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (left), accompanied by Margaret Truman (right), christens an airplane. Mrs. Truman is swinging a champagne bottle. Others in background are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman christening airplanes
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (partly obscured by microphone) christening a Naval Air Transport Service airplane. A view from the side. Standing behind Mrs. Truman is Lieutenant George Elsey.  Others are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman hold bouquets during the christening of airplanes
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (foreground, third from right) and Margaret Truman (foreground, second from right) hold bouquets during the christening ceremony for two airplanes. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman Christening an Airplane
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) christens an airplane with a bottle of champagne. Her daughter Margaret Truman is beside her. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman during christening ceremony
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second from left), Margaret Truman (right) and another unidentified woman, standing with bouquets during the christening ceremony for two Naval airplanes.

title: Crowd assembled for the christening of airplanes by Bess Truman
Scopenote: Two airplanes and a crowd assembled for the christening of two Naval airplanes by First Lady Bess Truman.

title: General and Mrs. Eisenhower
Scopenote: Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower and General Dwight Eisenhower exiting a plane.  They have arrived in Washington, D. C.

title: Eisenhower, Mrs. Eisenhower, and Marshall at the airport
Scopenote: From left to right in foreground, General Dwight D. Eisenhower and Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower, with the General George C. Marshall, at the airport in Washington. Others are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower and Marshall at an airport in Washington
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) sitting in the back of a jeep with General George C. Marshall (right), waving to spectators at the airport in Washington. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowds along a Washington street welcoming Eisenhower
Scopenote: Crowds gathered along a Washington, D.C. street to welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower to the nation's capital upon his victorious return from World War II.

title: War Bond Commandos welcoming Eisenhower
Scopenote: A group of young women, identified as "War Bond Commandos," gathered along a Washington, D.C. street to welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower home from Europe. All are unidentified.

title: Crowds welcoming Eisenhower
Scopenote: Police holding back crowds gathered along a Washington, D.C. street to welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower home from Europe.

title: Eisenhower in jeep saluting crowds in Washington
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower standing up in the back of his jeep, saluting flag-waving crowds along a Washington, D.C. street. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower cheered by crowds
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower standing in the back of his jeep, surrounded by photographers and a cheering crowd as he is making his way down the parade route in Washington, D.C. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower on platform surrounded by crowd
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (back towards the camera) approaching a speaker's platform just outside a Washington, D.C. building as he is surrounded by a cheering crowd.

title: Crowd gathered to welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: Large crowd gathered outside the Willard Hotel in Washington, D.C. to welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower home from Europe.

title: Crowd gathered to welcome Eisenhower
Scopenote: Picture of large crowd gathered along a Washington, D.C. street to cheer and welcome General Dwight D. Eisenhower back from Europe.

title: Truman reading citation for medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) accompanied by General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) and Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (left) as he reads the citation for the General's Distinguished Service Medal.

title: Truman pinning Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) pinning General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) with the Distinguished Service Medal, before a cheering crowd in Washington, D.C. Standing next to President Truman on the left is Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman decorating Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) decorates General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) with the Distinguished Service Medal, as Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (left) and the crowd observe.

title: Truman shaking hands with Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shaking hands with General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) after decorating him with the Distinguished Service Medal. Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (left) and a cheering crowd observe.

title: Eisenhower wearing the Distinguished Service Medal
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower wearing the Distinguished Service Medal in front of a group of spectators. Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower is at the extreme left. Others are unidentified.

title: The Eisenhowers smiling in a limousine
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower and Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower smiling in the back of a limousine after the General received the Distinguished Service Medal in Washington, D.C.

title: Eisenhower in the Washington airport
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (second from left) with a group of unidentified persons, probably at the Washington, D.C. airport.

title: Eisenhower and son boarding an airplane
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (left), accompanied by his son, John S. D. Eisenhower, wave to a crowd as they prepare to board an Army airplane.

title: Crowd reacts to Eisenhower's arrival
Scopenote: Unidentified Army officers and other civilians on the speaker's platform react to General Dwight D. Eisenhower's arrival. This event took place during the welcoming parade in Washington, D.C. for General Eisenhower upon his return from Europe.

title: Eisenhower and Marshall with wives at Washington airport
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower talking to General George C. Marshall at the Washington airport, with their wives beside them. In center, from left to right: Mrs. Katherine Marshall, General Marshall, General Eisenhower, and Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower. Others are unidentified.

title: The Eisenhowers and Marshall at Washington airport
Scopenote: Foreground, from left to right: General Dwight D. Eisenhower, his wife Mamie, and General George C. Marshall at the Washington, D.C. airport.

title: Eisenhower and Marshall waving to the crowd
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) and General George C. Marshall (right) in the back of a jeep, waving to the crowd at the Washington, D.C. airport. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman shaking hands with Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shaking hands with General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) after awarding him the Distinguished Service Medal. Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (left) and the crowd observe the ceremony.

title: Truman reading citation before awarding Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) reading the citation for General Dwight D. Eisenhower's Distinguished Service Medal, while the General (right) and Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (left) look on. Others in the crowd are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower at Washington airport
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (third from left) and several unidentified individuals at the Washington, D.C. airport. The man second from the right may be Under Secretary of State Joseph Grew.

title: Truman shaking hands with Eisenhower at airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) at the Washington, D.C. airport. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower chatting at the airport
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (center) talking with unidentified persons at the Washington, D.C. airport. The man on the right may be Under Secretary of State Joseph Grew.

title: President Truman and General Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) at National Airport preparing to leave for a trip to the West coast of the United States.  With him is General Dwight Eisenhower (right). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman waving hat from airplane steps
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat at spectators in the National Airport in Washington, as he is about to board an Army airplane for his trip to the West Coast of the United States.

title: Truman meets with cabinet members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with several members of his Cabinet at the White House. From left to right: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes; the President; Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: Anderson arriving at Cabinet meeting
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting.

title: Truman with Cabinet members and others
Scopenote: Cabinet meeting at the White House. From left to right, around the table: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; John Blandford, Jr. of the National Housing Agency; Julius Krug of the War Production Board; John Snyder of the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; William H. Davis of the Office of Economic Stabilization; Leo T. Crowley of the Foreign Economic Administration; Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace; Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; Secretary of State James F. Byrnes; and the President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman and Cabinet meeting
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with Cabinet members in the White House. From left to right: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; Secretary of State James Byrnes; the President; Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.

title: Cabinet members exiting the White House
Scopenote: Government officials exiting the White House after a Cabinet meeting. From left to right: Julius Krug of the War Production Board; Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas; and an unidentified man.

title: Forrestal arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting. The cameraman is unidentified.

title: Stimson arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry Stimson arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Hannegan arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting.

title: Wallace arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting.

title: Truman Cabinet meeting at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with the Cabinet and other members of the administration at the White House. From left to right around the table: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach; National Housing Agency Chairman John B. Blandford, Jr.; War Production Board Chairman Julius Krug; War Mobilization Director John W. Snyder; Office of Economic Stabilization Director William H. Davis; Foreign Economics Administrator Leo Crowley; Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace; Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; Secretary of State James Byrnes; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson; Attorney General Tom Clark; Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.

title: Schwellenbach arriving at the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach arrives at the White House for a Cabinet meeting.

title: Stimson outside of the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry Stimson outside the White House, either arriving for or departing from a Cabinet meeting.

title: Cabinet meeting
Scopenote: Cabinet members and other government officials at a meeting with President Harry S. Truman (not pictured). From left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; John Blandford, Jr. of the National Housing Agency; Julius Krug of the War Production Board; John Snyder of the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; William H. Davis, Office of Economic Stabilization; Leo T. Crowley, Foreign Economic Administration; Secretary of Commerce Henry A. Wallace; Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; and Secretary of State James F. Byrnes.

title: Cameramen in the White House
Scopenote: Cameramen and sound technicians in the White House, photographing a meeting between President Harry S. Truman and members of his Cabinet and administration. All are unidentified.

title: Cameramen in the White House
Scopenote: Cameramen and sound technicians in the White House, photographing a meeting between President Harry S. Truman and members of his Cabinet and administration. All are unidentified.

title: Forrestal leaving the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal leaves the White House after a Cabinet meeting.

title: Byrnes leaving the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes leaves the White House after a Cabinet meeting.

title: Government officials at Cabinet meeting
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in a meeting. From left to right: Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas (partially obscured); Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; Secretary of State James Byrnes; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury Fred M. Vinson; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.

title: Stimson leaving the White House
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry Stimson (right) leaves the White House after a Cabinet meeting. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Unidentified individuals outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Several unidentified individuals outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Announcement of Japanese Surrender
Scopenote: Two unidentified men are standing outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Announcement of the Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Two unidentified men outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Barkley and unidentified man leaving the White House
Scopenote: Senator Alben Barkley (right) and an unidentified man are leaving the White House after Japan announced that it would surrender, thus ending World War II.

title: Reporter interviewing unidentified man outside White House
Scopenote: A reporter interviewing an unidentified man outside the White House after finding out that Japan had just announced its surrender, thus ending World War II.

title: Reporter and two unidentified men outside the White House
Scopenote: A reporter and two unidentified men outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Clark and two unidentified men outside the White House
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom Clark (left) and two unidentified men outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Legislators and Others Outside the White House
Scopenote: Senator Elbert Thomas (right, bow tie) and Congressman Andrew J. May (center) stand outside the White House with a group of unidentified reporters on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Duke of Windsor at White House for Japanese Surrender Announcement
Scopenote: The Duke of Windsor (left) and British diplomat Sir John Balfour outside the White House on the occasion of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Duke of Windsor at White House for Announcement of Japanese Surrender
Scopenote: The Duke of Windsor (left) and British diplomat Sir John Balfour arriving at the White House on the date of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Media at White House for announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Cameramen and sound technicians at the White House on the date of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II. All are unidentified.

title: Crowd gathered in White House for announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Unidentified persons milling around in White House on the date of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Byrnes outside White House for the announcement of the Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and an unidentified man outside the White House on the date of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Truman reading announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at desk) reads the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II to various reporters and officials in the Oval Office. Seated on the sofa in the background are (left to right): Reathel Odum, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Samuel Rosenman, and John Snyder.  Seated behind President Truman is Secretary of State James Byrnes. Standing behind President Truman at the window is Attorney General Tom Clark (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg (right). Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Announcing Surrender of Japan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman announcing the surrender of Japan, ending World War II, to assembled reporters in the Oval Office. Seated behind President Truman are John Snyder, Admiral William D. Leahy, and Secretary of State James Byrnes.

title: Truman Reading Announcement of Japanese Surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at desk) reads the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II to various reporters and officials in the Oval Office.  Seated on the sofa in the background are (left to right): Reathel Odum, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Samuel Rosenman, and John Snyder.  Seated behind President Truman is Secretary of State James Byrnes. Standing behind President Truman at the window is Attorney General Tom Clark (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg (right). Others are unidentified.

title: Reporters upon hearing the announcement of the Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Reporters running in the White House after hearing the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Reporters running in White House upon news of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Reporters running through the White House upon the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II. The young woman by the table is Mildred Wilson, secretary to Charles Ross.

title: Reporters grabbing press releases for Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Reporters scramble for press releases announcing the Japanese surrender ending World War II. Mildred Wilson is the young woman on the table handing out releases.

title: Reporters on phones after announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Reporters on telephones transmitting news of the Japanese surrender ending World War II. All are unidentified.

title: Crowd outside the White House after the announcement of the Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Scenes around the White House showing crowds and reporters receiving news of the surrender of Japan, ending World War II.

title: Crowd outside White House upon announcement of Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Crowd of spectators in Lafayette Park, north of the White House (those in uniform saluting) on the date of the announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: Crowd outside White House celebrating Japanese surrender
Scopenote: Crowd pressing against the gates of the White House on the date of announcement of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: President and Mrs. Truman greeting crowd upon Japanese surrender announcement
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman greet the crowd outside the White House on the occasion of the Japanese surrender ending World War II.

title: President Truman with government officials
Scopenote: From left to right: President Harry S. Truman, General George C. Marshall, Secretary of State James  F. Byrnes, and General Henry "Hap" Arnold after President Truman awarded Byrnes a Distinguished Service Medal.

title: Truman awarding Byrnes with Distinguished Service Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman awarding the Distinguished Service Medal to Secretary of State James Byrnes in the Rose Garden at the White House. From left to right: General George C. Marshall; General Henry "Hap" Arnold; the President; Secretary Byrnes; his wife, Maude Byrnes; John Snyder of the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; and General Harry Vaughan, the President's Military Aide.

title: Truman presents Byrnes with Distinguished Service Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman awarding Secretary of State James F. Byrnes the Distinguished Service Medal in the Rose Garden at the White House.  From left to right are: General George Marshall, General Henry Arnold, President Truman, Secretary Byrnes, Mrs. Maude Byrnes, John Snyder, and General Harry Vaughan.

title: Truman reads citation in honor of Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reading the citation for Secretary James F. Byrnes's Distinguished Service Medal. From left to right: General George Marshall; the President; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; the Secretary; Mrs. Maude Byrnes; John Snyder; and General Harry Vaughan (partially obscured).

title: Truman reads citation in honor of Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reading the citation for Secretary of State James F. Byrnes' Distinguished Service Medal. From left to right:  General George C. Marshall, General Henry Arnold President Truman, Admiral William D. Leahy, Secretary Byrnes, Mrs. Byrnes, John Snyder, and General Harry Vaughan.

title: Truman and DeGaulle attend welcoming ceremonies for French visit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, right) and General Charles De Gaulle (front, left) attend the welcoming ceremonies for the French leader on the White House lawn while officers salute in the background. Behind General De Gaulle (mostly obscured) is Admiral William Leahy; second from the right in the second row is Major General Harry Vaughan; others are unidentified.

title: Truman and De Gaulle at ceremonies for French visit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, right) and General Charles de Gaulle (front, left) attend the welcoming ceremonies for the visit of the French General on the front lawn of the White House. In the row behind Truman and de Gaulle are: Admiral William Leahy; unidentified; Major General Harry Vaughan; and unidentified.  Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Truman and De Gaulle stand at attention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, right, and French President Charles De Gaulle, left, stand at attention during the welcoming ceremonies for the French visit to the White House. Behind President Truman is Admiral William Leahy. Others are unidentified.

title: Color guard and troops help with welcoming ceremonies
Scopenote: Color guard and troops participating in welcoming ceremonies for the visit of French General Charles de Gaulle, on the south grounds of the White House. All are unidentified.

title: Truman decorates World War II veterans in White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing in front with a veteran) decorating one of twenty-eight servicemen who received Medals of Honor in a ceremony in the East Room of the White House. First Lieutenant Cecil H. Bolton is seated far left, front row. Behind President Truman at the table with the medals is Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: Dignitaries at Medal of Honor presentation
Scopenote: Dignitaries at Medal of Honor presentation ceremony at the White House: (front row, from left to right) Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; unidentified man; General George C. Marshall; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; General Henry "Hap" Arnold. Behind General Arnold is General Omar Bradley.  Others are unidentified.

title: Truman decorating soldier with Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman decorating a soldier during a Medal of Honor presentation ceremony in the East Room of the White House, as other recipients and guests look on. In the background, standing directly in front of the candelabra, is Press Secretary Charles Ross. Standing in front of the flag, leaning over the table of medals is Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: Truman shakes hands with Medal of Honor recipient
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes the hand of a Medal of Honor recipient in a wheelchair while other recipients and guests look on. First Lieutenant Cecil H. Bolton is seated second from left, front row.

title: Truman stands with Medal of Honor recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, center) posing with some of the twenty-eight recipients of the Medal of Honor who were decorated at a ceremony in the East Room of the White House.

title: Truman gives Medal of Honor to World War II veteran
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, standing with veteran) decorating a soldier with the Medal of Honor during a ceremony in the East Room of the White House, as other recipients and photographers look on. First Lieutenant Cecil H. Bolton is seated second from left, front row. Major General Harry Vaughan is standing in front of the flag with the remaining medals.

title: Truman decorates World War II veteran with Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, standing with veteran) decorating a soldier with the Medal of Honor during a ceremony in the East Room of the White House, as other recipients and photographers look on. First Lieutenant Cecil H. Bolton, seated second from left, front row.

title: Dignitaries applauding during Medal of Honor ceremony
Scopenote: Dignitaries applauding during Medal of Honor presentation ceremony in the East Room of the White House: (front row, from left to right) Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; unidentified man; General George C. Marshall; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; and General Henry "Hap" Arnold. Behind General Arnold is General Omar Bradley. Others are unidentified.

title: Dignitaries applauding during Medal of Honor ceremonies
Scopenote: Dignitaries applauding during Medal of Honor presentation ceremony in the East Room of the White House: (front row, from left to right) Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; unidentified man; General George C. Marshall; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; General Henry "Hap" Arnold. Behind General Arnold is General Omar Bradley.

title: Nimitz and family on way to reception
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (third from right) and his family, taken on the occasion of the celebration held in Washington, D.C. to welcome Admiral Nimitz home from World War II.

title: Nimitz and family at airport
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (second from left) along with his wife, Catherine (right) and his family, taken on the occasion of the celebration held in Washington, D.C., to welcome Admiral Nimitz home from World War II.

title: Nimitz and family at Washington, D.C. airport
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (center), his wife Catherine (right) and his family at the airport in Washington, D.C. They are in Washington to attend a celebration welcoming Admiral Nimitz home from World War II. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Nimitz and family in limousine
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz, his wife Catherine (back seat, right) and his family in a limousine for their motorcade through Washington, D.C.

title: Nimitz passes spectators in front of Capitol building
Scopenote: Limousine carrying Admiral Chester Nimitz (back seat, left) passes a large crowd of applauding spectators at the United States Capitol. They are celebrating Admiral Nimitz's return from World War II.

title: Troops march past Capitol building
Scopenote: Troops marching past U.S. Capitol during ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz and his return from World War II.

title: Military band marches in front of Capitol building
Scopenote: Military band marching past the U.S. Capitol during ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Troops marching by Capitol building
Scopenote: Troops marching by the U.S. Capitol during ceremonies honoring the homecoming of Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Color guard and troops march past Capitol building
Scopenote: Color guard and troops marching by the U.S. Capitol during ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Crowd assembled to honor Admiral Nimitz
Scopenote: Crowd assembled on Washington Mall for ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Battleship mock-up set in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Battleship mock-up set up as a backdrop for ceremonies in Washington, D.C. honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Battleship mock-up and assembled crowds
Scopenote: Battleship mock-up and crowds assembled for ceremony honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Family of Nimitz seated on speaker's platform
Scopenote: Family of Admiral Chester Nimitz, including his wife Catherine (left), seated on speaker's platform in front of mock-up of battleship on the Mall in Washington, D.C. They are attending a ceremony honoring Admiral Nimitz and his return from World War II.

title: Nimitz seated in back of limousine
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz seated in the back of a limousine, driving by a vast crowd, with the Washington Monument in the background. He is arriving for a ceremony honoring his return from World War II.

title: Nimitz arrives on speaker's platform
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (right) arriving on speaker's platform, to the applause of dignitaries. He is attending a ceremony on the Mall in Washington, D.C., honoring his return from World War II.

title: Crowd assembled for Nimitz ceremonies
Scopenote: Vast crowd assembled around the Washington Monument for ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz.

title: Nimitz on the speaker's platform
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (third from left) shakes hands with an unidentified dignitary on the speaker's platform in front of a model battleship with his wife, Catherine Nimitz (center) looking on at ceremonies on the mall in Washington, D.C.  honoring the Admiral.

title: Nimitz on the speaker's platform
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (third from left) waving his hat to the crowd from the speaker's platform in front of a model battleship with his wife, Catherine Nimitz (center) and an unidentified person. They are attending an event on the Mall in Washington, D.C., honoring Nimtiz's return to the United States from World War II.

title: Troops marching at the ceremonies honoring Nimitz
Scopenote: Troops marching past the model battleship at the ceremonies held in honor of the return of Admiral Chester Nimitz after World War II.

title: Nimitz on the speaker's platform
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (right) with his wife, Catherine Nimitz, (center) and an unidentified person standing on the speaker's platform in front of a model battleship during ceremonies honoring Nimitz. The ceremony took place on the National Mall in Washington, D.C.

title: U.S. Navy band marching at ceremonies honoring Nimitz
Scopenote: The U.S. Navy band marching at ceremonies held in honor of Admiral Chester Nimitz on the Mall in Washington, D.C.

title: Troops marching at ceremonies honoring Nimitz
Scopenote: Troops marching past the speaker's platform at ceremonies honoring Admiral Chester Nimitz held in Washington, D.C.

title: Troops marching at ceremonies honoring Nimitz
Scopenote: Troops marching past the speaker's platform at ceremonies held in honor of Admiral Chester Nimitz on the Mall in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman and Nimitz in the Rose Garden at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left foreground) and Admiral Chester Nimitz (foreground, second from left) entering the Rose Garden at the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman awarding Nimitz a medal in the Rose Garden of the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left foreground) giving Admiral Chester Nimitz (right foreground) a Gold Star (in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal) in the Rose Garden of the White House.  Mrs. Catherine Nimitz (between Truman and Nimitz), Margaret Truman (third from right, background), and several unidentified people look on.

title: Truman shaking hands with Nimitz after decorating him in the Rose Garden of the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left foreground) shaking hands with Admiral Chester Nimitz (right foreground) after decorating him with a Gold Star (in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal) in the Rose Garden of the White House.  Looking on are Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (third from left, in second row), General George C. Marshall (fourth from left), Mrs. Catherine Nimitz (between Truman and Nimitz), Margaret Truman (third from right) and others.

title: Nimitz speaking in the Rose Garden of the White House
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (right foreground) speaking in the Rose Garden of the White House with President Harry S. Truman (left foreground), during a presentation of a Gold Star (in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal) to Nimitz. Others looking on include the Secretary of the Navy, James Forrestal (third from the left, second row); General George C. Marshall (fourth from left); Mrs. Catherine Nimitz (between Truman and Admiral Nimitz); Margaret Truman (fourth from right, in background); other members of the Nimitz family and other unidentified officials.

title: Truman reading the citation for Nimitz's medal
Scopenote: Admiral Chester Nimitz (right foreground) speaking in the Rose Garden of the White House with President Harry S. Truman (left foreground), during a presentation of a Gold Star (in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal) to Nimitz. Others looking on include the Secretary of the Navy, James Forrestal (third from the left, second row); General George C. Marshall (fourth from left); Mrs. Catherine Nimitz (between Truman and Admiral Nimitz); Margaret Truman (fourth from right, in background); other members of the Nimitz family and other unidentified officials.

title: Truman shaking hands with Nimitz after presenting him with a medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) shaking hands with Admiral Chester Nimitz (second from right) after presenting him with a Gold Star (in lieu of a third Distinguished Service Medal) in the Rose Garden of the White House, as Mrs. Catherine Nimitz (between Truman and Nimitz) and others look on.

title: Rios, Truman, and others during welcoming ceremonies for Rios
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (left foreground), President Harry S. Truman (right foreground), and others standing at attention during welcoming ceremonies for Rios at the White House. On the far left is President Truman's military aide, Major General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: Rios and Truman at the welcoming ceremonies for Rios
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios (front row, left) of Chile, President Harry S. Truman (front row, right), and others standing at attention during the welcoming ceremonies for Rios at the White House. Truman's Naval Aide, Captain James Vardaman is behind Truman; Secretary of State James Byrnes can be seen in the background between President Rios and President Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: Rios with others at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (seventh from left, front row) with unidentified military officers and dignitaries outside Mount Vernon, George Washington's home.

title: Rios signing a guest book, probably at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (seated) signing a guest book, probably at Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington, during the course of his visit to the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Rios at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (left foreground) standing at attention at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Others are unidentified.

title: Rios signing a guest book, probably at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (seated) signing a guest book, probably at Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington. Others are unidentified.

title: Rios and others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (second from left) and others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington, during Rios' visit to the United States. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Rios and others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (second from right in foreground) and unidentified others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington.

title: Rios placing a wreath on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (right) placing a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Solider in Arlington National Cemetery, as a Chilean Army officer looks on.

title: Rios and others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (third from right) and unidentified others touring the grounds of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington, during President Rios' trip to the United States.

title: Rios and others at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (fourth from right) with other unidentified dignitaries in the doorway of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington.

title: Rios and others in front of Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (eighth from right, front row) with other unidentified military officers and dignitaries in front of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington.

title: Color guard and troops at the White House during Rios' visit to America
Scopenote: Color guard and troops on the lawn of the White House during the welcoming ceremonies for President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile.

title: Cabinet members outside the White House during Rios' visit to the United States
Scopenote: Officials of the Truman administration outside the White House on the occasion of welcoming President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile to the United States.  From left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, and (maybe?) John Blandford, Jr. of the National Housing Agency.

title: Cabinet officials outside the White House during Rios' visit to the United States
Scopenote: Truman administration officials outside the White House on the occasion of welcoming President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile to the United States.  From left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, (maybe?) John Blandford, Jr. of the National Housing Agency, and Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace.

title: Truman, Rios, and others during Rios' visit to America
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) and President Juan Antonio Rios of Chile (front row, left), stand at attention during welcoming ceremonies for Rios. President Truman's military aide, Harry Vaughan, is on the far left. Captain James Vardaman is in the second row behind Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: Halifax waiting for Attlee to arrive in Washington
Scopenote: Lord Halifax, British Ambassador to the United States (left), with an unidentified military officer waiting for the arrival of British Prime Minister Clement Attlee at the National Airport in Washington, D.C.

title: Attlee arriving in Washington
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (right) disembarking from his aircraft at the National Airport in Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Attlee shaking hands with Byrnes after arriving in Washington
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (foreground, third from right) shaking hands with Secretary of State James Byrnes (foreground, second from right) after arriving at the National Airport in Washington, D.C. On the right is President Harry S. Truman's military aide, Harry Vaughan. Directly behind Mr. Attlee is the British Ambassador to the United States, Lord Halifax. Others are unidentified.

title: Attlee in car after arrival in Washington
Scopenote: From left: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee, Secretary of State James Byrnes, and British Ambassador Lord Halifax in the back of a limousine after Attlee's arrival at the National Airport in Washington, D.C.

title: Attlee and Byrnes shaking hands after Attlee's arrival in Washington
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (third from right foreground) shaking hands with Secretary of State James Byrnes (foreground, second from right) after arriving at the National Airport in Washington, D.C. In the right foreground is President Harry S. Truman's military aide, Harry Vaughan. In the foreground on the left is Lord Halifax, British Ambassador to the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman, Attlee, and King at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Front row, left to right: President Truman; British Prime Minister Clement Attlee; Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King. Second row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy (partly obscured by King). Third row, left to right: Lieutenant Clark Clifford and Secretary of State James Byrnes (partly obscured by Attlee). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman, Attlee, and King at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Front row, left to right: President Truman; British Prime Minister Clement Attlee; Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King. Second row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy. Third row, left to right: Lieutenant Clark Clifford and Secretary of State James Byrnes (obscured by Vaughan). Others are unidentified. Also present are Secretary of War Henry Stimson (second from left); Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (fifth from left); and British Ambassador to the United States Lord Halifax (sixth from left). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Laying a Wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Front row, left to right: President Truman; British Prime Minister Clement Attlee; Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King. Second row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy. Third row, left to right: Lieutenant Clark Clifford and Secretary of State James Byrnes (obscured by Vaughan). Others are unidentified. Also present are Secretary of War Henry Stimson (second from left); Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (fifth from left); and British Ambassador to the United States Lord Halifax (sixth from left). Others are unidentified.

title: Attlee laying a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier with Truman and others looking on
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (walking toward Tomb) laying a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Behind him are: President Harry S. Truman and Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King (front row, left to right); Major General Harry Vaughan and Admiral William Leahy (second row, left to right); Lieutenant Clark Clifford and Secretary of State James Byrnes (third row, left to right, Byrnes partly obscured); and British Ambassador Lord Halifax.

title: Truman, Attlee, and Others at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Front row, left to right: President Truman; British Prime Minister Clement Attlee; Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King. Second row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy. Third row, left to right: Lieutenant Clark Clifford and Secretary of State James Byrnes (obscured by Vaughan). Others are unidentified. Also present are Secretary of War Henry Stimson (second from left); Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (fifth from left); and British Ambassador to the United States Lord Halifax (sixth from left). Others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball with Hollywood celebrities
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second from the left of cake) and Margaret Truman (left of cake) cutting the cake at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball. Also present are Margaret O'Brien (in front of cake), Charles Coburn (front row, second from left), Gene Kelly (kneeling, left), Paul Henreid (third from right), Cesar Romero (kneeling, right), Alexis Smith (second from right), and other Hollywood celebrities.

title: Bess Truman cutting the cake at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball, with Hollywood celebrities looking on
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman cutting the cake at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball as various Hollywood celebrities look on. From left to right; three unidentified, Charles Coburn; Gene Kelly (kneeling); Margaret O'Brien (sitting on Gene Kelly's knee); unidentified; Mrs. Truman; Margaret Truman; unidentified; unidentified; Paul Henreid.

title: A large crowd at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball
Scopenote: A large crowd gathered at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball.

title: Bess Truman with Hollywood celebrities at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second left of cake) at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball with various Hollywood celebrities in attendance.  Charles Coburn is third from the left. Van Johnson is on the right of the cake, eating a piece of cake. Others are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman cutting the cake at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman and Margaret Truman cutting the cake at the Roosevelt Birthday Ball with Hollywood celebrities in attendance. From left to right: Margaret O'Brien, unidentified woman, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, unidentified man, unidentified man, Paul Henreid, Alexis Smith, Cesar Romero (kneeling), unidentified man, unidentified woman, Van Johnson (kneeling), unidentified woman.

title: The Truman family with various Hollywood celebrities in the East Room of the White House
Scopenote: Photograph of Hollywood celebrities posing with the Truman family in the East Room of the White House: (front row, left to right) Ilene Woods, Diana Lynn, Margaret Truman, Margaret O'Brien, President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Constance Moore, Dorothy Kilgallen, Eileen Barton; (second row, left to right) Jo Stafford, Eleanor Lambert, Angela Lansbury, Helen Sioussat, Eddie Bracken, Paul Henreid, Zachary Scott, Alexis Smith, Cesar Romero, Lucy Monroe, William Bendix, Reginald Gardiner, Sgt. Harvey Stone, Charles Coburn.

title: Truman speaking before awarding a medal to Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium) speaking in the Pentagon Court during a ceremony at which he awarded an Oak Leaf Cluster to the Distinguished Service Medal of the retiring Army Chief of Staff, General George C. Marshall (far right). Standing along the left are, from left to right: unidentified, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (second row), unidentified woman, and Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall.

title: Truman speaking before awarding a medal to Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaking in the Pentagon Court during a ceremony at which he awarded the retiring Army Chief of Staff, General George C. Marshall (right of Truman) an Oak Leaf Cluster to the Distinguished Service Medal. On the left are Secretary of State James Byrnes (second from left); Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (third from left) and Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall (fifth from left). On the right of Marshall, from left to right are Harry Vaughan, Admiral William D. Leahy, and Clark Clifford. Others are unidentified.

title: Marshall speaking at a ceremony where he received a medal from Truman
Scopenote: General George C. Marshall (at podium) speaking in the Pentagon Court during a ceremony at which he received an Oak Leaf Cluster for his Distinguished Service Medal from President Harry S. Truman. On the left is Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall (second woman from left). Seated behind Marshall is Secretary of War Henry Stimson (left) and President Truman (right). Seated on the right are Major General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William D. Leahy, and Clark Clifford. Marshall was retiring as Army Chief of Staff.

title: Truman shaking hands with Marshall after awarding him a medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left foreground) shaking hands with General George C. Marshall (right foreground) and presenting him with an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal in the Pentagon Court.  Marshall was retiring as Army Chief of Staff.

title: Truman shaking hands with Marshall after awarding him a medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left foreground) shaking hands with General George C. Marshall (right foreground) after awarding the General an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal on the occasion of the General's retirement as Army Chief of Staff.

title: Military officers at a ceremony in honor of Marshall
Scopenote: Admiral Edwin Halsey (left) and two unidentified military officers in the Pentagon Court at a ceremony where President Harry S. Truman presented retiring Army Chief of Staff General George C. Marshall with an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal.

title: A crowd at a ceremony where Truman awarded Marshall a medal
Scopenote: A crowd in the Pentagon Court during a ceremony where President Harry S. Truman awarded retiring Army Chief of Staff General George C. Marshall an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal.

title: Band and spectators at a ceremony where Truman awarded Marshall a medal
Scopenote: The military band and a group of spectators in the Pentagon Court on the occasion of President Harry S. Truman awarding retiring Army Chief of Staff General George C. Marshall an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal.

title: Truman speaking before awarding Marshall a medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaking to a crowd in the Pentagon Court at a ceremony in which he awarded an Oak Leaf Cluster to the Distinguished Service Medal of retiring Army Chief of Staff, General George C. Marshall. Standing on the left, from left to right, are: Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (in second row), unidentified woman, and Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall. Standing on the right of Truman, from left to right, are: General Marshall, Major General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Leahy, and Lieutenant Clark Clifford. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman shaking hands with Marshall and awarding him with a medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right center) shaking hands with retiring Army Chief of Staff General George C. Marshall (left center) and presenting him with an Oak Leaf Cluster to his Distinguished Service Medal in the Pentagon Court. The second woman from the left in the background is Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall.

title: A Boy Scout speaking at the lighting of the National Christmas Tree
Scopenote: An unidentified Boy Scout speaking at the ceremonial lighting of the National Community Christmas Tree on the grounds of the White House as President Harry S. Truman (seated, right) listens.

title: A crowd waiting for the lighting of the National Christmas Tree
Scopenote: A large crowd assembled on the South Lawn of the White House for the lighting of the National Community Christmas Tree.

title: Truman at the lighting of the National Christmas Tree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) on the occasion of the lighting of the National Community Christmas Tree on the grounds of the White House, flanked by several unidentified people and General Harry Vaughan, his Military Aide (behind the President's left shoulder).

title: A crowd and band waiting for the lighting of the National Christmas Tree

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) receiving a set of stamps honoring the late President Franklin D. title: Truman and Churchill at End of Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) waving his hat standing to the right of Winston Churchill flashing his famous "V for Victory" sign from the rear platform of a special Baltimore & Ohio train, evidently en route to Fulton, Missouri for Churchill's "Iron Curtain" speech, as the President's Military Aide, General Harry Vaughan, looks on.

title: Churchill visits the U.S
Scopenote: Former Prime Minister Winston Churchill (center, with cigar) soon after his arrival in the United States. He is in the United States for a speaking engagement at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri. Others are unidentified.

title: Churchill visits the U.S
Scopenote: Former Prime Minister Winston Churchill (left in back seat, with cigar) in the back of a limousine with members of his family, soon after his arrival in the United States. He traveled to the United States for a speaking engagement at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt and Julius Krug
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug at the dedication of the Franklin D. Roosevelt home in Hyde Park, New York as a national shrine.

title: President Truman speaking at the home of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) speaking at the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine. Seated behind President Truman are, from left to right: Marian Anderson, Reverend George Anthony, Newton B. Drury (Director of the National Park Service), Eleanor Roosevelt, Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and Admiral William D. Leahy. Standing behind Clark Clifford, next to the pillar is Franklin D. Roosevelt, Junior. Former President Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala is sitting on the ground next to Mrs. Roosevelt, his leash tied to the chair.

title: Crowds at the dedication of the Franklin D. Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Crowds of people attending the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine.

title: Julius Krug speaking at the home of former President Roosevelt
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug speaking the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine.  Seated behind Mr. Krug is President Harry S. Truman.  The man in the naval hat seated next to the pillar is Admiral William D. Leahy.

title: Julius Krug speaking at the home of former President Roosevelt
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug speaking the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine.  Seated behind Mr. Krug is President Harry S. Truman.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt speaking at the dedication of the home of Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (standing at podium) speaking at the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine. Seated behind her are, from left to right: Marian Anderson, Reverend George Anthony, National Park Service Director Newton B. Drury, Major General Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and Admiral William D. Leahy. Standing behind Clark Clifford, next to the pillar is Franklin D. Roosevelt, Junior. Former President Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala is sitting on the ground next to Mrs. Roosevelt's empty chair, his leash tied to the chair.

title: Julius Krug speaking at the dedication of the Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (standing at podium) speaking at the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine. Seated behind him are, from left to right: Marian Anderson (partly seen), Reverend George Anthony, National Park Service Director Newton B. Drury, former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Major General Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, and Admiral William D. Leahy. Standing behind Clark Clifford, next to the pillar is Franklin D. Roosevelt, Junior. Former President Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala is sitting on the ground next to Mrs. Roosevelt, his leash tied to the chair.

title: President Truman speaking at the home of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) speaking at the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine. Seated behind President Truman are, from left to right: Marian Anderson, Reverend George Anthony, National Park Service Director Newton B. Drury, Eleanor Roosevelt, Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and Admiral William D. Leahy. Standing behind Clark Clifford, next to the pillar is Franklin D. Roosevelt, Junior. Former President Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala is sitting on the ground next to Mrs. Roosevelt, his leash tied to the chair.

title: Mrs. Roosevelt leaving the dedication ceremony of the Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt leaving the ceremony dedicating her and the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt's home as a national shrine.  The man on the left is Reverend George W. Anthony. The man standing third from the left is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.  The African-American woman on the extreme left is the opera singer Marian Anderson.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt and Fala at the dedication of the Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right) attending the dedication of her and former President Franklin D. Roosevelt's home as a national shrine.  Seated at Mrs. Roosevelt's feet is former President's Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala.  The two men next to her are Reverend George Anthony (left) and Director of the National Park Service Newton B. Drury.

title: Henry Wallace and others at the dedication of the Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Secretary of Commerce and former Vice President Henry Wallace (third from the left) attending the dedication of the home of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine.  The other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Crowds of dignitaries and others at the dedication of the Roosevelt home
Scopenote: Crowds of dignitaries and others attending the dedication of the home of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine.

title: President Truman walking to the grave of former President Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in the dark suit, holding his hat) walking out to the grave of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt.  President Truman attended the dedication of the Roosevelt home as a national shrine.

title: President Truman and Eleanor Roosevelt at former President Roosevelt's gravesite

title: President Truman leaving the Franklin D. Roosevelt gravesite
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in the dark suit and coat, carrying his hat) leaving the gravesite of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt. title: President Truman and Eleanor Roosevelt at former President Roosevelt's gravesite
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt placing a wreath on the grave of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt.  Both of them attended the dedication of the Roosevelt home as a national shrine.

title: Mrs. Roosevelt attending the dedication of the Roosevelt home as a national shrine
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right) attending the dedication of her and former President Franklin D. Roosevelt's home as a national shrine.  From left to right is opera singer Marian Anderson, Reverend George W. Anthony, and National Park Service Director Newton B. Drury.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt speaking at the dedication of the home of Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (standing at podium) speaking at the dedication of the home of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt as a national shrine. Standing behind Clark Clifford, next to the pillar is Franklin D. Roosevelt, Junior. Former President Roosevelt's Scottish Terrier dog Fala is sitting on the ground next to Mrs. Roosevelt's empty chair, his leash tied to the chair.
