Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian suit and hat) shaking hands with a soldier as he reviews the military police of the District of Columbia, standing at attention on the Ellipse. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and military officers saluting
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian suit and hat) and military officers saluting as they walk past the color guard during the President's review of the District of Columbia military police on the Ellipse.

title: Truman and other dignitaries watching the military police
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and military dignitaries on the reviewing stand watching the District of Columbia military police. President Truman's military aide, Harry Vaughan, seated in the front row, second from right. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and other dignitaries saluting
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left), Secretary of War Robert Patterson (front row, second from left), and other unidentified dignitaries saluting during the President's review of the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, the Nisei (Japanese-American) regiment.

title: Truman and other dignitaries reviewing troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left, in long overcoat) and other dignitaries standing in the rain, reviewing the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, the Nisei (Japanese-American) regiment.

title: President Truman surveying Nisei troops
Scopenote: Four Nisei soldiers present the colors as President Harry S. Truman reviews their regiment. The Nisei were second-generation Japanese-Americans.  This is a review of the famous 442nd Regimental Combat Team.

title: President Truman surveys a Nisei regiment
Scopenote: President Truman reviews a group of soldiers from a Nisei Regiment. The Nisei were second-generation Japanese-Americans.  This is a review of the famous 442nd Regimental Combat Team.

title: Truman walking past troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walking past troops standing at attention during his review of the Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman decorating the 442nd Regimental Combat Team
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) decorating the colors of the Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team, as other dignitaries look on

title: 442nd Regimental Combat Team marching
Scopenote: The Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team marching past President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries as they are reviewed.

title: Truman speaking during his review
Scopenote: Dignitaries observe President Harry S. Truman speaking before a microphone during his review of the Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team.

title: Truman reviewing troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman accompanied by other dignitaries during their review of the Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team.

title: Japanese-American 442nd Regimental Combat Team passing in review
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, other dignitaries, and wounded soldiers in wheelchairs review the Nisei (Japanese-American) 442nd Regimental Combat Team.

title: Truman shaking hands with Mitscher
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Admiral Marc Mitscher (right), commander of the 8th Fleet and wartime commander of Task Force 58, during a ceremony taking place at the White House in which President Truman awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers for their heroic service during World War II.

title: Truman with officers from eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with eight U.S. Navy officers from eight aircraft carriers receiving Presidential Unit Citations for their heroic service during World War II (the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN). Officers are unidentified.

title: Truman posing on the White House lawn with Navy officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) on the White House lawn with eight United States Navy officers from eight aircraft carriers that received Presidential Unit Citations for their heroic service during World War II - the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN. Officers are unidentified.

title: Ceremony on the South Grounds of the White House
Scopenote: Ceremony on the South Grounds of the White House in which President Harry S. Truman awarded the Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers for their heroic service during World War II. The aircraft carriers were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN

title: Military band playing and troops standing at attention on the South Lawn of the White House
Scopenote: A military band playing and troops standing at attention on the South Lawn of the White House, with the Washington Monument in the background, during a ceremony at which President Truman awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN.

title: Truman shaking hands with Admiral Mitscher
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) on the White House lawn shaking hands with Admiral Marc Mitscher (right), commander of the 8th Fleet and wartime commander of Task Force 58, during a ceremony in which the President awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN.

title: Truman shaking hands with guests on the White House lawn
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shaking hands with guests on the White House lawn in a ceremony in which he presented Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman posing on the White House lawn with officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) posing on the White House lawn with eight U.S. Navy officers from eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers receiving Presidential Unit Citations for their heroic service during World War II. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Byrnes, Mrs. Byrnes, and Snyder at a White House ceremony
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes, Mrs. Maude Byrnes, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder at a White House ceremony in which President Harry S. Truman awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN.

title: Ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House
Scopenote: Ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House in which President Harry S. Truman awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers for their heroic service during World War II. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN.

title: Truman reading a citation during a ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reading a citation during a ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House in which he awarded Presidential Unit Citations to eight U.S. Navy aircraft carriers. The aircraft carriers honored were the BELLEAU WOOD, BUNKER HILL, CABOT, ESSEX, HORNET, LEXINGTON, SAN JACINTO, and YORKTOWN.

title: Byrnes makes a statement before boarding an airplane to attend the Paris Peace Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes making a statement as he prepares to board an airplane and depart for the Paris Peace Conference in which treaties ending World War II will be considered. President Harry S. Truman (back of platform, left) Senator Tom Connally of Texas (back of platform, right), and others observe.

title: Truman speaking at Paris Peace conference departure
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking at the airport ceremony marking the departure of Secretary of State James Byrnes for the Paris Peace Conference, as Secretary Byrnes (rear of platform, right), Senator Tom Connally (rear of platform, left) of Texas, and others look on. The Paris Peace Conference will consider treaties ending World War II.

title: Connally speaking at an airport ceremony
Scopenote: Senator Tom Connally of Texas speaking at an airport ceremony marking the departure of Secretary of State James Byrnes for the Paris Peace Conference, as Secretary Byrnes (back of platform) and others look on. The Paris Peace Conference will consider treaties ending World War II.

title: Vandenberg speaking at airport
Scopenote: Senator Arthur Vandenberg of Michigan speaking at the airport ceremony marking the departure of Secretary of State James Byrnes for the Paris Peace Conference, as President Truman, Senator Tom Connally of Texas, Secretary Byrnes (back of platform, left to right), and others look on. The Paris Peace Conference will consider treaties ending World War II.

title: Truman speaking prior to the departure of Secretary Byrnes for Paris
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking at the airport ceremony marking the departure of Secretary of State James Byrnes for the Paris Peace Conference, as Senator Tom Connally of Texas (rear of platform, left), Secretary Byrnes (rear of platform, right), and others observe.

title: Byrnes speaking at airport prior to his departure for Paris Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes speaking at the airport ceremony marking his departure for the Paris Peace Conference, as President Harry S. Truman (rear of platform, left), Senator Tom Connally of Texas (rear of platform, right), and others observe.

title: Truman shaking hands with Byrnes before departure
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at the National Airport, shaking hands with Secretary of State James Byrnes before Byrnes' departure for the Paris Peace Conference, as other political associates look on. Front row: Senator Tom Connally, President Truman, Secretary Byrnes, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Senator Arthur Vandenberg, two unidentified men. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Drucie Snyder Presenting the President's Cup

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from right) and Drucie Snyder, Queen of the President's Cup Regatta and daughter of the Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, present the President's Cup to the Regatta winner Dan Foster and his squad.

title: Children gather at the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate Lincoln's Birthday
Scopenote: Large group of African-American children gather at the steps of the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate the birthday of former President Abraham Lincoln.

title: President Truman arrives at the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate Lincoln's Birthday
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from left) arrives at the Lincoln Memorial for a ceremony to commemorate Abraham Lincoln's Birthday. On the left is Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman's military aide.

title: Commemorating Lincoln's birthday at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: A color guard of African American children stand at attention with flags and a wreath on the stairs of the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: Wreath at a ceremony marking Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: An unidentified African American youth stands with a wreath at the Lincoln Memorial in a ceremony marking Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: African American children gather to celebrate Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: African American children gather at the steps of the Lincoln Memorial to celebrate Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: Dignitaries in the doorway of the Lincoln Museum at Ford's Theater
Scopenote: A group of unidentified dignitaries in the doorway of the Lincoln Museum at Ford's Theater in Washington, D.C., the site of President Lincoln's assassination. This event was part of the celebration of Lincoln's birthday.

title: Dignitaries tour the exhibits at the Lincoln Museum at Ford's Theater
Scopenote: A group of unidentified dignitaries tour exhibits relating to the assassination of President Abraham Lincoln in the Lincoln Museum at Ford's Theater.

title: Dignitaries examine an exhibit at the Lincoln Museum in Ford's Theater
Scopenote: An unidentified group of dignitaries examine an exhibit concerning the assassination of President Abraham Lincoln in the Lincoln Museum at Ford's Theater.

title: Group of dignitaries outside the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: A group of unidentified dignitaries outside the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C., during the celebration of Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: Dignitaries in front of the statue of Lincoln in the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: A group of unidentified dignitaries pose in front of the statue of former President Abraham Lincoln with a wreath in the Lincoln Memorial. They are there to celebrate Lincoln's birthday.

title: Truman shakes hands with a military officer outside the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified military officer beside his car at the Lincoln Memorial at a ceremony commemorating Lincoln's birthday.

title: Ceremony commemorating Lincoln's birthday at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: A group of unidentified military officers walk down the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, past a color guard and a large crowd of spectators, at a ceremony commemorating Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: The Lincoln Memorial during a ceremony commemorating Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: The steps of the Lincoln Memorial covered with troops and spectators gathered to celebrate Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: Truman during ceremonies commemorating Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), with two unidentified men, holds his hat over his heart at the Lincoln Memorial during ceremonies commemorating Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

title: Truman standing beside his car during ceremonies at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) standing beside his car with several military officers, including his military aide, Major General Harry Vaughan (far left), during ceremonies at the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate Lincoln's birthday.

title: Dignitaries leaving George Washington's home at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: A group of dignitaries, including British Field Marshal Harold Alexander and his wife, Lady Margaret Alexander, leaving George Washington's home at Mount Vernon.

title: A group of dignitaries outside George Washington's home at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: A group of dignitaries, including British Field Marshal Harold Alexander and Lady Margaret Bingham Alexander, outside George Washington's home at Mount Vernon.

title: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander laying wreath at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander laying a wreath at a Canadian monument to World War I veterans in Arlington National Cemetery while others look on.

title: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander (foreground, left) and an unidentified United States Army officer saluting at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery.

title: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander laying a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery.

title: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander signing a guest book
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander signs a guest book, probably at Mount Vernon, as Lady Margaret Alexander and an unidentified man look on.

title: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander and others
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander (second from right), two unidentified men, and Lady Margaret Alexander (right) pose, possibly at Mount Vernon.

title: Field Marshal Alexander laying at wreath at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander lays a wreath on the grave of George Washington at Mount Vernon.

title: Field Marshal Alexander and other dignitaries
Scopenote: British Field Marshal Harold Alexander (foreground) and other dignitaries, possibly at Mount Vernon. Mrs. Margaret Alexander can be seen in the background, partly obscured by Marshal Alexander.

title: Truman greeting dignitaries at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, sixth from left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (foreground, seventh from left) greet the Governor General of Canada, British Field Marshal Harold Alexander, and his party at the White House. Also present are Donald Dawson (second from left), Major General Harry Vaughan (third from left), Secretary of State George Marshall (fourth from left), and George Elsey (to the left of the pillar).

title: President Truman and Mrs. Truman standing outside the White House awaiting guests
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Truman stand outside the White House awaiting the arrival of the Governor General of Canada, British Field Marshal Harold Alexander, and his wife, Lady Margaret Alexander. From left to right: Secretary of State George Marshall, Donald Dawson, Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, Mrs. Truman, unidentified, George Elsey. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman in the Oval Office with James Byrnes and George C. Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) talks in the Oval Office with James Byrnes (center), the retiring Secretary of State, and George C. Marshall (left), on the occasion of Marshall's swearing-in as the new Secretary of State. In the background are, from left to right: Attorney General Tom Clark; Secretary of War Robert Patterson; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; unidentified; Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: George C. Marshall walking in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: George C. Marshall walking in Washington, D.C. on the day he assumed the office of Secretary of State. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Marshall's swearing-in as Secretary of State
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at his desk in the Oval Office with members of his Cabinet as George C. Marshall is sworn in as the new Secretary of State. Standing behind Truman are, from left to right: Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, outgoing Secretary of State James Byrnes, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.

title: George C. Marshall shaking hands with senators
Scopenote: George C. Marshall (third from the right) shaking hands with Senator Tom Connally (second from left) of Texas, as Senator Arthur Vandenberg of Michigan (left), President Harry S. Truman (second from right), and James Byrnes (right) look on, on the occasion of Marshall's swearing-in as Secretary of State in the Oval Office.

title: Marshall shakes hands with his predecessor, James Byrnes
Scopenote: George C. Marshall (second from left) shakes hands with his predecessor as Secretary of State, James Byrnes, as President Harry S. Truman looks on, on the occasion of Marshall's taking the oath of office as Secretary of State in the Oval Office. On the left is Senator Tom Connally of Texas; in the background, to the right of Byrnes, is Attorney General Tom Clark and Secretary of War Robert Patterson. Others are unidentified.

title: George C. Marshall taking the oath of office
Scopenote: George C. Marshall (foreground, left) being sworn in as Secretary of State in the Oval Office by Chief Justice Fred Vinson (foreground, right) as President Harry S. Truman (standing behind desk) and dignitaries look on. title: George C. Marshall being sworn in as Secretary of State

Along the wall, from left to right are: Secretary of War Robert Patterson (partly obscured); Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; outgoing Secretary of State James Byrnes; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; unidentified man.

title: Chief Justice Fred Vinson swearing in George C. Marshall

Second row, left to right; unidentified man; William Hassett (partly obscured); Clark Clifford; John Steelman; and Captain James Foskett. All others are unidentified.

Standing, left to right: Sargent Shriver, Attorney General Tom Clark, Oscar Ewing,  G. Howland Shaw, Katharine Lenroot, Eunice Kennedy, Frank Weil, and John W. Andrews.

title: President Truman with Under Secretary Kenney and family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) with Medal of Merit recipient W. John Kenney (right), Under Secretary of the Navy and his family. With Mr. Kenney are his children Elinor M., Priscilla, and David, and his wife, Elinor (second from the right).

title: President Truman with Secretary Sullivan and family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) presenting Medal of Merit to John L. Sullivan (right), Secretary of the Navy. With the President and Secretary Sullivan are Mr. Sullivan's family: children Patricia, Charles, and Deborah, and his wife Priscilla. Standing on the right in the background is General Harry Vaughan.

title: Medal of Merit recipients families
Scopenote: The children of Under Secretary of the Navy W. John Kenney and Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan in the Oval Office while their fathers receive the Medal of Merit from President Harry S. Truman. Secretary of State George Marshall is on the far right. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medals of Merit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (middle, third from the right) presenting Medal of Merit to top officials. Standing with President Truman are (from left to right) W. John Kenney, Under-Secretary of Navy; W. Stuart Symington, Secretary of the Air Force; James Forrestal, Secretary of Defense; and John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy. Standing in the back row are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (fourth from left); Secretary of State George Marshall (fifth from left); and Admiral William D. Leahy (sixth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman presents the Medal of Merit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in the oval office with four men who received the Medal of Merit. L to R: W. John Kenney, Undersecretary of the Navy; W. Stuart Symington, Secretary of the Air Force; President Truman; James Forrestal, Secretary of Defense; and John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy. Standing in the back on the left is Admiral William D. Leahy. Standing in the back on the right is Eben Ayers. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman presents a Medal of Merit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents a Medal of Merit to Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (right) in the Oval Office. Standing in the background are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (third from the left) and Admiral William D. Leahy (fourth from the left, between Truman and Forrestal). Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman with radio contest winners at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with the winners of the "Voice of Democracy" Contest. L to R: Commissioner of Education Dr. John Studebaker, Janet Gerster from Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio; Rose Ellen Mudd from Missoula, Montana; President Truman; Alice Wade Tyree of Lawton, Oklahoma;  Laura Shatte of Hagerstown, Maryland; and Senator James Murray of Montana.

title: Radio Broadcast for the March of Dimes with Margaret Truman and Others
Scopenote: Margaret Truman in a White House broadcast for the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis (March of Dimes). Seated, left to right: Lady Inverchapel, Margaret Truman, Roberta (Mrs. Fred) Vinson. Standing, left to right: Lady Balfour, Mrs. John Baker, and Mrs. Ralph Edwards.

title: Margaret Truman for the March of Dimes
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (standing at microphone, left) at outdoor microphone with Terry Tullos, three year old poster boy for the March of Dimes. He is being held by his mother, Mrs. Clarence Tullos. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman starting March of Dimes fundraiser
Scopenote: Margaret Truman at an outdoor microphone (second from right) in downtown Washington, D. C. with Terry Tullos, three year old poster boy for the March of Dimes. They are launching the 1948 Polio Fund Drive. Others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman for the March of Dimes
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second from left) at an outdoor microphone in downtown Washington, D. C. with Terry Tullos, three year old poster boy for the March of Dimes. They are launching the 1948 Polio Fund Drive. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman at March of Dimes fundraising drive opening
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second from right) in downtown Washington, D. C. with Terry Tullos, the three year old poster boy for the March of Dimes. They are launching the 1948 Polio Fund Drive, and Terry is preparing to drop a dime in one of the bottles for each state. On the right is Mrs. Clarence Tullos, Terry's mother.

title: Margaret Truman with March of Dimes poster child
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (foreground, right) in downtown Washington, D. C. with three year old Terry Tullos, poster boy for the March of Dimes. They are at an outdoor ceremony launching the 1948 Polio Fund Drive, as Terry places a dime in one of the bottles for each state. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman with his cabinet in the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise at table: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip B. Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: President Truman with his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise at table: Secretary of Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: President Truman and Cabinet members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise around table from left: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise around table from left: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: Truman with members of his Cabinet and staff
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise around table from left: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: Truman with Cabinet and staff members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Clockwise around table from left: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree ceremony
Scopenote: View of crowd at ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas tree.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree ceremony
Scopenote: View of crowd at ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas tree.

title: President Truman at the 1947 White House Christmas Tree ceremony
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman speaking during ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: Truman at the 1947 White House Christmas Tree ceremony
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman speaking during ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: The White House, Christmas Eve 1947
Scopenote: View of empty stands waiting for ceremonies of the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: White House Christmas ceremony, 1947
Scopenote: View of empty podium awaiting ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: The White House Christmas Tree ceremony, 1947
Scopenote: View of empty stands awaiting ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: Preparations for the White House Christmas Tree ceremony
Scopenote: View of empty stands prior to the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas tree.

title: The White House Christmas Tree ceremony, 1947
Scopenote: View of White House Christmas tree and empty podium prior to the start of the ceremony for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: President Truman lights the White House Christmas Tree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman lights the White House Christmas Tree during ceremonies outside the White House. Daughter Margaret Truman is in background.

title: Truman at the 1947 White House Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets members of the armed services in the audience at the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree. All others are unidentified.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: View of the audience at the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree. All are unidentified.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: View of audience at ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree. The man second from the right is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug. Others are unidentified.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: View of audience at the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree. The man second from the right is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug. Others are unidentified.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: Distance view of audience looking toward podium at the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: View of the crowd at the 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony with the White House in the background.

title: The 1947 White House Christmas Tree lighting ceremony
Scopenote: Distance view of the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree. President Harry S. Truman is at podium.

title: Christmas Eve 1947 at the White House
Scopenote: Daytime view of the White House Christmas Tree with the White House in the background. It is the day of the ceremonies for the lighting of the White House Christmas Tree.

title: Truman leaving for Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman preparing to go up the stairs into the presidential airplane to leave for vacation in Key West, Florida. Gen. Harry Vaughan is at the top of the stairs. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman leaving for Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the bottom of the stairs leading to the presidential airplane. He is leaving for a vacation at Key West, Florida. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman leaving for Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) at the bottom of the stairs leading up to the presidential airplane, shaking hands with the pilot, Lieutenant Colonel Henry Myers.

title: Marshall leaving for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at microphones, left) shaking hands with Secretary of State George Marshall (at microphones, right) at the National Airport in Washington, D. C. Secretary Marshall is leaving to attend the London Conference of Foreign Ministers. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at National Airport to send Secretary Marshall to London
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) at National Airport in Washington, D. C., talking with Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall. Secretary of State George Marshall (not in this photo) is leaving for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: Marshall leaving for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Secretary of State George Marshall (right) as Secretary Marshall is about to leave on an airplane to attend the London Conference of Foreign Ministers. They are at National Airport in Washington, D. C. Others are unidentified.

title: Marshall preparing to leave for the London Conference of Foreign Ministers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at microphones, left) and Secretary of State George Marshall (at microphones, right) are at microphones at the National Airport in Washington, D. C. where Secretary Marshall is leaving to attend the London Conference of Foreign Ministers.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery. Standing behind Truman are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; Major General Harry Vaughan; and Captain James Foskett, President Truman's Naval Aide. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman laying wreath at Tomb of the Unknowns
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, standing directly across from the Tomb) at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery, after he has placed a wreath at the Tomb. Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; Major General Harry Vaughan; and Captain James H. Foskett. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and staff members at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing before the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery. A soldier is carrying a wreath for President Truman to place at the base of the Tomb. Behind President Truman are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; Major General Harry Vaughan; and Captain James Foskett, President Truman's Naval Aide. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery, prior to wreath-laying ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, left) walking toward the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery, prior to the wreath-laying ceremony. Walking behind President Truman are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy; Major General Harry Vaughan; Captain James Foskett; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; and Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman attending the burial of twenty soldiers at Arlington National Cemetery. These twenty were the first war dead now returned to be buried in the United States. Standing in the group between the rows of caskets are, front row, from left to right: President Truman; Secretary of State George Marshall; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; unidentified. In the second row, standing behind President Truman is Admiral William D. Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman attending mass burial at Arlington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending the burial of twenty soldiers at Arlington National Cemetery. These twenty were the first war dead now returned to be buried in the United States. Standing in the group between the rows of caskets are, front row, from left to right: President Truman; Secretary of State George Marshall; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; unidentified. In the second row, standing behind President Truman is Admiral William D. Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman attending mass burial at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman attending the burial of twenty soldiers at the Arlington National Cemetery. These twenty were the first war dead, now returned to be buried in their native land.

title: Truman attending mass burial at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman attending the burial of twenty soldiers at Arlington National Cemetery. These twenty were the first war dead, now returned to be buried in their native land.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery with Cabinet officers
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman attending the burial of twenty soldiers at Arlington National Cemetery. These twenty were the first war dead now returned to be buried in the United States. Standing in the group between the rows of caskets are, front row, from left to right: President Truman; Secretary of State George Marshall; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Under Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan; unidentified. In the second row, standing behind President Truman is Admiral William D. Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman with family and Ambassador Martins, leaving for Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party wave good-bye before boarding his airplane, the Independence, to fly to Brazil. From left to right: Mrs. Carlos Martins, Margaret Truman, President Truman, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, and Brazilian Ambassador to the United States Carlos Martins.

title: Truman family leaving for Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party board the presidential airplane to fly to Brazil. From left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins (partially obscured), Margaret Truman (back to camera), Mrs. Carlos Martins.

title: Truman family with Martins family, leaving for Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party prepare to board the presidential airplane, the Independence, to fly to Brazil. L to R: Mrs. Carlos Martins, Margaret Truman, President Truman, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins.

title: Truman with ambassador Martins, leaving for Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins as they prepare to board the presidential airplane for a flight to Brazil. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman's aircraft the "Independence."
Scopenote: View of the "Independence," the presidential airplane. President Harry S. Truman and his party (distance view) are below, waiting to leave on their trip to Brazil.

title: Truman sending off delegates to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is at the National Airport in Washington, D. C. where he is seeing off Secretary of State George Marshall and two delegates who are leaving to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers in Brazil. From left to right: Warren Austin, U. S. Representative to the United Nations; President Truman; Secretary Marshall; and Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Michigan, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: Truman sending delegates to conference in Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sees off Secretary of State George Marshall and two other delegates as they leave National Airport in Washington, D. C. for Brazil to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers. From left to right: Carlos Martins, Brazilian Ambassador to the U. S.; President Truman; Secretary Marshall; Senator Arthur Vandenberg; and Warren Austin, U. S. Representative to the United Nations.

title: Truman sends delegates to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sees off Secretary of State George Marshall and two delegates at National Airport in Washington, D. C. as they leave for Brazil to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers. From left to right: Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins; Warren Austin, U. S. Representative to the United Nations; President Truman, Secretary Marshall; and Senator Arthur Vandenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sends Delegates to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at National Airport in Washington, D. C., seeing off Secretary of State George Marshall and two delegates who are leaving to fly to Brazil to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers. From left to right: Carlos Martins, Brazilian Ambassador; President Truman; Secretary Marshall; Senator Arthur Vandenberg; and Warren Austin, U. S. Representative to the United Nations.

title: Truman with delegates to the Rio Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at National Airport in Washington, D. C. where he is seeing off Secretary of State George C. Marshall and two delegates who are leaving to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers in Brazil. L to R at microphones: Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Secretary Marshall, Brazilian Ambassador Carlos Martins, and President Truman.

title: Truman sends delegates to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at National Airport in Washington, D. C. to see off Secretary of State George Marshall and two delegates who are leaving to attend the Rio de Janeiro Conference of Foreign Ministers in Brazil. L to R: Warren Austin, U. S. Representative to the United Nations; President Truman; Secretary Marshall; and Senator Arthur Vandenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Bill for Elections in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing a bill in the oval office making the governorship of Puerto Rico an elected office. L to R: unidentified woman, Irving Silverman, Representative Fred Crawford, Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Jesus T. Pinero, and Resident Commissioner Antonio Fernos Isern.

title: Delegation from Puerto Rico Visits the White House
Scopenote: Delegation outside the White House attending the bill signing to make the governorship of Puerto Rico an elected office. L to R: Representative Fred Crawford of Michigan; Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Antonio Fernos Isern, Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico; unidentified lady; Jesus T. Pinero, Governor of Puerto Rico and Irving Silverman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Bill for Puerto Rican Elections
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) in the oval office signing a bill to make the governorship of Puerto Rico an elected office. From left to right: Unidentified woman; Irving Silverman; Representative Fred Crawford of Michigan; Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Jesus T. Pinero, Governor of Puerto Rico; and Antonio Fernos Isern, Resident Commissioner from Puerto Rico.

title: View from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise that President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg evidently on the Potomac River. This photo shows a rowboat and a metropolitan police boat.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise which President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently on the Potomac River. Photo shows a rowing team on a long boat, with a seaplane flying overhead. All are unidentified.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise which President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently on the Potomac River. Photo shows a rowing team on a long boat, with sailboats in the background. All are unidentified.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise that President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently in the Potomac River. Photo shows a rowing team arriving at dock, with crowd standing waiting. All are unidentified.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise that President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently in the Potomac River. This photo shows a rowboat filled with unidentified people.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently in the Potomac River. This is a view of a rowing race in which one team has capsized in the water.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: This is a photo taken during a cruise that President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently on the Potomac River. This photo shows a race between two rowing teams.

title: A view from the Williamsburg
Scopenote: Photo taken during a cruise which President Harry S. Truman took on the presidential yacht Williamsburg, evidently on the Potomac River. This photo shows a race between rowing teams.

title: Truman at closing session of conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the closing session of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People at Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D. C. This view shows President Truman seated between Walter White, President of the NAACP and Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, in the front row. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at closing session of conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People at Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D. C. In this photo, President Truman is in the background, chatting, as Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt leaves the podium area.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the 38th Annual Conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is walking away from the podium on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial ,where he addressed the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People. Seen slightly behind Truman are Walter White (left) and Fred Vinson. All others are unidentified.

title: Choir performs on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: An African-American choir performing on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C., at the closing session of the 38th conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People. President Harry S. Truman attended this event and addressed the group.

title: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People Convention
Scopenote: A general view of the crowd during President Harry S. Truman's address at the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D. C. with the Washington Monument in the background.

title: Truman speaking at conference of National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, as he addresses the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP). Reflection pool and the Washington Monument are in background.

title: Truman speaking at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial as he addresses the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).

title: Truman addresses closing session of National Association for the Advancement of Colored People conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial during the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: President Truman speaks on steps of Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Truman speaks from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial as he addresses the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People. Senator Wayne Morse is seated on the right in the first row.  Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt is seated second from the right on the first row, next to Senator Morse. Walter White, President of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People is seated in the front row, on the other side of the empty chair next to Mrs. Roosevelt.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt speaking on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt speaking from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, addressing the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People. Seated in the first row on the right of the rostrum are: Walter White, President of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People; President Harry S. Truman, who also addressed the conference; and Senator Wayne Morse.

title: Senator Morse speaking to conference
Scopenote: Senator Wayne Morse speaking from a rostrum on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial, addressing the closing session of the 38th annual conference of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People. Seated in the first row on the right of the rostrum are: Walter White, President of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People; President Harry S. Truman, who also addressed the conference; and Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, who also addressed the conference.

title: Truman and others leaving the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left) leaves after giving a speech at the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) conference at the Lincoln Memorial. He is accompanied by (front row) Eleanor Roosevelt and Walter White, president of the NAACP; General Harry Vaughan and Captain James Foskett (second row, left to right); Supreme Court Chief Justice Fred Vinson and Senator Wayne Morse (third row, left to right, Vinson partly obscured by Foskett); and Attorney General Tom Clark (behind and to the left of Senator Morse in the bow tie).

title: Truman receiving Cavalcade of Freedom representatives
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets little Michael Dene Condatore of Washington, D.C. and E. F. Harloff in the oval office. Little Michael is presenting to President Truman a giant "firecracker" and tickets to the American Cavalcade of Freedom which will take place on the grounds of the Washington Monument on July 4.

title: Truman receiving gifts in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives three and half year old Michael Dene Condatore of Washington, D.C. in the oval office. Little Michael presented to President Truman a "firecracker" and tickets to the American Cavalcade of Freedom which will be held on the grounds of the Washington Monument on July 4.

title: Truman receiving gifts in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets little Michael Dene Condatore of Washington in the oval office. Little Michael presented to President Truman a "firecracker" and tickets to the American Cavalcade of Freedom which will take place on the grounds of the Washington Monument on July 4.

title: Truman receiving gifts in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) chats with little Michael Dene Condatore of Washington, D.C. in the oval office. Michael presented to President Truman a "firecracker" and tickets to the American Cavalcade of Freedom which will be held on the grounds of the Washington Monument on July 4.

title: Memorial Day at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: A general distance view of the Memorial Day Ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, in civilian suit) attends Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery and lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. This photo shows President Truman walking to the tomb. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman placing wreath on Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier during a Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery. Others in this photo are unidentified.

title: Memorial Day at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: A view of the podium and the seated dignitaries at Arlington National Cemetery where President Harry S. Truman will make a speech for Memorial Day. Seated in the third row next to the woman wearing the hat is Secretary of Defense Kenneth Royall. Seated on the left of Mr. Royall is President Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman speaking at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at the podium) speaks during the Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery. Also in attendance is Secretary of Defense Kenneth Royall (third row, seated next to woman in hat). Seated in the back row are (left to right) Colonel Robert Landy, General Wallace Graham, and Captain Robert Dennison. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman speaking at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) addresses the crowd gathered for the Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery. Also in attendance is Secretary of Defense Kenneth Royall (third row, seated next to woman in hat), and General Wallace Graham (back row). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends a Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery and lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. This photo shows President Truman at the podium.

title: Truman at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery and lays a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. This photo shows the tomb after President Truman has placed the wreath in front of it. President Truman can be partly seen standing in front of the group of soldiers, without a hat on.

title: Truman speech at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) prepares to address the crowd gathered for the Memorial Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery. Also in attendance is Secretary of Defense Kenneth Royall (third row, seated next to woman in hat), General Wallace Graham, and Captain Robert Dennison (seated, back row, left to right). Others are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman was not at the ceremonies. This picture shows a general view of the ceremony with soldiers.

title: Memorial Ceremony for San Martin
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman was not at the ceremonies. This photo shows three unidentified men at the base of the statue.

title: Memorial Ceremony at San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at the statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This photo shows three unidentified men at base of statue. The ribbons on the wreaths say "San Martin Memorial Foundation."

title: Memorial Ceremony for San Martin
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman was not at the ceremonies. This photo shows three unidentified men at the base of the statue.

title: San Martin statue in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman was not present during this ceremony. This picture shows two unidentified men in front of the statue.

title: Memorial Ceremony at San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman was not present at the ceremony. This photo shows the statue with soldiers and wreaths in front.

title: Memorial Ceremony at the San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at the statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This photo shows soldiers in front of the statue.

title: Soldier and band at the San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at the statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This picture shows two unidentified men, possibly Argentinian dignitaries, saluting the statue, with soldiers and a band in background.

title: Soldiers at San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This photo shows distance view of ceremony with many soldiers in front of the statue.

title: Memorial Ceremony for San Martin
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This photo shows four unidentified women in front of the statue, possibly the wives of Argentinian dignitaries.

title: Women at San Martin statue
Scopenote: Ceremony at statue of South American patriot Jose Francisco de San Martin in Washington, D. C. President Truman is not present at the ceremonies. This photo shows four unidentified women in front of the statue, possibly the wives of Argentinian dignitaries.

title: Argentinian diplomats ready to give gift to Truman
Scopenote: Presentation of a small statue of South American patriot Jose de San Martin to President Harry S. Truman by General Jose Humberto Sosa Molina, the Argentinian War Minister. The gift was made in the name of Juan Peron of Argentina. L to R: three unidentified men, Stanley Woodward, Chief of Protocol, State Department; Don Martin Luis Drago, Argentinian Minister to the United States; General Sosa Molina, and unidentified reporters.

title: Presentation of gifts from Argentinian delegation to Truman
Scopenote: Presentation of a small statue of South American patriot San Martin to President Harry S. Truman from General Jose Humberto Sosa Molina, the Argentinian War Minister. The gift was made in the name of Juan Peron of Argentina. L to R: (in lobby of the White House) three unidentified reporters, Stanley Woodward, Chief of Protocol, State Department; Don Martin Luis Drago, Argentinian Minister to the United States; General Sosa Molina; and unidentified reporters.

title: Truman with the Youth Safety Patrol
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back row, fourth from the left) and Kansas City friend Lou Holland (back row, third from the left) in the Oval Office with the boys and girls of the Youth Safety Patrol from all over the United States. All others are unidentified.  Lennox Bundy is the African American student who is kneeling in the first row, at left.

title: Truman with the Youth Safety Patrol
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back row, fourth from the left) and Kansas City friend Lou Holland (back row, third from left) in the Oval Office with the boys and girls of the Youth Safety Patrol from all over the United States. Lennox Bundy is the African American youth at left in first row, kneeling.

title: Truman in the National Guard
Scopenote: Copy of a old photograph of President Harry S. Truman as a young man in his Missouri National Guard uniform.

title: Truman receiving baseball tickets from Clark Griffith
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), in the Oval Office, receives tickets to a baseball game and an alligator handbag for Mrs. Truman from Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Senators baseball team.

title: Truman at opening day at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the first baseball game of the year at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D. C. The game is between Washington and New York. Seated in first row, left to right are: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, and President Truman. Seated in the second row, left to right are: Colonel Robert Landry, Captain Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at opening day at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing in the aisle, wearing hat) prepares to throw out the first baseball in the opening game at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D. C. between the Washington Senator and the New York Yankees. Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Senators, is to the right of President Truman. Seated in the first row are Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, and Mrs. Bess W. Truman. Seated in the second row are Captain Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at opening day at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tosses a baseball from the stands to open the baseball season. Two unidentified baseball players are also on hand. Front row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, and President Truman. Second row, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly.

title: Truman at opening day at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the opening baseball game at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D. C. between the Washington Senators and the New York Yankees. Seated in the front row, left to right: Unidentified woman, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, President Truman. In the second row, left to right are: unidentified man, Colonel Robert Landy, Captain Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and others at opening day at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the opening baseball game at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D. C. between Washington and New York. Standing, left to right in front row: Unidentified woman, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, First Lady Mrs. Bess W. Truman, President Truman, unidentified man. In the second row, from left to right are: Colonel Robert Landry, Captain Robert Dennison, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman receiving baseball passes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), in the oval office, receives tickets to the opening baseball game of the Washington Senators and an alligator handbag and baseball pass for Mrs. Bess W. Truman from Clark Griffith (right), President of the Washington Senators.

title: Truman greets the Prince of Belgium at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Prince Charles of Belgium at the door of the White House. General Harry Vaughan stands in doorway.

title: Paul Hoffman sworn in by Chief Justice Vinson
Scopenote: Paul Hoffman (foreground, left) is sworn in by Chief Justice Fred Vinson (foreground, right) as administrator of the Economic Recovery Corporation in a ceremony in the oval office. President Harry S. Truman is in the center behind his desk. Standing in back, L to R: unidentified man, unidentified man, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, unidentified man, Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett, and Edwin Nourse.

title: Truman with Hoffman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) shakes hands with Paul Hoffman (foreground, left) after being sworn in as administrator of the Economic Recovery Corporation in a ceremony in the oval office.  Chief Justice Fred Vinson stands in the middle. Standing in the background, from left to right: Attorney General Tom Clark; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett; Edwin Nourse, Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers; Admiral William D. Leahy; two unidentified men.

title: Truman greeting Prince Charles of Belgium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, first row, second from left) greets Prince Charles of Belgium (foreground, first row, left) and his delegation at the White House. In the second row, from left to right are: unidentified, General Harry Vaughan (partly obscured by Truman), Captain Robert Dennison, and Colonel Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman receives the insignia of the Blinded Veterans Association
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in the oval office receiving the official insignia of the Blinded Veterans Association. L to R: Lloyd M. Greenwood, Harrison King, James W. Hope, Raymond Frey, Byrum S. Shumway, President Truman, Irving P. Schloss, Robert Pistel, Peter J. McKenna, Jr., and John F. Brady.

title: Truman with Prince Charles of Belgium
Scopenote: Prince Charles of Belgium (first row, left) and President Harry S. Truman (first row, center) and other dignitaries stand at attention in the entranceway to the White House. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman receiving baseball tickets from 3 Shriners
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, in the Oval Office, receives a bid to open the first performance of the 8th annual Shrine circus on April 19. Left to right: President Harry S. Truman, Renah F. Camalier, Chief Rabban of Almas Temple; Howard P. Foley, Managing Rector of the Shrine Circus; and Omer W. Clark, Illustrious Potentate of Almas Temple.

title: Truman with Prince Charles of Belgium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, center) and Prince Charles of Belgium (front row, left) attention, with other dignitaries, in the entrance to the White House. Others unidentified.

title: Truman reviews Army Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at the reviewing stand for Army Day in Washington, D. C. Front row, left to right: unidentified officer, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, and Vice Admiral Earle W. Mills. In the second row are Colonel Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan (between Royall and Forrestal), and Admiral William D. Leahy (between Truman and Mills). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman reviews Navy Band in Army Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the reviewing stand (in distance) as the Navy band marches by (foreground) during the Army Day parade in Washington, D. C.

title: Truman reviews Navy Band in Army Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the reviewing stand (in the distance) as the Navy Band marches by in the Army Day parade in Washington, D. C.

title: Truman reviews troops in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in the reviewing stand during the Army Day parade.

title: Truman reviews troops in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in reviewing stand watching soldiers march by in the Army Day parade.

title: Truman reviews Army Day parade
Scopenote: Soldiers on horseback ride by the reviewing stand as President Harry S. Truman and others watch the Army Day parade in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman reviews band in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in the reviewing stand watching a band march by in the Army Day parade in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman reviews Women's Army Corps in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in the reviewing stand watching the Women's Army Corps march by in the Army Day parade in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman reviews troops in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in the reviewing stand watching the Army Day parade in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman reviews band in Army Day parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman in the reviewing stand watching the band in the Army Day parade in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman reviews Army Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at the reviewing stand for Army Day in Washington, D. C. Front row, left to right: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, and Vice Admiral Earle W. Mills. In the second row are Colonel Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan (between Royall and Forrestal), and Admiral William D. Leahy (between Truman and Mills). All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Wait for President Harry S. Truman to Arrive
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman are at the airport, awaiting the return of President Harry S. Truman to Washington, D. C., from his Florida vacation. From left to right: Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Margaret Truman. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Await President Harry S. Truman's Arrival
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman are at the airport, awaiting the return of President Harry S. Truman to Washington, D. C., from his Florida vacation. From left to right: Katherine (Mrs. George C.) Marshall, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Secretary of State George Marshall, and Margaret Truman. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Truman arrives from Florida vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives in Washington, D. C. from his vacation in Key West, Florida. Descending the airplane, from the bottom up to the top of the stairs are President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan, and Admiral Robert Dennison. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman after arrival from Florida vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with his wife, Bess (right) and daughter Margaret (left), at the airport in Washington, D. C., where he has just returned from Florida. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman upon arrival from Florida vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with White House doorkeeper William Simmons as he descends the airplane stairs upon his return to Washington, D. C. from his Florida vacation.

title: Truman after arrival from Florida vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with his wife, Bess (right) and daughter Margaret (left) at the airport upon his return to Washington, D. C. from his vacation in Florida.

title: Truman at the Lincoln Memorial for birthday ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives for a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial for President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. L to R in front of car: W. Elkins Reed, Assistant to the Chairman of the ceremonies; General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy; President Truman; First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman; General U. S. Grant III; Admiral Robert Dennison; unidentified officer. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman's visit to the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) and his party, including First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman (second from the left), attend the ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial for the birthday of President Lincoln. The group is seen from behind, facing the Lincoln Memorial. Others are unidentified.

title: Trumans and Others at Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's Birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Lincoln's birthday. From left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman.

title: Truman's visit to the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the ceremony at Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Lincoln's birthday. This photo shows General U. S. Grant III (at left) with two unidentified men.

title: Truman, Mrs. Truman, and others at Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Lincoln's birthday. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, Assistant to the Chairman of the ceremony; General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy; President Truman; First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman; and General U. S. Grant III.

title: Truman's visit to Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: Soldiers and members of the public attending a ceremony at Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman attended the celebration. All are unidentified.

title: Lincoln's birthday celebration at the Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Distance view of ceremonies at the Lincoln Memorial to celebrate Lincoln's birthday. President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman (not pictured) were in attendance.

title: Ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attended a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial for President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. This photo shows General U. S. Grant III (left) and Admiral Robert Dennison (right) leaving the ceremony. Others unidentified.

title: Truman, Mrs. Truman, and others at Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, third from left), Mrs. Bess Truman (front row, second from left), and others attended a ceremony at Lincoln Memorial for President Lincoln's birthday. This photo shows a distance view of the ceremony. Others unidentified.

title: Trumans and others at the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial celebrating the birthday of President Abraham Lincoln. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, Assistant to the Chairman of the ceremony; General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy; President Truman; First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman; and General U. S. Grant III. Others are unidentified.

title: Ceremonies at the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, Assistant to the Chairman of the ceremony; General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William Leahy; President Truman; First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman; and General U. S. Grant III.

title: Trumans and others at the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at a ceremony at Lincoln Memorial in honor of President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. L to R: Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman, General U. S. Grant III, General Robert Landry, and Admiral Robert Dennison. Others are unidentified.

title: Ceremonies at the Lincoln Memorial for Lincoln's birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at a ceremony at Lincoln Memorial in honor of the birthday of President Abraham Lincoln. L to R: W. Elkins Reed, Assistant to the Chairman of the ceremony; General Harry H. Vaughan; Admiral William D. Leahy; President Truman; First Lady Mrs. Bess W. Truman; General U. S. Grant III; and General Robert B. Landry.

title: Arrival of cross country horseback riders
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders arrive at the White House from Tacoma, Washington and are greeted by Officer Davis (on horseback) as they ride through the White House gates. Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary will later be greeted by President Harry S. Truman.

title: Arrival of cross country horseback riders
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders arrive at the White House from Tacoma, Washington where they will be greeted by President Harry S. Truman after their 3,500 mile ride. This photo shows them on horses by the west wing of the White House. The riders are Ned Kennedy and Cecil Carey.

title: Arrival of cross country horseback riders
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Carey from Tacoma, Washington, are greeted when they arrive at the White House by Officer Davis (mounted on horse) and Captain Rasberry (standing). They will later be greeted by President Harry S. Truman.

title: Arrival of cross country horseback riders
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary of Tacoma, Washington are greeted by an unidentified man as they arrive at the White House to meet President Harry S. Truman. They have completed a 3,500 mile trek.

title: Cross country horseback riders wait to meet Truman
