Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary from Tacoma, Washington wait on their horses by the west wing of the White House to meet President Harry S. Truman. Their trip from Washington State to Washington, D.C. was 3,500 miles.

title: Cross country horseback riders wait to meet Truman
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary from Tacoma, Washington let two unidentified children sit on their horses at the west wing of the White House as they wait to meet President Harry S. Truman. The riders have just completed a 3,500 mile trek.

title: Truman greets cross country horseback riders
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) greets cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary from Tacoma, Washington after their arrival at the White House. The riders have completed a 3,500 mile trek. Others unidentified.

title: Cross country horseback riders wait to meet Truman
Scopenote: Cross country horseback riders Ned Kennedy and Cecil Cary, from Tacoma, Washington, are greeted when they arrive at the White House by Officer Davis (on horseback) and Captain Rasberry (standing). The riders have just completed a 3,500 mile trek and are waiting to meet President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman leaving for west coast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of the presidential train as he is leaving on his western trip for the west coast.

title: Truman at Union Station before leaving for west coast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at Union Station in Washington, D. C. as he prepares to leave for his western trip to the west coast. L to R: Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Senator Scott Lucas, President Truman, Senator J. Howard McGrath, Secretary of State George Marshall, and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal.

title: Truman leaving for west coast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the rear platform of the presidential train as he is leaving for his western trip to the west coast.

title: Truman leaving for west coast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at Union Station in Washington, D. C. as he prepares to leave for his western trip to the west coast. L to R: Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Senator Scott Lucas, President Truman, Senator J. Howard McGrath (behind Truman, partly obscured), Secretary of State George Marshall, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (shaking hands with the President). Other man unidentified.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second row, left)greets the President of Venezuela, Romulo Gallegos (second row, right). They are under the presidential airplane, the "Independence." Mrs. Gallegos (front row, left) and First Lady Bess Truman (front row, right) have their backs to the camera. Others unidentified.

title: Truman greets the President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) greets the President of Venezuela, Romulo Gallegos (front row, left) at the airport. The presidential airplane, the "Independence" is in the background. Mrs. Bess Truman (front row, second from right) is speaking with Mrs. Gallegos (back to camera). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) at a podium at the airport where President Gallegos has just arrived. The presidential airplane, the "Independence" is in the background. Others unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos at airport
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) and President Harry S. Truman (right) at a podium at the airport where President Gallegos has just arrived for a visit. The presidential airplane the "Independence" is in the background. Admiral William Leahy is to the left of the podium. Others are unidentified.

title: President Gallegos speaks at airport
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) and President Harry S. Truman (right) at a podium at the airport where President Gallegos has just arrived for a visit. The presidential airplane "Independence" is in background. Others unidentified.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, left) and President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) at attention in a ceremony at the Washington, D.C. airport where President Gallegos has just arrived for a visit. The presidential airplane "Independence" is in the background. Standing in the row behind Truman and Gallegos are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy (obscured by Truman); General Harry Vaughan; Captain Robert Dennison; unidentified Air Force officer; Colonel Robert Landry. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right)greets President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, left) at the airport upon President Gallegos' arrival in the United States. In this photo they are walking from the presidential airplane "Independence." Admiral William Leahy is between the two men, in background. Walking behind President Truman are General Harry Vaughan (left) and Captain Robert Dennison (right, in white uniform). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and President of Venezuela reviewing troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, third from left) and Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos (front, fourth from left) review troops upon Gallegos' arrival at the Washington, D.C. airport. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman's cabinet at the airport to meet Gallegos
Scopenote: Various members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet at the Washington, D.C. airport to greet Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos upon his arrival. From left to right: Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, unidentified man in background, Attorney General Tom Clark, Nell (Mrs. Jesse M.) Donaldson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (back seat, left) leaving the Washington, D.C. airport in a limousine after Gallegos' arrival. Admiral William Leahy (right) and an unidentified Venezuelan dignitary are in the front seat. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman meets President of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, left) are at attention in an airport ceremony upon the arrival of President Gallegos for a visit to the United States. The presidential airplane "Independence" is in the background. Standing behind Truman and Gallegos are, from left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy (obscured by Truman); General Harry Vaughan; Captain Robert Dennison; unidentified Air Force officer; Colonel Robert Landry. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos in limousine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right) with President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (back seat, left) as they leave the Washington, D.C. airport in a limousine. Admiral William Leahy (left) and an unidentified Venezuelan dignitary are in the front seat. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman speaking at airport with Gallegos
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) at the podium during a ceremony at the airport upon the arrival of President Gallegos for a visit to the United States. The presidential airplane "Independence" is in the background. Admiral William Leahy is to the left of the podium. Others are unidentified.

title: President of Venezuela visits Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, right) and his wife (front row, middle) to Mount Vernon, George Washington's estate. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos visit to Washington's tomb
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela lays a wreath on the tomb of George Washington at Mount Vernon.

title: Gallegos and party outside Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela and his wife to Mt. Vernon. This photo shows the entire party that accompanied President Gallegos in front of Mt. Vernon. President Gallegos and his wife are in the center of the group. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos and party at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela and his wife to Mt. Vernon. This photo shows the entire party that accompanied President Gallegos in front of Mt. Vernon. President Gallegos and his wife are in the center of the group. Others are unidentified.

title: Close-up and President Gallegos outside Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, second from left) and his wife visit Mount Vernon. Others are unidentified.

title: President Gallegos outside Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front, third from right), his wife, and other members of his party outside Mount Vernon, George Washington's estate. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos inside Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated) and his wife to Mt. Vernon. In this photo they are signing the guest book. Others are unidentified.

title: President and Mrs. Gallegos in Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos (left) of Venezuela and his wife to Mt. Vernon. In this photo, they are walking down the stairs, accompanied by three unidentified men.

title: President Gallegos at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: Visit of President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela to Arlington National Cemetery. In this photo, he is on the steps of the Custis-Lee house at left. Others are unidentified.

title: President Gallegos places wreath at Tomb
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela places a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Solider at Arlington National Cemetery. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos visit to Tomb of the Unknowns
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (second from right) after he placed a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Solider at Arlington National Cemetery. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos visits Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (foreground, left) visits the Lincoln Memorial. Mrs. Gallegos is in the second row, right. Others are unidentified.

title: Gallegos laying wreath at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela placing a wreath by the statue of Abraham Lincoln inside the Lincoln Memorial.

title: President of Venezuela visits Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) placing a wreath at the statue of Abraham Lincoln inside the Lincoln Memorial. Unidentified man at right.

title: President of Venezuela visits Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (foreground, center) leaving the Lincoln Memorial, where he placed a wreath at the foot of the statue of Abraham Lincoln. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Arthur Godfrey celebrating the 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: Arthur Godfrey at ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument.

title: Truman attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. Also present are Secretary of State George C. Marshall (front row, second from right) and  Admiral William Leahy (second row, left, behind Marshall). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Leahy at Washington Monument ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left) attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. Also present is Admiral William D. Leahy (front row, right). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (on the reviewing stand, second from right) and others attending a celebration for the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument, as a car carrying naval officers drives by. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Leahy at Washington Monument ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) shakes hands with Admiral Edwin Halsey (left) at ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. Admiral William Leahy (right) is also present. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: A military band marches by the reviewing stand at ceremonies commemorating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (obscured) attended the ceremonies.

title: Truman attending Washington Monument ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (to the right of the podium on the grandstand) and others watch soldiers with flags march in the parade during ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument.

title: Naval guns on display in parade
Scopenote: Here an anti-aircraft gun from the Naval Gun Factory rolls by the reviewing stand in the parade during ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (under awning of grandstand, with hat on his lap) attended the event.

title: Band in the parade celebrating the Washington Monument
Scopenote: The United States Navy Band marches by the grandstand during ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (seated under awning of grandstand, with hat in his lap) attended the event.

title: Truman at Washington Monument ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. He is watching an unidentified group of African Americans in the parade from the reviewing stand.

title: Float in the Washington Monument ceremony parade
Scopenote: A float sponsored by the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association in the parade at ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (seated, right of podium) attended the ceremonies.

title: Float in the Washington Monument parade
Scopenote: An unidentified float in the parade celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (seated, right of podium) attended the ceremonies.

title: Float in the Washington Monument celebration parade
Scopenote: An unidentified float in the parade celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (seated, right of podium) attended the ceremonies.

title: Crowd watches parade of 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: A series of floats in the parade held during ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington, D.C. The crowd in attendance is also visible.

title: Truman attending Washington Monument celebration
Scopenote: A float from the Washington Board of Trade, Greater National Capitol Committee in the parade celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman (seated, right of podium) attended the ceremonies.

title: Parade celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right of podium on grandstand) attending ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman speaks at the Washington Monument ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking from the podium at the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. On the left is Secretary of State George Marshall; others are unidentified.

title: Truman speaking at Washington Monument celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking from the podium at the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. Others are unidentified.

title: Ceremony for the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument
Scopenote: Military bands behind the reviewing stand at ceremonies celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument. President Harry S. Truman is standing at the reviewing stand, speaking to the crowd.

title: Truman waves to crowd at the 100th anniversary of Washington Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing in his limousine as he arrives for the ceremony celebrating the 100th anniversary of the Washington Monument.

title: Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate. Front row, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Colonel Robert Landry, Brigadier General Wallace Graham (physician to the President), Captain Robert Dennison, unidentified officer, unidentified officer, President Truman, unidentified officer, unidentified officer. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate. Front row of group standing on the grass, from left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Colonel Robert Landry, Brigadier General Wallace Graham (physician to the President), Captain Robert Dennison, unidentified officer, unidentified officer, President Truman, unidentified officer, unidentified officer. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate. Front row, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross (mostly obscured by sailor), Colonel Robert Landry, Brigadier General Wallace Graham (physician to the President), Captain Robert Dennison, unidentified officer, unidentified officer, President Truman, unidentified officer, unidentified officer. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman attends Memorial Day services at Water Gate
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Memorial Day service for war dead at Water Gate. He is arriving in his limousine. He is seated in the back with Press Secretary Charles Ross. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman with National Security Council
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of the National Security Council.  From left to right, clockwise around the table: Assistant Secretary of the Air Force Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Executive Secretary of the National Security Council Sidney Souers; National Security Resources Board Chairman Arthur M. Hill; Director of Central Intelligence Roscoe Hillenkoetter; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; President Truman; Under Secretary of the Navy W. John Kenney. The two men seated at the back are Major General A. M. Gruenther, Director, Joint Chiefs of Staff (left); and Robert Blum, Foreign Affairs Specialist, Department of Defense (right).

title: Truman with National Security Council
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of the National Security Council.  From left to right, clockwise around the table: Assistant Secretary of the Air Force Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Executive Secretary of the National Security Council Sidney Souers; National Security Resources Board Chairman Arthur M. Hill; Director of Central Intelligence Roscoe Hillenkoetter; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; President Truman; Under Secretary of the Navy W. John Kenney. The two men seated at the back are Major General A. M. Gruenther, Director, Joint Chiefs of Staff (left); and Robert Blum, Foreign Affairs Specialist, Department of Defense (right).

title: Truman with National Security Council
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of the National Security Council.  From left to right, clockwise around the table: Assistant Secretary of the Air Force Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney; Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall; Executive Secretary of the National Security Council Sidney Souers; National Security Resources Board Chairman Arthur M. Hill; Director of Central Intelligence Roscoe Hillenkoetter; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; President Truman; Under Secretary of the Navy W. John Kenney. The two men seated at the back are Major General A. M. Gruenther, Director, Joint Chiefs of Staff (left); and Robert Blum, Foreign Affairs Specialist, Department of Defense (right).

title: Truman at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front-row, center) attending a baseball game at Griffith Stadium, Washington, DC.  He is with the owner of the Washington Senators, Clark Griffith (right). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front-row, right) attending a baseball game at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. President Truman is shaking hands with the owner of the Washington Senators, Clark Griffith (center). Standing in the second row, left to right are Press Secretary Charles Ross, Captain Robert Dennison, and Colonel Robert Landry. Others are unidentified.

title: Celebration for Clark Griffith at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: Baseball players and unidentified men gathered on the field of Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. President Harry S. Truman was in attendance for the baseball game, as well as ceremonies honoring Washington Senators owner Clark Griffith, who celebrated 50 years in baseball. The man on the left is New York Yankees Manager Bucky Harris. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at microphone, left) attending a baseball game at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators is located at center.  Truman is attended the game and ceremonies honoring Griffith's 50th year in baseball. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a baseball game at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. Seated in the presidential box, front row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan; Admiral William D. Leahy; President Truman. Second row of presidential box, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross; Captain Robert Dennison (obscured by Leahy); Colonel Robert Landry; Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) attending a baseball game at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. Standing next to Truman is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. In the second row are, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Captain Robert Dennison, Colonel Robert Landy, and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. Others are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at Jose de San Martin Statue
Scopenote: Ceremony in front of an equestrian statue of Jose de San Martin in Washington, DC.  All are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at Jose de San Martin Statue
Scopenote: Ceremony in front of an equestrian statue of Jose de San Martin in Washington, DC.  All are unidentified.

title: Group at San Martin Statue, Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Group of people gathered in front of an equestrian statue of Jose de San Martin in Washington, DC.  All are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at Jose de San Martin Statue
Scopenote: Wreath laying ceremony at the statue of the South American patriot, Jose de San Martin, in Washington, D. C. All are unidentified.

title: Men at Jose de San Martin Statue
Scopenote: Three men, probably Latin American officials, standing in front of an equestrian statue of Jose de San Martin in Washington, D.C.  All are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos Arrive in Bolivar
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela arrive via train at Bolivar, Missouri for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar. From let to right: President Gallegos, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Mrs. Gallegos, and President Truman.

title: Truman and Gallegos on Train in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela, Mrs. Gallegos, and First Lady Bess W. Truman standing on the rear platform of the presidential train, Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered behind the train. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar during his visit.

title: Truman on Train at Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman was there to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar. The event was also attended by Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos.

title: Crowd Greeting Truman's Train
Scopenote: General view of the crowd at the train station greeting President Harry S. Truman's train on its way to Bolivar, Missouri where President Truman will dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar. The identification of this train stop is unknown.

title: Truman's Train Traveling to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: The presidential train crossing a bridge on its way to or leaving Bolivar, Missouri. President Harry S. Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar while visiting Bolivar with President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela.

title: Truman's Train Traveling to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: The presidential train on its way to or departing from Bolivar, Missouri. President Harry S. Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar while there, along with Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos.

title: Truman's Train Traveling to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: A crowd gathered at a railroad station to greet the presidential train, traveling to or from Bolivar, Missouri. The location of this station is unidentified. President Harry S. Truman traveled to Bolivar with Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman Arrives at Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing on the rear platform of the presidential train, probably in Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the train, and the President is standing on the left on the rear platform, with an unidentified man on the right. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar while visiting Bolivar.

title: Truman Arrives at Bolivar, Missouri Aboard Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing on the rear platform of the presidential train, probably in Bolivar, Missouri. The President is holding a small child, and a crowd is gathered around the train. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar while visiting Bolivar.

title: President Truman Stepping Off a Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stepping off the train during his trip with President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (not pictured) to Bolivar, Missouri for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman on Train Traveling to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing on a step of the rear platform of the presidential train, speaking to a group of men, probably reporters. The President was en route to or from Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar with the President of Venezuela, Romulo Gallegos.

title: Gallegos Presented with Phonograph Record
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left)being presented with a phonograph record by an unknown man. Gallegos attended the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri, with President Harry S. Truman.

title: Gallegos Presented with Phonograph Record
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left) being presented with a phonograph record by an unknown man. Gallegos traveled with President Harry S. Truman to Bolivar, Missouri, to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman Traveling to Bolivar, Missouri on Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right in front) and four unidentified men on the rear platform of the presidential train. President Truman has been presented with a large leather bag with his initials and a covered wagon tooled into the leather. Truman was traveling to Bolivar, Missouri, along with Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos, to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman and Gallegos on Train at Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela standing on the rear platform of the presidential train, in the distance, with a crowd of people gathered around. The train is in the station at Bolivar, Missouri, where President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Crowds of People Waiting to Hear President Truman Speak
Scopenote: Crowds of people gather in Bolivar, Missouri for the arrival of President Harry S. Truman and President Gallegos of Venezuela.  The men were in Bolivar for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos on Train at Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: From left to right, President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela, Mayor of Bolivar, Missouri Doyle C. McCraw, President Harry S. Truman, and General Harry Vaughan are standing on the rear platform of the presidential train during a playing of the national anthem. The train is in the station at Bolivar, Missouri, where President Truman was to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Key to the City of Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (on left in front), and  Mayor of Bolivar, Missouri Doyle C. McCraw are standing on the rear platform of the presidential train. The train is in the station at Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman has just received the key to the city. Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri. The man in the background on the rear platform is unidentified.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos on Train in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing on the rear platform of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri, after receiving the key to the city. Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar. Standing from left to right: unidentified man; Missouri Governor Phil Donnelly; President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela; Dr. Doyle C. McCraw, Mayor of Bolivar; and President Truman.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos on Train in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: Front row, from left to right, President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela, Missouri Governor Phil Donnelly, Mayor Doyle C. McCraw of Bolivar, Missouri, and President Harry S. Truman are standing on the rear platform of the presidential train in Bolivar, Missouri. President Gallegos has just been presented with the key to the city. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos Riding in Convertible in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: From left to right, President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela, Mayor Doyle C. McCraw of Bolivar, Missouri, and President Harry S. Truman are sitting in the rear seat of a convertible. The car is in the train station at Bolivar, Missouri; several unidentified people are standing around. President Truman was in town to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman and Gallegos Riding in Convertible in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (back seat, left); Mayor Doyle C. McCraw of Bolivar, Missouri (back seat, center); and President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right) sitting in a convertible, driving down the street in Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is lined up on the street to watch the motorcade pass. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar.

title: Truman and Gallegos Riding in Convertible in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (on left in rear seat), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (on right in rear seat), and three unidentified men, seen from behind and to the left, riding in a convertible down the main street in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos on Platform in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (foreground, left), President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right), and other unidentified dignitaries sitting on a platform in front of the county courthouse in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar. Seated in the second row, visible between President Truman and President Gallegos, is the Mayor of Bolivar, Missouri, Doyle C. McCraw. Seated slightly behind President Truman is the Governor of Missouri, Phil Donnelly.

title: Man on Horseback at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: Unidentified man on horseback passing in front of the reviewing platform on which President Harry S. Truman (front row, center, right) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, center, left) were seated in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman and President Gallegos were present to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Marching Band at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: A marching band passing in formation before the reviewing stand (not visible) on which President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were seated in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman was in town to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Young Women Marching in Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: Young women from Bolivar High School passing before the reviewing platform on which President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were sitting in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman and President Gallegos were present to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Airplanes at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: Airplanes passing over the county courthouse in Bolivar, Missouri during ceremonies to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar. The ceremonies were attended by President Harry S. Truman and Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos (not pictured).

title: Mules Pulling Wagon at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: A wagon pulled by four mules, passing before a reviewing stand (not visible) on which President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were sitting, during ceremonies marking to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Drum Majors Marching in Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: Drum majors, probably from Bolivar High School, passing before the reviewing platform (not visible) on which Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were sitting, in Bolivar, Missouri. These ceremonies marked the presence of President Truman in Bolivar to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar. All in photo are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (front row, left), and other dignitaries, standing on the reviewing platform during ceremonies marking the presence of President Truman in Bolivar, Missouri to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar. Standing behind President Truman is Missouri Governor Phil Donnelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting, farthest), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (sitting, closest) and other unidentified dignitaries, sitting on the reviewing platform, watching ceremonies marking the presence of President Truman in Bolivar, Missouri and the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman and Gallegos Watching Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela and other unidentified dignitaries sitting on the reviewing platform, watching ceremonies marking the presence of President Truman in Bolivar, Missouri to dedicate a statue to Simon Bolivar.  The presidential party is seen from the rear. President Truman (left) and President Gallegos (right) are seated in the first row of the reviewing box.

title: Truman Ladies Watching Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (first from left), Margaret Truman (second from left), First Lady Bess W. Truman (fifth from left), and other ladies (unidentified) watch the parade in Bolivar, Missouri. The parade was part of the dedication ceremonies for a statue of Simon Bolivar, which President Harry S. Truman was in town to dedicate.

title: Covered Wagon at Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: A covered wagon drawn by two white mules passes in front of the reviewing platform (in the distance) on which President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were sitting in Bolivar, Missouri. The ceremonies marked the presence of President Truman and his dedication of a statue honoring Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Southwest Baptist College Float in Simon Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremonies
Scopenote: A Southwest Baptist College float passes in front of the reviewing platform (in the distance) on which President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were seated in Bolivar, Missouri.  The ceremonies marked the presence of President Truman and his dedication of a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Romulo Gallegos Sitting in a Convertible in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (left), and Mayor Doyle C. McCraw of Bolivar, Missouri (center) are sitting in a convertible, with other cars and a crowd in the background in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: President Truman and President Gallegos in Bolivar
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated behind the driver in the front car) and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela in Bolivar, Missouri.  Presidents Truman and Gallegos were in Bolivar for the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Platform at Bolivar Statue Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, first to the left of the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated, second to the left of the podium), Bess Truman (seated, second to the right of the podium) and others on a platform in Bolivar, Missouri. They are attending the ceremonies dedicating a statue of Simon Bolivar. Also present was Admiral William Leahy (far left, in naval uniform). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos on platform in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (third from left) and other unidentified dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman and Gallegos on platform in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (second from left), and other unidentified dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. An unidentified man is at the podium speaking. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated second on left from the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated third on left from the podium), and other dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a draped statue of Simon Bolivar stands to the platform's right. An unidentified man is speaking. President Truman dedicated the statue in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Statue Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated second on left from the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated third on left from the podium), and other dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a draped statue of Simon Bolivar stands to the platform's right. An unidentified man is speaking. President Truman dedicated the statue in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Band Playing at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: A band plays for the entertainment of the crowd during the ceremonies in Bolivar, Missouri at which President Harry S. Truman dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated second on left from the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated third on left from the podium), and other unidentified dignitaries on the reviewing platform at Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a draped statue of Simon Bolivar is to its right. President Truman dedicated the statue. An unidentified man is speaking at the podium.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated second on left from the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated third on left from the podium), and other unidentified dignitaries on the reviewing platform at Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a draped statue of Simon Bolivar is to its right. President Truman dedicated the statue. An unidentified man is speaking at the podium.

title: Truman and Gallegos at Statue Dedication in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated second on left from the podium), President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated third on left from the podium), and other unidentified dignitaries on the reviewing platform at Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a draped statue of Simon Bolivar is to its right. President Truman dedicated the statue. An unidentified man is speaking at the podium.

title: Crowd gathered at dedication of statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: A view of the large crowd gathered in Bolivar, Missouri, to watch President Harry S. Truman dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar. This event was also attended by Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos.

title: Truman and Dignitaries at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in light-colored suit, standing to the left of the podium) and other dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. Everyone is standing, hat and hand over heart, as a band plays. A statue of Simon Bolivar stands beside the platform. President Truman dedicated the statue. This event was also attended by Venezuelan President Romulo Gallegos.

title: Truman Speaking at Dedication of Statue in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries on the reviewing platform in Bolivar, Missouri. A crowd is gathered around the platform, and a statue of Simon Bolivar stands to the platform's right. President Truman is speaking. President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela is seated on the front row to the left of the podium.

title: Presidents Harry S. Truman and Romulo Gallegos in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated on left), Mayor of Bolivar, Missouri, Dr. Doyle C. McCraw (center), and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela (seated on right), are seated at a table, engaged in conversation, in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Truman and Gallegos on Train in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) on the rear platform of the presidential train, in Bolivar, Missouri. President Truman is hugging another man, presumably President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela. An unidentified man is on the left in the photo. President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: Truman Waves to Crowd from the Train in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing on the lower step of the rear platform of the presidential train, waving to the crowd. Probably in Bolivar, Missouri, where President Truman dedicated a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: President Truman holding small child on rear train platform
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (on platform, second from left) receives a gift (German pistol) from Stevie Stoltz on the rear platform of a train at Springfield, Missouri.  All others unidentified.  The President is on his way to Bolivar, Missouri, to dedicate a statue of Simon Bolivar.  See also 2005-201.

title: Large crowd surrounds President Truman's train
Scopenote: Crowd gathers around the train of President Harry S. Truman in Bolivar, Missouri.  Truman and President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela were in Bolivar for the dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman in train station on trip to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) walking in a station, beside the presidential train. President Truman was on a trip to Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman and President Gallegos of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of the presidential train, speaking to a crowd, in Parkersburg, West Virginia. President Truman was on a trip to Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar on July 4, 1948. The train passed through Parkersburg on July 4 and July 6.

title: President Truman's Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's train while on his trip to Bolivar, Missouri and back for the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar.  Traveling with President Truman was President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela.

title: President Truman's Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's train while on his trip to Bolivar, Missouri and back for the dedication of the statue of Simon Bolivar.  Traveling with President Truman was President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela.

title: Truman's Train During Trip to Bolivar
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's train passing through the mountains. President Truman was on a trip to Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: Truman's Train on Trip to Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's train, passing through the mountains, with a river alongside. President Truman was on a trip to Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a statue to Simon Bolivar.

title: President Truman and Vice President-Elect Barkley on Train Platform
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley (third from the right) to Washington, D. C. after their 1948 Presidential election victory.  They are at Union Station. Others on the platform are unidentified.

title: Truman on Train in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right) on the rear platform of the presidential train, speaking to two unidentified men. Truman had just returned to Washington, D.C., after having won election to a second term in 1948.

title: Truman and Barkley Wave Hats to Crowd in Union Station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley (right) in the Washington, D.C. train station, sitting on the back of an open vehicle, waving their hats to the crowd. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Washington after winning the 1948 election.

title: President Truman and Vice President-elect Barkley after the 1948 election
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley to Washington, D.C. after the Presidential election.  Seated in back, left to right: President Truman, J. Howard McGrath, and Vice President-elect Barkley.  Seated in front, left to right: Bess Wallace Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mrs. Marian Barkley Truitt (daughter of Alben Barkley).

title: Truman and Barkley in Washington After 1948 Election
Scopenote: From left to right, Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley, Marian Barkley Truitt, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and President Harry S. Truman, posing together on the front porch of the White House, with other dignitaries standing behind them. President Truman and Vice President-elect Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. after winning the election of 1948. Standing behind Mr. Barkley and Ms. Truitt, partly obscured, are Admiral William D. Leahy and General Harry Vaughan. Standing behind President Truman, partly obscured, is Captain Robert Dennison. Standing in the background between Mrs. Truman and President Truman is Irving Geist. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley Shakes Hands With Forrestal
Scopenote: Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley (left) shakes hands with Secretary of Defense James V. Forrestal (right), with others looking on. President Truman and Vice President-elect Barkley had just returned to Washington after winning the election of 1948.

title: Barkley in Washington After 1948 Election
Scopenote: Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley (second from left) standing with several unidentified people. Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. with President Harry S. Truman after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: Truman and Barkley on the platform of a train
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman (right) and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley (second from the right) to Washington, D.C. after the Presidential election. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Barkley on Train in Washington After 1948 Election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right) and Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley (fourth from right) greet two unidentified men on the rear platform of the presidential train. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Union Station in Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: Truman Family with Alben Barkley Upon Arrival in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, in back seat), Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley (right, in back seat), First Lady Bess W. Truman (left, in front seat), and Margaret Truman (right, in front seat) sitting in an open car in the Washington, D.C. train station. Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath is in the middle in the back seat. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Washington after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: President Truman and Vice President-elect Barkley return to Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman (back of car, left) and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley (back of car, right) to Washington, D. C. after the Presidential election.  Between them is Senator J. Howard McGrath.  Bess Truman, Margaret Truman and Mrs. Marian Barkley Truitt, Senator Barkley's daughter, are seated in front of them. Others are unidentified.

title: Military band standing on White House lawn after 1948 election
Scopenote: A military band is standing on the front lawn of the White House. A large crowd is gathered in Jackson Park across the street. The crowd and band are celebrating the return of President Harry S. Truman and Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election. All are unidentified.

title: Crowd waiting to see Truman and Barkley after 1948 election
Scopenote: A crowd gathered in Jackson Park, across the street from the front of the White House, waiting to see President Harry S. Truman and Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley, who had just returned to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: Truman Standing on White House Porch After Election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and unidentified others standing on the front porch of the White House; President Truman is standing before several microphones. Truman and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the election of 1948.

title: Barkley at Microphone in Washington After 1948 Election
Scopenote: Vice President-elect Alben Barkley speaking into microphones on the front porch of the White House. President Harry S. Truman stands to his left, and others stand behind them. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election

title: Truman and Barkley in Washington after 1948 election
Scopenote: From left to right, Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley, Marian Barkley Truitt, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and President Harry S. Truman posing together on the front porch of the White House. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: Truman and Barkley in Washington After 1948 Election
Scopenote: From left to right, Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley, Marian Barkley Truitt, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and President Harry S. Truman posing together on the front porch of the White House with other dignitaries standing behind them. Truman and Barkley had just returned to Washington, D.C. after their victory in the 1948 election. Also present is Admiral William D. Leahy (background, left, in naval hat) and Captain Robert Dennison (background, right, in naval hat). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Campaign Photo on the Veterans' Information Center in Washington
Scopenote: A large photograph of President Harry S. Truman and a "Welcome" sign beneath it, on the side of the temporary quarters of the Veterans' Information Center in Washington, D.C. Truman had just returned to Washington after his victory in the 1948 election.

title: Veterans' Information Center Decorated After 1948 Election
Scopenote: The temporary quarters of the Veterans' Information Center in Washington, D.C., decorated to welcome President Harry S. Truman, who had just returned to Washington after his victory in the 1948 election.

title: Welcome Vice President Barkley Banner
Scopenote: Large sign hung above Pennsylvania Avenue near the Willard Hotel, saying, "Welcome Vice Pres. Barkley." President Harry S. Truman and Vice President-elect Alben W. Barkley had just returned to Washington, DC after their victory in the 1948 election.

title: Sign on the Washington Post Building
Scopenote: Sign, "Welcome Home From the Crow-Eaters," on the front of the Washington Post Building in Washington, D.C. President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben W. Barkley had just returned to Washington after their victory in the 1948 election--a victory not predicted by the Washington Post.

title: Margaret Truman in Automobile
Scopenote: Close-up photograph of Margaret Truman, taken through the side window of an automobile.

title: Truman Family Exiting Airplane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman coming down an airplane ramp, waving his hat. First Lady Bess W. Truman (center) and Margaret Truman (right) are behind him.

title: Photo of Reathel Odum
Scopenote: Reathel Odum, Secretary in the office of Senator Harry S. Truman, 1936-45; personal secretary to Mrs. Harry S. Truman, 1945-53, including correspondence and other duties for Margaret Truman during concert tours, 1947-49.

title: Reathel Odum at her desk in White House
Scopenote: Reathel Odum, secretary to First Lady Bess W. Truman, working at her desk in the White House.

title: Truman on Train After Campaign Trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) standing on the rear platform of the presidential train, shaking hands with an unknown man. The train is in Union Station, Washington, D.C. President Truman had just returned from a campaign trip.

title: Truman Family Waving From the Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) returns from a whistlestop tour during the presidential campaign.  He is joined by his wife, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (third from the right), daughter Margaret (second from the right), and two unidentified men. They are at Union Station in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman in Motorcade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) in the back of an automobile, upon his return to Washington, D.C. from a campaign trip. Others in the car are unidentified.

title: Truman Family on Train Platform
Scopenote: Front row from left to right, District Commissioner Guy Jason, First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman. They are standing on the rear of a train at Union Station, Washington, D.C. having returned from a political campaigning trip.

title: President Truman in Motorcade Returning to Washington, D.C., During the 1948 Campaign
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman from whistlestop tour during Presidential campaign. President Truman is seated on left in back. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman speaks to crowd from open car in Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: Return of President Harry S. Truman to Washington, D.C., from political trip during Presidential campaign. He speaks to crowd from open car.

title: President Truman and Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) returned to Union Station in Washington, D.C. after a trip for his Whistlestop Campaign Tour of 1948.  He was joined by Margaret Truman (second from right) and Bess Truman (foreground, third from right) as well as other members of his staff. Others are unidentified.

title: New Desk For the White House Executive Office
Scopenote: A copy of a desk used by George Washington, made for use in the White House during the administration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: New Desk for the White House Executive Office
Scopenote: A copy of a desk used by George Washington, made for use in the White House during the administration of President Harry S. Truman. The drawers of the desk are open.

title: Stand at 1949 Inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: The inauguration stand in front of the Capitol Building, Washington, D.C. The guests are in their seats; a band is gathered beneath the stand. President Harry S. Truman is not yet present.

title: Stand at 1949 Inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: The inaugural stand in front of the Capitol Building, Washington, D.C. This shot is taken from a distance, showing the guests seated under the stand, a band gathered below it, and a larger crowd seated behind the band. President Harry S. Truman may be speaking at the podium.

title: President Truman's 1949 Inaugural Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivering his inaugural address, beneath the inaugural stand in front of the Capitol Building, Washington, D.C. This shot is taken from some distance, showing the guests, crowd and band.

title: Barkley Takes the Oath of Office at 1949 Inauguration
Scopenote: The inauguration of President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben W. Barkley. Vice President Barkley is apparently taking the oath of office. The photograph shows most of the inaugural stand, the guests under and around the stand, and the band beneath it.

title: Barkley Takes the Oath of Office at 1949 Inauguration
Scopenote: Vice President Alben W. Barkley apparently taking the oath of office. The shot is taken from a distance; it shows the inaugural stand and the crowd before it. Everyone is standing. President Harry S. Truman is also present.

title: Crowd at Inaugural Stand for Truman's Inauguration
Scopenote: The inauguration of President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben W. Barkley. Photograph showing the inaugural stand in front of the Capitol Building, Washington, D.C. The crowd is standing, and the band is playing.

title: Distance View of 1949 Inaugural Address by President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is apparently delivering his inaugural address. The photograph shows the inaugural stand in from of the Capitol Building and the crowd gathered around and under it.

title: Distance View of 1949 Inaugural Address by President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman showing the President speaking at the podium. Photograph also shows the inauguration stand and crowd in front of Capitol Building.

title: Distance View of 1949 Inaugural Address by President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman showing the President speaking at the podium. The inauguration stand and crowd in front of Capitol Building are also shown.

title: Truman Delivering His Inauguration Speech
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman showing the President at the podium delivering his inauguration address. Photograph also shows the inauguration stand and crowd.

title: Truman Speaking to Inauguration Crowd
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman speaking from the podium at his Inauguration. Photograph also shows the inauguration stand and crowd beneath the Capitol building.

title: President Truman Takes Oath of Office
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman, showing the President being sworn into office.

title: Truman Takes Oath of Office
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman showing the President being sworn into office. The photo also shows the crowd in the stands, and the band beneath the stand at the United States Capitol Building.

title: Distance view of President Truman Taking the Oath of Office
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman showing the President being sworn into office. The photo also shows the crowd in the stands, and the band beneath the stand at the United States Capitol Building.

title: Distance view of inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman, showing the President walking to his seat after taking the Oath of Office. Photograph also shows the inauguration stand and band below the podium.

title: View of Crowd at Inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the crowd at the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman. The angle of the photograph shows the crowd to the right in front of the inauguration stand. The Capitol Building is in the background.

title: View of Crowd at Inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the crowd at the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: View of Crowd at Inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of the crowd attending the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Inaugural Reception for President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of President Truman and his family at the inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C., seated on the balcony. In front row from left to right are President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman along with unidentified guests. A large banner with the Presidential Seal hangs in front of the balcony.

title: Truman Waves to Crowd at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves to the crowd from the balcony at the inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman are seated next to him in the front row. There is a banner with the Presidential Seal hanging from the front of the balcony. The Seal is partially obscured.

title: President Truman and Hollywood Stars at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with performers at the inaugural gala held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. From left to right, Margaret O'Brien, George Jessel, unidentified man, Dorothy Maynor, unidentified man (partly obscured), unidentified woman, President Truman, Phil Harris (in background), Alice Faye, Phil Regan, unidentified woman, Lucy Monroe, unidentified man, Jane Powell, unidentified woman (partly obscured), Gene Kelly, Sally De Marco, Tony De Marco, Lionel Hampton.

title: Performers at President Truman's Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Performers ride into President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala in a miniature train. The gala was held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All are unidentified.

title: Band Performs at Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Distance view of an unidentified band performing at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Photograph is dark except for the spot-lit stage.

title: Audience at Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: View of unidentified members of the audience at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Photograph shows several people in formal attire seated in metal folding chairs.

title: Pendergast Family at Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Mr. James Pendergast (third from left) is photographed at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Pendergast's wife, Kathleen (fourth from left), and daughter, Mary Ellen Pendergast (unknown position), are also present along with two unidentified women.

title: Audience at Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: View of unidentified audience members at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.  All are seated in folding chairs.

title: Pendergast Family Attending Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Mr. James Pendergast (third from left) is photographed at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Pendergast's wife, Kathleen (fourth from left), and daughter, Mary Ellen Pendergast (unknown position), are also present along with two unidentified women.

title: Audience at President Harry S. Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: View of unidentified audience members, seated in folding chairs, at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: Distance view of Phil Spitalny's All Girl Orchestra at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. The crowd is also visible in the this photograph.

title: Performers at President Truman's Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Distance view of an orchestra performing at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: Performers at the Inaugural Gala for President Truman
Scopenote: Distance view of an orchestra performing at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Photograph was taken from right side of stage, and is dark except for the spot lit stage.

title: President Truman and Family at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Front row from left to right, President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman, along with other unidentified guests. President Truman and his family are seated in the balcony at the inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. In front of the balcony hangs a banner with the Presidential Seal.

title: Truman Family at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Front row, standing from left to right, President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman at the inaugural gala in the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. In front of the balcony is hanging a banner with the Presidential Seal. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Hollywood Stars at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with performers at the inaugural gala held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. From left to right, Lena Horne, Margaret O'Brien, George Jessel, unidentified man, Dorothy Maynor, unidentified man, unidentified woman (partly obscured by Truman), President Harry S. Truman, Phil Harris, Alice Faye, Phil Regan, unidentified woman, Lucy Monroe, unidentified man, unidentified man (partly obscured), Jane Powell, Gene Kelly, Sally De Marco, Tony De Marco.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with performers at the inaugural gala held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. From left to right, Edgar Bergen, Joan Davis, Lena Horne, Margaret O'Brien, George Jessel, unidentified man, Dorothy Maynor, unidentified man (partly obscured), unidentified woman (partly obscured), President Truman, Phil Harris (partly obscured), Alice Faye, Phil Regan, unidentified woman, Lucy Monroe, unidentified man, Jane Powell, unidentified woman, Gene Kelly.

title: Truman and Barkley with Families at Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Left to right, First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, Marian (Mrs. Max) Truitt (daughter of Alben Barkley), Vice President Alben Barkley, and President Harry S. Truman attending the inaugural gala at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: Left to right, Unidentified man, President Harry S. Truman, and Vice President Alben Barkley at dinner honoring Truman and Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: Distance view of the crowd at dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: View of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: View of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman is second from the right. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: View of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Left to Right, unidentified man, unidentified woman, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret (Mrs. Harry) Vaughan, unidentified man, unidentified woman.

Scopenote: View of table at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Left to right, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, and an unidentified man. All others in background are unidentified.

title: Table at Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: View of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Left to right, unidentified man, unidentified woman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. All others are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Officers at Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: View of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Standing in the center from left to right are Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson. All others are unidentified.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Sullivan at Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: View of table at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Charles Sawyer (left) is seated with Mr. and Mrs. John L. Sullivan (right).

title: Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: View of table at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice-President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing at microphone at the dinner honoring him and Vice-President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Mrs. Truman is third from the left; Margaret Truman is fifth from the left. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at left) stands and applauds Vice-President Alben Barkley (third from left) at the dinner honoring them at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. First Lady Bess W. Truman on far right. All others unidentified.

title: Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: Distance view of banquet room at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman at Inaugural Dinner
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified man, President Harry S. Truman, and Vice-President Alben Barkley at the dinner in their honor at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman with Bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) poses with artist Felix de Weldon (left) and the bust Mr. Weldon created of President Truman.

title: Truman With de Weldon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) poses with artist Felix de Weldon (left) and the bust of President Truman that Mr. de Weldon created.

title: President Truman Bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) poses next to the bust that artist Felix de Weldon (left) created.

title: President Truman and Bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) poses next to a bust of himself that artist Felix de Weldon (left) created.

title: Margaret and Mrs. Truman at Blair House
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (left) and her daughter, Margaret (right), pose for a portrait in front of the fireplace at Blair House.

title: Margaret Truman and Mrs. Truman at Blair House
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (left) poses with her daughter, Margaret (right), for a portrait photograph in front of the fireplace at Blair House.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman at Blair House
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (left) poses with her daughter, Margaret (right), in front of the fireplace at Blair House.

title: President Truman with President Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right) greets President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (second from right) at the National Airport in Washington, D.C. Standing at the microphone is Carlos Lechuga Hevia. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Awaiting the Arrival of President Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with crowd of dignitaries at National Airport in Washington, D.C., awaiting the arrival of President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba. President Truman is the man standing in front of the two Naval officers, wearing a hat. Cuban Ambassador to the United States Guillermo Belt is standing in front of President Truman. The two Naval officers standing behind Truman are Admiral William Leahy (left) and Captain Robert Dennison. General Harry Vaughan is also in attendance (fourth from left in main group of people). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Prio Socarras Review Troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (middle) and President Carlos Prio Socarras (right of Truman) of Cuba review troops in ceremony upon the arrival of President Prio Socarras at National Airport in Washington, D.C. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Prio Socarras at Attention
Scopenote: President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (left) and President Harry S. Truman stand at attention at National Airport in Washington, D.C. President Prio Socarras has just arrived for a visit. Standing behind Presidents Prio Socarras and Truman are, from left to right: Genovevo Perez-Damera, unidentified man, Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan, Captain Robert Dennison, and Colonel Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Walking With Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (foreground, left) and President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) walking together at National Airport, Washington, D.C., where President Prio Socarras has just arrived for a visit. All others unidentified.

title: Ceremony Welcoming President Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba standing at the microphone during ceremonies welcoming him to the United States at National Airport, Washington, D.C. Standing behind him on the platform is Carlos Hevia (left) and President Harry S. Truman (right). All others are unidentified. On the right is President Truman's airplane, The Independence.

title: Truman on Platform With Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (second from left) on a platform upon President Prio Socarras' arrival at National Airport in Washington, D.C. Carlos Hevia is the man at right.

title: Truman Shaking Hands With Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (second from left) in ceremonies at National Airport in Washington, D.C., upon the arrival of President Prio Socarras for a visit. Carlos Hevia the man at right.

title: Truman and Prio Socarras Walk Away From Plane
Scopenote: President Carlos Prio Socarras (foreground, left) of Cuba walks with President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) away from the presidential airplane Independence. President Socarras has just arrived at National Airport in Washington, D. C. for a visit. Standing between President Socarras and President Truman is Colonel Robert Landry. Among the group standing at the base of the stairs are, from left to right: Luis Botifoll, unidentified woman, unidentified man (partly obscured), Cuban Ambassador Guillermo Belt, Admiral William Leahy, unidentified man, Carlos Hevia, and United States Ambassador to Cuba Robert Butler. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Confers With Advisors Regarding Marshall Plan
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, Paul Hoffmann, and Averell Harriman confer in the Oval Office on the Marshall Plan.

title: President Truman Discussing Marshall Plan with George C. Marshall, Paul Hoffman, and Averell Harriman
Scopenote: From left to right President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, Economic Cooperation Administrator Paul Hoffman, and Ambassador Averell Harriman in the Oval Office discussing the Marshall Plan.

Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman riding in his limousine to the reviewing stand for the inaugural parade.

title: Distance View Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Distance view of the procession of limousines as President Harry S. Truman rides to the reviewing stand for the inaugural parade. The members of Battery D, President Truman's World War I battery, walk beside his car.
