Scopenote: President Harry s. Truman and Vice-President Alben Barkley ride in their limousine to the reviewing stand for the inaugural parade. The men of Battery D, President Truman's World War I battery, walk beside the car.

title: Truman and Barkley in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice-President Alben Barkley ride in a limousine to the reviewing stand for the inaugural parade. The members of Battery D, 35th Division, President Truman's World War I battery, walk beside the car.

title: Cars in Truman Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The limousine of Julius Krug, Secretary of Interior, is in foreground in this view of the limousines of dignitaries in President Harry S.  Truman's inaugural parade.

title: Dignitary Limousines at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Limousines carrying dignitaries in President Harry S. Truman's inaugural parade.

title: Truman's Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Distance view of President Harry S. Truman's inaugural parade showing the limousine of Governor William Tuck of Virginia.

Scopenote: A formation of airplanes, B-36 bombers, flying over Washington during the inaugural festivities for President Harry S. Truman.

title: Armored Vehicle at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: An armored vehicle driven by soldiers is passing in front of the viewing stand at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural parade. President Truman is seated behind the center stripe of the bunting on the front of the stand. Vice-President Alben Barkley is on the right behind the bunting. All others unidentified.

title: Truman and Barkley at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Vice-President Alben Barkley (right) on the reviewing stand during the Inaugural parade, holding cups containing warm beverages in their gloved hands. Seated in the background on the left is General Omar Bradley. Seated in the background on the right side, front row is General Robert Landry (left) and Admiral Robert Dennison (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Barkley at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Vice-President Alben Barkley (right) waving from the reviewing stand during the Inaugural Parade. Seated in the background on the left is General Omar Bradley. Seated in the background on the right side, front row are, left to right, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry and Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman and daughter Margaret Truman with other dignitaries, watching the inaugural parade from the reviewing stand. Front row, left to right: unidentified woman, Mrs. Truman, Mrs. Marian Barkley Truitt (daughter of Alben Barkley). Second row, left to right: unidentified woman, Drucie Snyder, Margaret Truman. Seated behind Margaret on the right is Mary (Mrs. Omar) Bradley and General Omar Bradley. All others are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Members at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet watch the Inaugural parade from the reviewing stand.  Front row, left to right: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, unidentified boy, unidentified woman, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, unidentified woman. In the second row, left to right are: Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, and Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Unidentified attendees at President Harry S. Truman's inaugural parade.

Scopenote: Crowd admiring float from Kentucky at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Parade. The float consists of models of the Washington Monument and other Washington, D.C. landmarks.

title: Truman Family at the 1949 Inaugural Ball
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman at the 1949 Inaugural Ball at the National Guard Armory, Washington, D.C. From left to right: unidentified man, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, Ms. Perle Mesta, President Truman, Margaret Truman, Inaugural Ball Co-Chairman Edgar Morris, and Arthur Bergman.

title: Truman Family in the Viewing Stand at the Inaugural Ball
Scopenote: Attendees in the viewing stand at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Ball, held at the National Guard Armory in Washington. Truman, unidentified girl, unidentified woman, unidentified boy, J. Vivian Truman.

title: Attendees at Inaugural Ball
Scopenote: Attendees at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Ball at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. First Lady Bess W. Truman is standing in the first row of the balcony, fourth from the left. Margaret Truman is standing in the first row of the balcony, fifth from the left. Seated between Bess and Margaret is Mary Jane Truman. Seated in the first row of the balcony, near the Presidential flag, is President Harry S. Truman and Ms. Perle Mesta (partly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: Swearing-in Ceremony of Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Dean Acheson (left) being sworn in as  Secretary of State by Supreme Court Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right). Standing behind his desk in the Oval Office is President Harry S. Truman. In the background from left to right are: Mrs. Alice Acheson, unidentified woman, Congressman Sol Bloom, Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Senator Tom Connally, Major General Harry Vaughan, Captain Robert Dennison, Mary Jane Truman, and an unidentified woman.

title: Truman and Acheson at Acheson's Swearing-in Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shaking hands with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) at Acheson's swearing-in ceremony in the Oval Office. Standing in the background, from left to right, are: Senator Tom Connally, Major General Harry Vaughan (partly obscured by Acheson), Chief Justice Fred Vinson, Mary Jane Truman, and two unidentified women.

title: Acheson's Swearing-in Ceremony
Scopenote: Dean Acheson (left) taking the oath of office as Secretary of State in the Oval Office, with Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right) administering the oath. Standing in the background are Attorney General Tom Clark (left), Mrs. Alice Acheson (visible between Mr. Acheson and Justice Vinson), Senator Tom Connally (partly obscured by Justice Vinson), President Harry S. Truman, and Major General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Acheson at Acheson's Swearing-in Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shaking hands with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) during Acheson's swearing-in ceremony in the Oval Office. Standing in the background are, from left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan, Captain Robert Dennison, Chief Justice Fred Vinson (partly obscured by Truman), Mary Jane Truman, and three unidentified women.

title: Truman, Acheson, and Vinson at Acheson's Swearing-in Ceremony
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson at Acheson's swearing-in ceremony in the Oval Office. Standing in the background, from left to right, are: unidentified woman, unidentified man, Mrs. Alice Acheson, unidentified woman, Congressman Sol Bloom, Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Senator Tom Connally, Major General Harry Vaughan (partly obscured by Vinson), Captain Robert Dennison, and Mary Jane Truman.

title: Truman, Acheson, and Vinson at Acheson's Swearing-in Ceremony
Scopenote: Dean Acheson (left) taking the oath of office as Secretary of State, with Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right) administering the oath. Standing in the background are, from left to right: unidentified man, Mrs. Alice Acheson, unidentified woman, Congressman Sol Bloom, Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Senator Tom Connally, President Harry S. Truman, Major General Harry Vaughan, Captain Robert Dennison, and Mary Jane Truman.

title: Portrait of Dale Doty
Scopenote: Portrait of Dale Doty which was used in conjunction with his oral history interview. He was the Assistant Secretary of the Interior, 1950-52, and Commissioner, Federal Power Commission, 1952-54.

title: Riders from Maryland in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Riders on horseback from Maryland participating in President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Parade.

title: French Merci Train Railroad Car
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (speaking behind podium) attending a ceremony next to a boxcar from the French "Merci train," a gift from France to the United States in grateful recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. Veterans stand among the crowd, all unidentified.

title: French Merci Train Ceremony
Scopenote: An unidentified man prepares to cut a ribbon on a boxcar from the French "Merci train," a gift from France to the United States in grateful recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. Vice-President Alben Barkley (not pictured) attended the ceremony, along with many veterans.

title: Vice President Alben Barkley at French Merci Train Gift Ceremony
Scopenote: Vice-President Alben Barkley attends a ceremony recognizing a gift of a boxcar from the French "Merci" train. The train is a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. Standing behind the podium are Senator Tom Connally (saluting), French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet (next to Connally), Vice-President Barkley (holding his hat over his heart), and Senator Arthur Vandenberg (to the right of Barkley). All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley Receiving Medals from Bonnet
Scopenote: Vice-President Alben Barkley (second from right) receiving medals from French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet (foreground, left). The medals were presented during a ceremony giving the United States a boxcar, part of the "Merci Train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. In the background on the left is Senator Tom Connally. On the right is Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley Speaking at Train Ceremony
Scopenote: Vice-President Alben Barkley (standing at microphone) speaking to a crowd gathered around a boxcar from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. Others at ceremony unidentified.

title: Henri Bonnet Speaking at French Merci Train Ceremony
Scopenote: French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet speaking to a crowd gathered around a box from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II.  Seated on the right side of the podium are Vice-President Alben Barkley (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley Attending French Train Ceremony
Scopenote: Unidentified man speaking to a crowd gathered around a box from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II.  Seated on the right side of the podium are Vice-President Alben Barkley (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others are unidentified.

title: Band and Crowd at French Train Ceremony
Scopenote: Crowd and a band gathered at the ceremony presenting a railcar from France to the United States in gratitude for U.S. aid in World War II. People unidentified.

title: Barkley and Vandenberg at Railcar Ceremony
Scopenote: Unidentified man speaking to a crowd gathered around a box from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II.  Standing on the right side of the podium are Vice-President Alben Barkley (left) and Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley with Dignitaries at French Merci Train Ceremony
Scopenote: From left to right, French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet, Vice-President Alben Barkley, and Senator Arthur Vandenberg at the French "Merci Train" ceremony. The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley and Vandenberg at French Merci Train Ceremony
Scopenote: From left to right, French Ambassador to the United States Vincent Auriol, Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified woman, and Senator Arthur Vandenberg at the French "Merci Train" ceremony. The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. All others are unidentified.

title: Vandenberg at French Train Ceremony
Scopenote: Senator Arthur Vandenberg (standing at microphone) speaking to a crowd gathered around a boxcar from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. Others at ceremony unidentified.

title: French Merci Train Ceremony
Scopenote: A crowd gathered around a boxcar from the French "Merci train." The train was a gift from France to the United States in recognition of U.S. aid to France after World War II. All are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Celebration at Lincoln Memorial with a line of members of the military lining the steps. People unidentified. The celebration is in commemoration of the 140th anniversary of Abraham Lincoln's birth.

title: Truman and Others at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries outside the Lincoln Memorial during ceremonies commemorating Abraham Lincoln's 140th birthday. From left to right: unidentified, Admiral Robert Dennison, President Truman, General Robert Landry, and unidentified.

title: Truman at Lincoln Memorial with Others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial to celebrate Lincoln's birthday. From left to right: unidentified, Admiral Robert Dennison, President Truman, General Robert Landry, unidentified.

title: Truman at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries standing at attention outside the Lincoln Memorial during ceremonies commemorating Lincoln's Birthday.

title: Truman and Dignitaries at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries watching as a wreath is carried up the steps of the Lincoln Memorial during ceremonies commemorating Lincoln's Birthday. Crowds of onlookers stand on the stairs of the Memorial

title: Truman at Lincoln Memorial Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries watching a flag procession on the steps of Lincoln Memorial. Truman is attending a wreath laying ceremony commemorating President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. The two military officers at the top of the stairs are Admiral Robert Dennison (left) and General Robert Landry (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dignitaries at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries watching a flag procession on the steps of Lincoln Memorial. Truman is attending a wreath laying ceremony commemorating President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. The two military officers at the top of the stairs are Admiral Robert Dennison (left) and General Robert Landry (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Attending Ceremony at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries watching procession coming down the steps of the Lincoln Memorial during the Lincoln birthday celebration.

title: Truman and Others at Lincoln Birthday Celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and unidentified dignitaries watching a flag procession on the steps of Lincoln Memorial. Truman is attending a wreath laying ceremony commemorating President Abraham Lincoln's birthday. The two military officers at the top of the stairs are Admiral Robert Dennison (left) and General Robert Landry (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Ceremony at Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: Crowd gathered on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial for celebration of Lincoln's birthday. People unidentified.

Truman and his Cabinet, in the Cabinet Room at the White House: (clockwise around table from left) Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Vice-President Alben Barkley; Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

Truman with his Cabinet and other top advisors, in the Cabinet Room at the White House: (clockwise around table from left) Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Ambassador Averell Harriman; Assistant to the President John Steelman; Vice-President Alben Barkley; Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark; Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: Truman with His Cabinet at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet, in the Cabinet Room at the White House: (clockwise around table from left) Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Vice-President Alben Barkley; Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and Attorney General Tom Clark.

Scopenote: Military band playing at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. All are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower and Forrestal at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (right) at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Others unidentified.

title: Cabinet Members at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: In the foreground, from left to right, are Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, and Attorney General Tom Clark, attending an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman with Stuart Symington at Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington (second from right) at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. title: Truman and Symington at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified, General Robert Landry, General Wallace Graham (partly obscured by Truman), President Harry S. Truman, unidentified civilian, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and unidentified others at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base.

title: Truman and Symington Attending Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at Andrews Air Force Base attending an air show. From left to right, unidentified, Admiral Robert Dennison (mostly obscured), President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, General Wallace Graham (background, behind Symington), General Robert Landry, two unidentified military officers. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Standing Next to Plane at Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending an air show at Andrews Air Force Base, standing next to a plane on display.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) walking with military personnel at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Foreground, from left to right: Attorney General Tom Clark, President Truman, General Robert Landry, unidentified. Behind and to the right of General Landry is Admiral Dennison. In the fourth row on the right is General Wallace Graham. All others unidentified.

title: Truman and Dignitaries Attending Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with other dignitaries inspecting aircraft during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Standing next to President Truman on the right is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving from inside a B-36A bomber, at an air show at Andrews Air Force Base.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) inspecting aircraft, a Northrop B-49, during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base, surrounded by reporters and military personnel. Standing on the right of President Truman is General Robert Landry. Behind General Landry is Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) using binoculars to observe an aerial display during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Standing on the left is Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington. Standing on the right, foreground, is Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified.

title: Aerial Display at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: Crowd watching a military airplane on the runway at Andrews Air Force Base. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Crowd watching a military airplane flying during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. All are unidentified.

title: Aerial Display at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: Crowd watching military aircraft flying during an aerial display at Andrews Air Force Base. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Inspecting Aircraft at Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left) inspecting aircraft, Northrop B-49, during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Standing next to Truman on the right is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dignitaries at Air Show
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) walking with military personnel, dignitaries, and reporters while attending an air show at Andrews Air Force Base. Walking next to President Truman on the right is General Robert Landry. Walking behind and slightly left of President Truman is General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Military band giving a performance during an air show at Andrews Air Force Base, with a military plane in the background. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shaking hands with General Hoyt Vandenberg, as Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington (third from right) looks on. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Basil O'Connor Doing Radio Broadcast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Basil O'Connor, chairman of the American Red Cross, during a radio broadcast on behalf of the Red Cross Fund Campaign.

title: Truman Giving a Radio Broadcast for the Red Cross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Basil O'Connor, Chairman of the American Red Cross, during a radio broadcast on behalf of the Red Cross Fund Campaign.

title: Truman and O'Connor at Radio Broadcast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Basil O'Connor, chairman of the American Red Cross, giving a radio broadcast on behalf of the American Red Cross.

title: Truman and Dignitaries at Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. Seated from left to right at the table facing the camera: Secretary of State Dean Acheson, unidentified man, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, unidentified man, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom Clark. All others unidentified.

title: Truman and Cabinet Members at Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. Seated around the table, from left to right: Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, unidentified man, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and unidentified man (back to camera).

title: Truman at Interior Department Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. Seated around the table from left to right are: Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, unidentified man, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and unidentified man.

title: Interior Department Luncheon
Scopenote: Group of men at a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer is on the back side of the table, fourth from the right. All others are unidentified.

title: Attendees at Interior Department Luncheon
Scopenote: Attendees at a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. On the near side of the table is Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (fifth from the right). On the far side of the table is Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from the left) and Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson (fourth from the left). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Attendees at Interior Department Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. At the head table, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior James Forrestal, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, unidentified man, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, unidentified man, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom Clark.  Seated at the table in the foreground are Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (Left side of table, left), Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson (left side of table, second from left), and Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (right side of table, fourth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Attendees at Interior Department Luncheon
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attending a luncheon commemorating the one-hundredth anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Department of the Interior. At the head table, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior James Forrestal, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, unidentified man, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, unidentified man, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom Clark.  Seated at the table in the foreground are Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (Left side of table, left), Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson (left side of table, second from left), and Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (right side of table, fourth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Opening Baseball Season at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, far right), with First Lady Bess Truman and other dignitaries at Griffith Stadium in Washington for the opening game of the 1949 baseball season. Seated in the first row of the Presidential box are, from left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified man, Mrs. Truman, and President Truman. Standing beside President Truman is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. Seated in the second row of the Presidential box are, from left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and Secretary Matthew Connelly. Standing behind Mr. Connelly with a cigar in his mouth is Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Opening Baseball Season at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, center) smiling and holding up the baseball which he is about to throw out to open the baseball season at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D.C. In the first row of the Presidential box, from left to right are: Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified man, Mrs. Truman and President Truman. The man holding on to Truman's arm is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. In the second row of the Presidential box are, from left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly (partly obscured). Standing behind President Truman is Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Opening Baseball Season at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throwing out the first ball from the presidential box at Washington's Griffith Stadium, on opening day of the 1949 baseball season. Vice President Alben Barkley is on the far left. Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators, stands beside Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: Harry and Bess Truman at Opening Game of Baseball Season
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other members of his party at the opening game of the 1949 baseball season at Griffith Stadium. Seated in the first row of the Presidential box, left to right: Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified man, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and President Truman. Standing behind President Truman is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. Seated in the second row of the Presidential box, left to right: General Robert Landry, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. Standing behind Mr. Connelly, wearing a bow tie, is Attorney General Tom Clark.

title: Truman at Opening Game of Baseball Season
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, left) shaking hands with Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators, at the opening game of the 1949 baseball season at Griffith Stadium. Seated in the first row of the Presidential box, left to right: Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified man, First Lady Bess W. Truman. Seated in the second row of the Presidential box are, from left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Opening Game of Baseball Season
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, far right) with First Lady Bess Truman (to Truman's right) and other members of his party, at Griffith Stadium in Washington on opening day of the baseball season. Seated in the first row of the Presidential box, left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Vice-President Alben Barkley, unidentified man, Mrs. Truman, President Truman. Standing beside President Truman is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. Seated in the second row of the Presidential box, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, Press Secretary Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. Standing behind Mr. Connelly is Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Signing Bill for Upper Colorado River Basin Compact
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office signing S. 790, an act granting the consent of the United States to the Upper Colorado River Basin Compact, as Interior Secretary Julius Krug and members of the Congressional delegations of Wyoming, Utah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Arizona look on. Secretary Krug is the man in the striped tie standing in front of the flag, behind President Truman. Arizona Senator and former Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson is the man in the background directly behind President Truman, wearing glasses. The two men leaning on the back of Truman's chair are Senator Lester Hunt (left) and Senator Dennis Chavez (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Signing Colorado Basin Legislation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office signing S. 790, an act granting the consent of the United States to the Upper Colorado River Basin Compact, as Interior Secretary Julius Krug and members of the Congressional delegations of Wyoming, Utah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Arizona look on. Secretary Krug is the man in the striped tie standing in front of the flag, behind President Truman. Arizona Senator and former Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson is the man in the background directly behind President Truman, wearing glasses. The two men leaning on the back of Truman's chair are Senator Lester Hunt (left) and Senator Dennis Chavez. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Signing Bill for Upper Colorado River Basin Compact
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office, signs S. 790, an act granting the consent of the United States to the Upper Colorado River Basin Compact, as members of the Congressional delegations of Wyoming, Utah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Arizona look on. The four men directly behind Truman's chair are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (fourth from left in striped tie), Senator Lester Hunt, Senator and former Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, and Senator Dennis Chavez (holding cigar). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Signing Bill for Upper Colorado River Basin Compact
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office, signs S. 790, an act granting the consent of the United States to the Upper Colorado River Basin Compact, as members of the Congressional delegations of Wyoming, Utah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Arizona look on. The four men directly behind Truman's chair are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (fourth from left in striped tie), Senator Lester Hunt, Senator and former Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, and Senator Dennis Chavez (holding cigar). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reviews Army Day Parade
Scopenote: From left to right, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Harry S. Truman, and others review the parade during Army Day ceremonies in Washington, D.C. Standing behind Bradley are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Robert Landry (partly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Others at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviews a parade during Army Day ceremonies. From left to right: General Omar Bradley (saluting), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, General Harry Vaughan (in background, leaning over Truman's shoulder), President Truman, and unidentified man. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman, Bradley, and Johnson at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) reviewing a parade during ceremonies in honor of Army Day, flanked by General Omar Bradley (far left), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (to the President's right), and an unidentified official.

title: Truman at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others review a parade during Army Day ceremonies. Seated in the front row are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. Seated behind the naval officer is General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Women in Army Day Parade
Scopenote: A group of female soldiers marching in a parade commemorating Army Day passes in front of the presidential viewing box. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Military in Army Day Parade
Scopenote: Members of the military marching in the Army Day parade pass in front of the presidential viewing stand. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Military Band at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: A military band passes by the box of President Harry S. Truman during Army Day Ceremonies in Washington, D.C. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Soldiers in Army Day Parade Passing Presidential Box
Scopenote: Members of the military participating in a parade commemorating Army Day pass in front of President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries in the presidential viewing stand. In the front row of the box, from left to right: two unidentified men, President Truman, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (man not wearing a hat), General Omar Bradley, unidentified man. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and others at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others review a parade during Army Day ceremonies. Seated in the front row are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. The man in the second row between Bradley and Johnson is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Soldiers at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: Soldiers in a military band marching in a parade commemorating Army Day. Also marching in front of the band is a small dog.

title: Marchers in Army Day Parade Passing Presidential Viewing Stand
Scopenote: Soldiers passing in front of the presidential viewing stand during a parade commemorating Army Day. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Marchers in Army Day Parade
Scopenote: Female soldiers in a parade commemorating Army Day passing in front of the presidential viewing stand . Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Soldiers on Horseback In Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries observe as soldiers on horseback pass the presidential viewing stand during a parade commemorating Army Day. In the front row of the box, from left to right: two unidentified men, President Truman, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (man not wearing a hat), General Omar Bradley, unidentified man. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Others at Army Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other dignitaries seated in the presidential viewing stand at a parade commemorating Army Day. Seated in the front row are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley (partly obscured by post), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. Seated behind the naval officer is General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Soldiers Marching In Army Day Parade
Scopenote: Members of the U.S. military marching in a parade commemorating Army Day as they pass in front of the presidential viewing stand. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: Soldiers Passing Presidential Viewing Stand During Army Day Parade
Scopenote: Members of the U.S. military marching in a parade commemorating Army Day pass in front of the presidential viewing stand. Standing in the front row of the presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified Navy officer, General Omar Bradley, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, President Truman, and two unidentified men. title: Truman and Churchill at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Winston Churchill (right) outside Blair House in Washington, during Churchill's visit to the United States.

title: Truman and Churchill
Scopenote: Winston Churchill (right) flashing his "V for Victory" sign and President Harry S. Truman (left) waving outside Blair House in Washington, D.C. during Churchill's visit to the United States.

title: Vinson and Wife at Dinner for Churchill
Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left) and his wife Roberta (right) at Blair House in Washington, D.C. for a dinner in honor of Winston Churchill.

title: Churchill Arriving in Washington
Scopenote: Winston Churchill descending the train during his visit to Washington, D.C. Standing in the train behind him is Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Churchill Arriving at Blair House
Scopenote: Winston Churchill (center) arriving at a dinner held in his honor at Blair House in Washington, D.C. The man on the left is Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: A view of the front lawn of the Harry S. Truman Library, from the front steps of the Library, preparing for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Churchill Speaking at Train Station
Scopenote: Winston Churchill (center) speaking at the train station upon his arrival in Washington, D.C. Also standing at the microphones is British Ambassador to the United States, Sir Oliver Franks (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Churchill at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Winston Churchill (right) outside Blair House in Washington, D.C. during Churchill's visit to the United States.

title: Barkley Arriving For Churchill Dinner
Scopenote: Vice-President Alben Barkley (right) and his daughter, Mrs. Marian Truitt (left) arriving at the Blair House in Washington, D.C. to attend a dinner in honor of Winston Churchill's visit to the United States. The other man is unidentified.

title: Marshall Arriving at Dinner for Churchill
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State George C. Marshall arriving at the Blair House in Washington, D.C. for a dinner in honor of Winston Churchill. Other man is unidentified.

title: Truman and Photographers in Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right) in the Oval Office, posing with photographers and their winning photographs in the sixth annual contest of the White House News Photographers Association. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Photographers in Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) in the Oval Office with the winning photographers of the sixth annual contest of the White House News Photographers Association. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Photographers in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) in the Oval Office with winners of the sixth annual contest of the White House News Photographers Association. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Photographers in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right) in the Oval Office, posing with photographers and their winning photographs in the sixth annual contest of the White House News Photographers Association

title: Brazilian Flag on Display in the Oval Office
Scopenote: A Brazilian flag on display in the Oval Office, and a view of the items on the table behind President Harry S. Truman's desk, including framed photographs of the President's wife, mother, and daughter.

title: Brazilian Flag on Display in the Oval Office
Scopenote: A Brazilian flag on display in the Oval Office, and a view of the items on the table behind President Harry S. Truman's desk, including framed photographs of the President's wife, mother, and daughter.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the front lawn and front of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral for former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Activating Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at his desk in the Oval Office, preparing to push a button activating a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam, as unidentified members of Congress from a number of Western states look on.

title: President Truman Activates New Generator at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at his desk in the Oval Office, preparing to press a button activating a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam. Also present are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (foreground, right, standing next to Truman) and members of Congress from a number of Western states. Partial identification of others standing behind the president include:  Washington Congressman Walter Horan (far left); Washington Congressman Hugh B. Mitchell (third from left); Washington Senator Henry Jackson (5th from left); Ohio Congressman Michael Kirwan (2nd from right); and Oregon Congressman Homer D. Angell (far right).

title: President Truman Activates New Generator at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) is at his desk in the Oval Office, preparing to press a button activating a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam located on the Columbia River in the state of Washington. Also present are Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (at Truman's left), and many members of Congress from a number of Western states.  Identification includes:  Washington Congressman Walter Horan (4th from left); Washington Congressman Hugh B. Mitchell (6th from left); Washington Senator Henry Jackson (8th from left, directly behind Truman); Ohio Congressman Michael Kirwan (8th from right); Oregon Congressman Homer D. Angell (7th from right); Washington Senator Harry P. Cain (6th from right); Idaho Congressman John Sanborn (5th from right); Montana Senator James E. Murray (3rd from right); C. Girard Davidson, Assistant Secretary of the Interior (2nd from right); and Michael W. Straus (far right).

title: President Truman Starts Operation of New Generator at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting down) is pushing a button to start operation of a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam situated on the Columbia River in the state of Washington. He is shown at his desk in the Oval Office. Standing left to right: C. Girard Davidson, Assistant Secretary of the Interior; Julius A. Krug, Secretary of the Interior; and unidentified.

title: President Truman Activates New Generator at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) starts activating a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam located on the Columbia River in the state of Washington by pushing a button on his desk in the Oval Office. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Starts Operation at Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated at his desk in the Oval Office, preparing to push a button activating a new generator at Grand Coulee Dam, as unidentified members of Congress from a number of Western states look on.

title: Truman Seeing Acheson Off to the Paris Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with other Cabinet members at the airport, seeing Secretary of State Dean Acheson off to the Foreign Ministers Conference in Paris. From left to right: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, unidentified man, President Truman, unidentified man.

title: Acheson Preparing for Flight to Paris Conference
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) prepares for his flight to the Foreign Ministers Conference in Paris with Vice-President Alben Barkley (left) and Mrs. Alice Acheson (second from right) seeing him off. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Seeing Acheson Off to Paris Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) and his wife Alice Acheson (left) and other unidentified members of his family at the airport in Washington prior to Acheson's departure to attend a meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers in Paris.

title: Acheson Boarding Plane to Paris with Truman Seeing Him Off
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) at the airport in Washington, as Mrs. Alice Acheson looks on, just prior to Acheson's departure to attend a meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers in Paris.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of library grounds during preparations for funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman With Acheson As He Prepares To Leave For Paris
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) and his wife Alice Acheson (left) and other unidentified members of his family at the airport in Washington prior to Acheson's departure to attend a meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers in Paris.

title: Truman Seeing Acheson Off to Paris Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) at the airport in Washington, prior to Acheson's departure to attend a meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers in Paris. Others unidentified.

title: Truman With President Eurico Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (second from left) with President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (second from right) and other unidentified dignitaries, during Dutra's visit to the United States. They are giving a banquet at the Carlton Hotel in honor of President Dutra.

title: Truman Greeting Dutra As He Exits Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (shaking hands on the left) greeting President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (shaking hands on the right) as he arrives in the United States for an official visit. First Lady Bess W. Truman is standing next to President Truman, her back to the camera. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Welcoming Dutra to the United States
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (center, in light-colored suit) greeting President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left) at the airport in Washington, on the occasion of Dutra's visit to the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Welcoming Dutra to United States
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right center, in front of military officers) and President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (center) among the unidentified crowd at Washington National Airport, after President Dutra's arrival in the United States.

title: Truman Looking On As Dutra Receives Key to the City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) observes as President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left) receives a key to the city of Washington, D.C., during welcoming ceremonies after his arrival in the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra Giving a Speech at Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left) behind a podium at Washington National Airport, giving a speech for the crowd after Dutra's arrival in the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Giving a Speech at Airport with Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center on podium) giving a speech alongside President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left on podium) upon President Dutra's arrival at Washington National Airport. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Airport Walking By Parade of Military Personnel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center of picture, on left) walking with President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (center of picture, on right) reviewing a line of military personnel at Washington National Airport, upon President Dutra's arrival to the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the grounds of the Harry S. Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman at Welcoming Ceremonies for Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (center) standing at attention with other dignitaries during welcoming ceremonies for President Dutra in Washington, D.C. General Harry Vaughan is on the left. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman at Ceremony for Dutra
Scopenote: First Lady Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (seated, third from left) observing the ceremony welcoming Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (extreme left, at microphones) to Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Giving Speech at Ceremony for Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) making a speech at the ceremony welcoming Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (seated to the left of podium, second from right) to Washington, D.C. Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (seated to right of podium, third from left), General Harry Vaughan (seated, first row behind railing, second from left), and unidentified others are in attendance.

title: Truman and Dutra Sampling Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (right) sampling a birthday cake decorated with Brazilian and United States flags, during welcoming ceremonies for President Dutra in Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra at Welcoming Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) with President Eurico Dutra (left) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (right) at welcoming ceremonies for President Dutra. Admiral Robert Dennison is in white Navy uniform, standing behind Mrs. Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra at Welcoming Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (top of stairs, on right) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (left) with President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (top of stairs, on left) and other unidentified dignitaries, during President Dutra's visit to Washington, D.C.

title: Visit of President Dutra to Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (second from right) at the gravesite of George Washington at Mount Vernon, during his visit to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: President Dutra at Washington's Tomb
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (left) and unidentified dignitaries and military personnel paying their respects at the tomb of George Washington at Mount Vernon.

title: Dutra Outside Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (foreground, center) with two other unidentified dignitaries, outside George Washington's home at Mount Vernon during his visit to the United States.

title: President Dutra at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left) visiting George Washington's home, Mount Vernon, with an unidentified dignitary.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: this is a view of the grounds of the Harry S. Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. This is the back of the Library, along Mechanic Street. All people are unidentified.

title: President Dutra Signs Guestbook
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (seated) signs the guestbook at Mount Vernon, George Washington's home, as unidentified dignitaries and military personnel stand around him observing.

title: President Dutra at Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra placing a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. All others are unidentified.

title: Paying Respects at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (foreground, right) and unidentified military personnel paying their respects at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Dignitaries at Dutra Dinner
Scopenote: Unidentified dignitaries in attendance at the dinner given by President Harry S. Truman in honor of Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra.

title: Truman Standing With Dutra in Receiving Line
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (second from left) with Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (second from right) and other dignitaries in a receiving line. They are attending a dinner given in honor of President Dutra by President Truman at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra Standing in Formal Attire
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right), Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (third from left), President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (second from right), and other unidentified dignitaries attending a banquet hosted by President Truman in honor of President Dutra's visit to the United States. The banquet took place at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Dignitaries at Banquet
Scopenote: Crowd of unidentified dignitaries and guests at banquet table. They are attending a banquet at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C., hosted by President Harry S. Truman in honor of Brazilian President Eurico Dutra's visit to the United States.

title: Crowd at Dinner for President Dutra
Scopenote: Crowd of unidentified dignitaries and guests at banquet table. They are attending a banquet at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C., hosted by President Harry S. Truman in honor of Brazilian President Eurico Dutra's visit to the United States.

title: President Dutra Receiving Dignitaries
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (back line, third from left) standing in a receiving line, shaking hands with dignitaries and guests. He is attending a dinner given in his honor by President Harry S. Truman at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Dutra Shaking Hands with Dignitary
Scopenote: Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (second from left) standing in a receiving line, shaking hands with dignitaries and guests. He is attending a dinner given in his honor by President Harry S. Truman at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Military Band in Preparation for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: A military band practices on the lawn of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra Cutting Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (center) and President Harry S. Truman (left) cutting a birthday cake during a ceremony welcoming President Dutra to the United States. Others are unidentified.

title: Dutra in a Crowd Talking to Woman
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (second from left) talking to woman in the middle of a crowd of dignitaries and guests. He is attending a dinner given in his honor by President Harry S. Truman at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: Donaldson at Dutra Banquet
Scopenote: Dignitaries, including Postmaster General Jesse  Donaldson (third from right) and his wife, Mrs. Nell Donaldson (second from right). They are attending a banquet at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C., hosted by President Harry S. Truman in honor of Brazilian President Eurico Dutra's visit to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Dutra at Mount Vernon
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (right) standing outside of Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington, with an unidentified dignitary.

title: Truman at Dutra's Welcoming Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) observing Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (center) receiving a key to the city of Washington, D.C. during his welcoming ceremony. Others around him are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra at Welcoming Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (center), standing at attention during ceremonies welcoming President Dutra to Washington, D.C. On the left is General Harry  Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra at Attention During Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Brazilian President Eurico Dutra (center), standing at attention during ceremonies welcoming President Dutra to Washington, D.C. On the far left is General Harry Vaughan. Standing behind President Truman (mostly obscured) is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra Giving Speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (on podium, on the right) and President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (on podium, on left) giving speech to crowd at airport. Others are unidentified.

title: Dignitaries Stepping From Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at Washington National Airport, greeting President Eurico Gaspar Dutra and members of his party upon their arrival in Washington, D.C.  First Lady Bess Truman is near the center, wearing the dark hat with her back to the camera. President Truman is near the steps of the plane, standing between two military officers (mostly obscured). President Dutra is likely the man descending the stairs, wearing the pinstriped suit and hat. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Dutra in Receiving Line
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (third from left) with President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (second from right) and other unidentified dignitaries, during President Dutra's visit to the United States. They are giving a banquet at the Carlton Hotel in honor of President Dutra.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: this is a view of the front lawn and front of Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. This view is taken from near Pleasant Street and Highway 24.

title: Truman and Dutra at Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at Washington National Airport, greeting Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra and other members of his party upon their arrival in Washington, D.C. President Truman is in the group on the left, wearing a hat. President Dutra is standing on the left of Mr. Truman, wearing a pinstriped suit and gray, cropped hair. All others are unidentified.

title: Krug and Dignitaries at Dutra Banquet
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (second from left) standing with other unidentified guests at a banquet given by President Harry S. Truman in honor of President Eurico Gaspar Dutra of Brazil. The banquet was held at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Johnson and Others at Dutra Banquet
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (second from left) standing with other unidentified guests at a banquet given by President Harry S. Truman in honor of President Eurico Gaspar Dutra of Brazil. The banquet was held at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Dutra Shaking Hands with Military Officer
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (left) shaking hands with military officer. All others are unidentified.

title: Dutra Visiting the United States
Scopenote: President Eurico Dutra of Brazil (back seat of car holding up his hat) and President Harry S. Truman (back seat of car, right)  departing Washington National Airport after President Dutra's arrival. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman preparing to board an airplane at Washington National Airport for his vacation trip to Florida. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: This is a view of the front lawn and front of Truman Library during preparations for funeral of Former President Harry S. Truman. The flag is flying at half-staff. This view is taken from near Pleasant Street and Highway 24.

Scopenote: Margaret Truman (standing) at a press conference for her concert at Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: The United States flag and flags for the branches of the military are in the lobby of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receiving a Turkey For Thanksgiving
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) receiving a Thanksgiving turkey from members of the Poultry and Egg National Board and other representatives of the turkey industry, outside the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receiving Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from left) receiving a Thanksgiving turkey from members of the Poultry and Egg National Board and other representatives of the turkey industry, outside the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receives Turkey at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) observes a turkey at White House. He has received the turkey from members of the Poultry and Egg National Board and other representatives of the turkey industry who are present. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Pets Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) pets a Thanksgiving turkey that is a gift to him from members of the Poultry and Egg National Board and other representatives of the turkey industry. They are standing outside the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receives Turkey at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) looking on as representatives of the turkey industry exhibit the Thanksgiving turkey they have presented to the President, outside the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receiving Report from United Nations Committee Members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) in the Oval Office, receiving a report on the work of the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF), prepared by the United States Committee for UNICEF. From left to right: Under Secretary of State James Webb; Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson; the President; Mary (Mrs. Oswald B.) Lord, chairman of the U.S. Committee for UNICEF; Miss Katharine Lenroot, chief of the Children's Bureau and U.S. delegate to UNICEF; and Dallas Dort, Special Assistant to the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs.

title: Truman Greeting the Shah of Iran
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left center, bottom of stairs, back to camera) shaking hands with the Shah of Iran (right center, at the bottom of the stairs) upon the Shah's arrival at Washington National Airport. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Shaking Hands with the Shah of Iran
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) and the Shah of Iran (foreground, left) shaking hands at Washington National Airport upon the Shah's arrival in the United States, with the President's airplane, "The Independence" (which had brought the Shah to Washington) in the background. General Harry Vaughan is on the far left. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and the Shah of Iran at Airport
Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (left) speaking at Washington National Airport, during ceremonies welcoming him to the United States, as President Harry S. Truman (right) looks on. President Truman's plane, The Independence, is in the background.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, wearing hat), Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left, with moustache), and other dignitaries at the airport for the arrival of the Shah of Iran. General Harry Vaughan is on the far left. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: This is a view of the grounds of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Dignitaries Waiting for Shah of Iran's Arrival

In the foreground on the right are Admiral Robert Dennison (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right). In the center foreground are (left to right) Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, and Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson. Others are unidentified.

Young (right) and other unidentified dignitaries at ceremonies welcoming the Shah to Washington, during his visit to the United States.

The Shah had just arrived for a State Visit to Washington, D.C.

title: Truman and the Shah of Iran Shaking Hands at Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) shaking hands with the Shah of Iran (foreground, right) at a ceremony welcoming the Shah to Washington, D.C. Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (front row, left) visiting George Washington's home, Mount Vernon, with a group of unidentified dignitaries during his visit to the United States.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (left) outside George Washington's home on his estate, Mount Vernon, with an unidentified dignitary during his tour of the United States.

title: Preparation for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: The United States flag is flaying at half-staff during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. This photo was taken from the sidewalk coming up to the entrance of the Library.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (sitting) writes signs the guestbook at George Washington's home, Mount Vernon, while an unidentified man looks on.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (front center) and other unidentified military personnel standing at attention outside George Washington's home, Mount Vernon.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (partly obscured by lines of soldiers) placing a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (left) walking at the front procession of unidentified military personnel at an unknown monument in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and the Shah of Iran (right) in the Oval Office during the Shah's visit to the United States.

Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (left) with Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court Fred Vinson (second from left) a banquet in honor of the Shah of Iran's visit to the United States.

Scopenote: This is a view of the replica of the Liberty Bell on the grounds of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. The person near the Bell is unidentified.

Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and the Shah of Iran in a receiving line at a dinner given in honor of the Shah's visit to the United States.

Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified dignitaries and guests dressed in formal wear at a dinner in honor of the visit of the Shah of Iran to the United States.

All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Welcome His Majesty the Shah of Iran banner over Pennsylvania Avenue. This banner was up during the ceremonies welcoming the Shah to Washington, D.C. for an official visit.

Scopenote: The Shah of Iran (fifth from right) with unidentified officials at George Washington's home, Mount Vernon, Virginia.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with the Shah of Iran (right) in the Oval Office.

title: Truman Greets Prime Minister of India
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India upon Nehru's arrival at Washington National Airport, while the Prime Minister's daughter, Indira Gandhi, disembarks from the President's airplane, "The Independence."  Madam Pandit, Nehru's sister, is standing next to President Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Photographers and television camera crews set up cameras on the roof of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Shaking Hands With Prime Minister Nehru
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) shaking hands with the Prime Minister of India, Jawaharlal Nehru (foreground, second from right), upon Nehru's arrival at Washington National Airport. With them are the Prime Minister's sister, Madame Pandit (second from left) and daughter, Indira Gandhi (foreground, right). In the background, far right, is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Prime Minister Nehru Speaking to Reporters
Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (at microphone) speaking to reporters with President Harry S. Truman standing to the right.  Prime Minister Nehru just arrived at Washington National Airport on President Truman's airplane, "The Independence," which is in the background. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Prime Minister Nehru Inspecting Troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (walking toward camera, left) and Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (right) are inspecting troops at Washington National Airport.  Others are unidentified.

title: Prime Minister Nehru Addressing Reporters
Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India is addressing reporters after landing in Washington, D.C. for an official visit. President Harry S. Truman is to his right. The presidential plane "Independence" is in the background. Others are unidentified.

title: Nehru and Truman Waving From Limousine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right) and Indian Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (left), with Nehru's sister, Madam Pandit (back seat, center), waving from their limousine as they leave Washington National Airport, during Nehru's visit to the United States. In the background is President Truman's plane, the "Independence."

title: Nehru at Gravesite of George Washington
Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India, exiting the gravesite of George Washington at Mount Vernon after paying his respects.  Madam Pandit and Indira Gandhi (nearest the gate) wait for him outside. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (left), his sister, Madame Pandit (right), and daughter Indira Gandhi (second from left) on the front lawn of George Washington's home, Mount Vernon, Virginia.  Unidentified woman in hat.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India (left), with his sister, Madam Pandit (right), and daughter Indira Gandhi (second from left), standing outside George Washington's house during their tour of Mount Vernon. Unidentified woman in hat.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (foreground, center) speaking for a Voice of America recording during his visit to George Washington's home, Mount Vernon. Madame Pandit is to the left of Nehru. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Stanchions are set up on the front steps of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India and his sister Madam Pandit pose for a photograph on the steps of Mount Vernon. Unidentified woman in hat in foreground.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (third from left) and his daughter Indira Gandhi (right) converse with two unidentified people on the lawn at George Washington's home, Mount Vernon.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India, laying a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. Others are unidentified.

title: Prime Minister Nehru with Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru of India (left) with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right) during Nehru's visit to the United States. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru (foreground, second from left) and Indira Gandhi (foreground, right) talking with an unidentified woman on the lawn at George Washington's home, Mount Vernon.  Madam Pandit is talking with an unidentified man in the left background. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Poses for Cartoonists
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, back to camera) poses for 40 cartoonists at the White House, who were in Washington, D.C. at the invitation of the Unites States Treasury. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman with Cartoonists at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left center, facing camera) poses for 40 cartoonists at the White House who are drawing sketches of him. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Glancing at Cartoonists' Work
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman takes a look at several cartoon drawings of himself when 40 cartoonists visit the White House. From left to right: Ham Fisher, President Truman, Alex Raymond, and Milt Caniff. Others in background are unidentified.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: An unidentified cameraman carries in equipment as the Truman Library prepares for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Posing With Finished Cartoon Portraits
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, wearing glasses) posing outside the White House with a group of visiting cartoonists, as they exhibit the sketches they have just made of the President. The cartoonists holding up drawings are: Ham Fisher (left), Milton Caniff (behind Fisher), Alex Raymond (behind Truman), Jo Fischer (behind Truman's left shoulder), Ray Van Buren (standing behind Pieretti), Alfred Andriola (standing at Mr. Truman's left, wearing bow tie), John Pieretti (second from right), Rube Goldberg (right), and Gus Edson (kneeling, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses With Completed Cartoon Portraits
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, glasses) posing outside the White House with a group of visiting cartoonists, as they exhibit the sketches they have just made of the President. Those holding up drawings, from left to right: Ham Fisher (partly cut off), Milton Caniff, Alex Raymond, Jo Fischer (over Truman's left shoulder), Alfred Andriola (bow tie, next to Truman), Ray Van Buren (next to Fischer), John Pieretti, and Rube Goldberg. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Standing for Cartoonists
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right, back to camera) posing outside the White House for a group of visiting cartoonists, as they sketch his portrait. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receiving National Football League Pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) at his desk in the Oval Office, receiving his annual pass to National Football League games from Bert Bell, Commissioner of the National Football League (center), and George Marshall, owner of the Washington Redskins.

title: Truman Receiving National Football League Pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving his annual pass to National Football League games from Bert Bell, Commissioner of the National Football League (center), and George Marshall (right), owner of the Washington Redskins.

title: Truman Accepting National Football League Pass
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) in the Oval Office, receiving his annual pass to National Football League games from Bert Bell, Commissioner of the National Football League (center), and George P. Marshall, owner of the Washington Redskins.

title: President Truman with National Football League Commissioner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receiving his annual pass to National Football League games from Bert Bell, Commissioner of the National Football League (center), and George P. Marshall, owner of the Washington Redskins.

title: Tom C. Clark Sworn In as Associate Justice
