Truman (center) looking on. Standing in the background are, from left to right: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (partly obscured by Vinson), Vice-President Alben Barkley, and Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson.

title: Tom C. Clark Being Sworn In
Scopenote: Tom C. Clark (foreground, left) sworn in as Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court by Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson (foreground, right) with President Harry S. Truman (center) looking on. Standing in the background are, from left to right: Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (partly obscured), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, and Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson.

title: Truman Shaking Hands with Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Tom Clark in the White House Rose Garden, on the occasion of Clark's taking the oath of office as an Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court. From left to right: Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Associate Justice Tom Clark, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Vice-President Alben Barkley, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, President Truman, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson.

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the Truman Library from the intersection of Highway 24 and Delaware Street during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Congratulating Tom C. Clark
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with newly sworn in Associate Justice Tom C. Clark. From left to right: Justice Clark, Vice President Alben Barkley, Attorney General J. Howard McGrath, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, President Truman, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson.

title: Tom Clark Sworn In as Associate Justice
Scopenote: Tom C. Clark (foreground, left) sworn in as Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court by Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson (foreground, right) with President Harry S. Truman (center)] looking on. Standing in the background are, from left to right: Georgia Clark (wife of Ramsey Clark), Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Mrs. Tom Clark (Mary Ramsey), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson.

title: Vinson Swearing In Tom Clark as Associate Justice
Scopenote: Former Attorney General Tom C. Clark (foreground, left) being sworn in as Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court by Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson (foreground, right).  President Harry S. Truman (center) watches. Standing in the background are, from left to right: unidentified woman, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Secretary of Commerce Louis Johnson, remainder unidentified.

title: Truman Signing North Atlantic Treaty Proclamation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs a proclamation declaring into effect the 12-nation North Atlantic Pact. They are in the Oval Office.   Witnessing the signing are, from left to right: Sir Frederic Hoyer-Millar of the United Kingdom; Ambassador Henrik de Kauffmann of Denmark; Canadian Embassy Counselor W. D. Matthews; Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson; Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe de Morgenstierne of Norway; Ambassador Henri Bonnet of France; Baron Robert Silvercruys, Ambassador of Belgium; Ambassador Pedro Pereira of Portugal (partly obscured by Acheson); Secretary of State Dean Acheson; Netherlands Minister Jonkheer Otto Reuchlin; and Italian Embassy Counselor Mario Lucielli.

title: Truman Signs North Atlantic Treaty Proclamation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs a proclamation declaring into effect the 12-nation North Atlantic Pact. They are in the Oval Office. Witnessing the signing are, from left to right: Sir Frederic Hoyer-Millar of the United Kingdom; Ambassador Henrik de Kauffmann of Denmark; Canadian Embassy Counselor W. D. Matthews; Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson; Ambassador Wilhelm Munthe de Morgenstierne of Norway; Ambassador Henri Bonnet of France; Baron Robert Silvercruys, Ambassador of Belgium; Ambassador Pedro Pereira of Portugal (partly obscured by Acheson); Secretary of State Dean Acheson; Netherlands Minister Jonkheer Otto Reuchlin; and Italian Embassy Counselor Mario Lucielli.

title: Truman Exiting Plane in Miami
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (waving his hat) disembarking from his airplane, "The Independence," during a trip to Miami to speak at the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars. Behind President Truman are General Robert Landry (closest to Truman), General Harry Vaughan (behind Landry), and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry Truman Arrives at Miami Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) is shown shaking hands with Secretary of Defense Louis A. Johnson as the president arrives in Miami, Florida to speak at the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars.  Standing directly in back of the two is Under Secretary of Defense Stephen T. Early. Others are unidentified. The presidential airplane, "Independence" is in background.

title: Truman and Louis Johnson in Miami
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) showing Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (foreground, left) the inside of a book.  President Truman and Secretary Johnson were in Miami for the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman in Miami
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiling and pointing to his watch upon arrival in Miami. He traveled to Miami to deliver a speech at the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman After His Arrival in Miami
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiling and pointing to his watch upon his arrival in Miami. He traveled to Miami to deliver a speech at the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars. The bottom of the photo is inscribed by President Truman: "To Abbie Rowe, a good, careful "one more club" member with kindest regards. Harry S. Truman."

title: Preparations for Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the Truman Library during preparations for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. A car is partly blocking the driveway to the Library, and an unidentified guard is standing outside the car.

title: Truman with Cabinet at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with his Cabinet, in the rear dining room at Blair House. Seated, left to right: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; the President; Vice-President Alben Barkley; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark. Standing, left to right: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; and Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signing National Security Act Amendment of 1949
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is seated at his desk in the Oval Office, signing H.R. 5632, the National Security Act Amendments of 1949, which converted the National Military Establishment into a new Department of Defense and made other changes in the national security system. From left to right: Senator Virgil Chapman, unidentified (behind Chapman), Senator Richard Russell, Admiral Louis Denfelt, Senator Leverett Saltonstall (behind Denfeld), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (leaning over the desk), General Omar Bradley, General Hoyt Vandenberg, Congressman Dewey Short, Congressman Carl Vinson, Secretary of the Army Gordon Gray, Senator Millard Tydings, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, Under Secretary of Defense Stephen Early, and Secretary of the Navy Francis Matthews.

title: Truman Signing National Security Act Amendments
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office, signing the National Security Act Amendments of 1949 which converted the National Military Establishment into a new Department of Defense and made other changes in the national security system. Standing, from left to right: unidentified Army officer, Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (leaning on desk) General Omar Bradley (mostly obscured by Johnson), unidentified Army officer, Congressman Dewey Short, Congressman Carl Vinson, Secretary of the Army Gordon Gray, unidentified, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington.

title: Truman Signing National Security Amendments Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, seated behind his desk, distributes pens he used to sign the National Security Act Amendments bill to assembled on-lookers. From left to right: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, unidentified, Congressman Dewey Short, Congressman Carl Vinson, Secretary of the Army Gordon Gray, unidentified, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, Under Secretary of Defense Stephen Early, and Secretary of the Navy Francis Matthews.

title: Truman Holding National Security Act Amendments
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office, displaying the National Security Act Amendments of 1949, which he had just signed.

title: President Truman Signs National Security Amendments Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the Oval Office, signing H.R. 5632, the National Security Act Amendments of 1949, which converted the National Military Establishment into a new Department of Defense and made other changes in the national security system. From left to right: Senator Virgil Chapman, unidentified (behind Chapman), Senator Richard Russell, unidentified military officer, unidentified man (behind officer), Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, General Omar Bradley, unidentified, Congressman Dewey Short, Congressman Carl Vinson, Secretary of the Army Gordon Gray, unidentified, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington (partly obscured), Under Secretary of Defense Stephen Early, and Secretary of the Navy Francis Matthews.

title: Truman Receives Passes to All-American Football Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in the Oval Office, receiving a gold pass to all games of the All-America Football Conference during the 1949 season. From left to right: Robert Embry of the Baltimore Colts; President Truman; Commodore O. O. Kessing, Commissioner of the All-America Football Conference; and Walter Driskill, President and General Manager of the Baltimore Colts.

title: Truman Receives Pass to All-America Football Conference Games

From left to right: Robert Embry of the Baltimore Colts; the President; Commodore O. O. Kessing, Commissioner of the All-America Football Conference; and Walter Driskill, President and General Manager of the Baltimore Colts.

Murphy, Administrative Assistant to the President; David E. Bell, Special Assistant in the White House Office; Leon H. Keyserling, Vice Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers; Robert C. Turner, consultant on the White House staff; Edwin G. Nourse, Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers; and John D. Clark, member of the Council of Economic Advisers.

title: Council of Economic Advisers Prepare 1949 Midyear Report
Scopenote: Members of the Council of Economic Advisers and White House staff members working on the President's Midyear Economic Report in the Cabinet Room. From left to right: Charles S. Turner, consultant on the White House staff; Edwin G. Nourse, Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers; and John D. Clark, member of the Council of Economic Advisers.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman outside the Lincoln Memorial, during ceremonies commemorating Lincoln's Birthday. From left to right: General Robert Landry, unidentified man, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, unidentified man, and General Harry Vaughan.

title: Truman at Lincoln Memorial Wreath-Laying Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right), First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left) and other unidentified dignitaries attend a wreath-laying ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate Abraham Lincoln's birthday.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right), First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left) and other unidentified dignitaries attend the wreath-laying ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial, celebrating Abraham Lincoln's birthday. General Robert Landry (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right) are at the head of the group walking down the stairs.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman outside the Lincoln Memorial, during ceremonies commemorating Lincoln's Birthday. From left to right, General Harry Vaughan, unidentified, President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, unidentified, General Robert Landry.

title: Masonic Case Exhibit at Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the Masonic case in the exhibit area of the Truman Library, showing items related to former President Harry S. Truman's Masonic memberships. Items from this case may have been removed for use during the funeral of former President Truman.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman as they enter their car to leave the Lincoln Memorial after a wreath-laying ceremony commemorating Lincoln's birthday. On the left is General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

All others are unidentified.  See also 65-2254.

All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With a Congressional Medal of Honor Recipient and Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) awards the Congressional Medal of Honor to World War II veteran Colonel Justice M. Chambers, United States Marine Corps Reserve for gallant action on Iwo Jima, February, 1945. Also present is Secretary of Defense George Marshall (front row, left). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With a Congressional Medal of Honor Recipient and Family
Scopenote: Marine Colonel Justice M. Chambers of Rockville, Maryland, holds his seven month old twins, Peter and Paul, while President Harry S. Truman (left) is shaking hands with one of the youngsters. President Truman has just awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to Col. Chambers for gallantry at Iwo Jima, Volcano Islands, February 19-22, 1945, during World War II.  On the right is Mrs. Chambers and behind her is General Clifton B. Cates, Commandant of the Marine Corps. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With a Congressional Medal of Honor Recipient and Family

title: Funeral Services for Leslie Coffelt

All others are unidentified.

Howard McGrath (left of Acheson), French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet (between Marshall and Truman), and Secretary of State Dean Acheson (between Truman and Auriol, partly obscured). Standing in the front row, on the right side of the microphones, from left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman, French First Lady Michelle (Mrs. Vincent) Auriol, unidentified woman, Helle (Mrs. Henri) Bonnet, Margaret Truman, Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson), Estelle (Mrs. J. Howard) McGrath, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, and unidentified woman. All others are unidentified.

Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

Howard McGrath,  Secretary of Defense George Marshall, French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet, Vice President Alben Barkley, President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, French President Auriol, French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman, and District Commissioner John R. Young. In the background, visible between Ambassador Bonnet and Vice President Barkley is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

Howard McGrath, Secretary of Defense George Marshall, French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet (partly obscured), Vice President Alben Barkley, French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman, President Truman, District Commissioner John R. Young, and an unidentified man. Seated on the right side of the podium is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Visiting With President Auriol and Others

Truman (seated, left) with French President Vincent Auriol (seated, right) in the Oval Office, as President Auriol examines a book containing photographs of monuments given to the United States by France, presented to him by Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman. title: Dignitaries at Auriol's Visit to Hyde Park
Scopenote: Officials arrive in Hyde Park, New York, during French President Vincent Auriol's visit. Left to right: Dr. Paul J. Raver, Administrator, Bonneville Power Administration; unidentified; unidentified; Arthur E. Demaray, Director, National Park Service; William J. Dougherty, Director of Information, Department of the Interior; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt During Auriol Visit
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt poses with guests in front of a portrait of the late president Franklin D. Roosevelt during the visit of French President Vincent Auriol to Roosevelt home in Hyde Park, New York. From left to right: Elliott Roosevelt; Minnewa (Mrs. Elliott) Roosevelt; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Eleanor Roosevelt; Arthur Demaray, Director, National Park Service; and Dr. Paul J. Raver, Administrator, Bonneville Power Administration.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt During Auriol Visit
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (center) poses with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) and former Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau during the visit of French President Vincent Auriol to the Roosevelt home in Hyde Park, New York.

title: President Truman at a Baseball Game, Griffith Stadium

Standing in the front row behind the Presidential seal, from left to right: Bess Truman; Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley; President Truman, Fred Vinson. The first three men in the second row are (left to right) Admiral Robert Dennison, General Harry Vaughan, and Special Assistant Averell Harriman. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Throws First Ball 1951 Opener
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman prepares to throw the first pitch at the 1951 opening game at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D.C. In the first row are, from left to right: two unidentified men, Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, Washington Senators manager Bucky Harris, Senators President Clark Griffith, and New York Yankees manager Casey Stengel. Standing behind and between Griffith and Stengel is United States Supreme Court Justice Fred Vinson. In the second row are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Harry Vaughan (behind Mrs. Barkley), Special Assistant Averell Harriman (behind Mrs. Truman), and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (behind Harris). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman With a Group of Boy Scouts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) receiving a group of Boy Scouts at the White House in celebration of National Boy Scout Week. All others are unidentified.

Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

title: Truman With Boy Scouts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) receives a "Report to the Nation" from a group of Boy Scouts in the Oval Office. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Leaves For Vacation
Scopenote: A crowd gathers around the presidential airplane, The Independence, as President Harry S. Truman (standing at the base of the stairs) prepares to depart for vacation in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: The Presidential Airplane, The Independence, en route to Key West, Florida.

Scopenote: Presidential airplane, The Independence.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor

From left to right: unidentified Army officer; Korean War Medal of Honor recipient Sergeant John A. Pittman, President Truman, Secretary of Defense George Marshall, and unidentified Army officer. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with Korean War veterans after presenting each of them the Congressional Medal of Honor in the Oval Office at the White House. From left to right: Senator Earle Clements of Kentucky (partly obscured); Senator Hugh Butler of Nebraska; Governor Lawrence Wetherby of Kentucky; First Lieutenant Carl Dodd, Kenvir, Kentucky; President Truman; Sergeant John A. Pittman, Carrolton, Mississippi; Master Sergeant Ernest R. Kouma, Dwight, Nebraska; and Secretary of Defense George C. Marshall. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Conference at the Department of the Interior
Scopenote: Officials gather for the Conference of the Industry Advisory Councils in the auditorium at the Department of the Interior. Industry advisory councils were appointed by the Secretary of the Interior and represented the petroleum, gas, minerals, bituminous coal, coke, mining machinery, electric utility, and canned fish industries.

title: Truman Receiving Piano
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, foreground) at the White House receiving a piano from the Piano Manufacturers Association. The piano was constructed from materials furnished by many member states of the United Nations in honor of National Music Week. All others unidentified.

title: Father Lembcke Leads Former President Harry S. Truman's Casket
Scopenote: Father John H. Lembcke, Jr., the officiating minister of the funeral of Harry S. Truman, leads the procession up the steps of the Truman Presidential Library. The casket is being placed in the lobby of the Library to allow visitors to pay their respects prior to the burial. The pallbearers are identified, front to rear right side: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

title: Truman Receiving Piano
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, foreground) at the White House receiving a piano from the Piano Manufacturers Association.  The piano was constructed from materials furnished by many member states of the United Nations in honor of National Music Week. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Plays Piano
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) plays the piano presented to him by the Piano Manufacturers Association at the White House in honor of National Music Week.  All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Plays Piano
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a piano at the White House for National Music Week, May, 1951.  The piano was constructed as a joint and cooperative work of all the members of the Piano Manufacturers Association. The materials that went into its production came from many of the member states of the United Nations.

Scopenote: A banner over a street in Washington, D.C. welcomes President Galo Plaza of Ecuador to the United States.

title: Truman Greets President Plaza of Ecuador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets President Galo Plaza of Ecuador (right) upon his arrival at Washington National Airport. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet participate in welcoming ceremonies for President Galo Plaza of Ecuador at Washington National Airport. Standing in line, from left to right: Vice President Alben Barkley, Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of Defense George Marshall, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Attorney General J. Howard McGrath, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, and the Ambassador from Ecuador Luis Antonio Penaherrera. All others are unidentified.

title: Honor Guard Carries Former President Harry S. Truman's Casket
Scopenote: The Honor Guard carries the casket of former president Harry S. Truman up the stairs to the Truman Library. Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

title: Cabinet Officials Greet President Plaza of Ecuador
Scopenote: Officials wait to greet President Galo Plaza of Ecuador upon his arrival at Washington National Airport. Standing in line, from left to right: unidentified man, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Attorney General J. Howard McGrath, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of Defense George Marshall, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. On the right is Secretary of State Dean Acheson. President Plaza is visible between Postmaster General Donaldson and Secretary Marshall, shaking hands with Attorney General McGrath. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Welcomes President Plaza of Ecuador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) looks on as President Galo Plaza of Ecuador (left) addresses the crowd upon his arrival at Washington National Airport.

Truman (front row, sixth from left) and President Galo Plaza of Ecuador (seventh from left) listen to remarks at ceremonies welcoming President Plaza to the United States. Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) confers with President Galo Plaza of Ecuador (right) in the Oval Office.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Galo Plaza of Ecuador (right) confer in the Oval Office.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, second from left) receives a gold key from Marjorie Nold of Savannah, Missouri (left) and Richard Golob of Sunnyside, Washington (second from right) during a visit by 4-H members to the White House.  All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Arrives at Carter Barron Amphitheater

title: Guests Gather at Carter Barron Amphitheater Dedication

title: Guests Gather at Dedication of Carter Barron Amphitheater

title: Honor Guard Carrying Former President Harry S. Truman's Casket
Scopenote: Members of the Honor Guard carry the casket of former president Harry S. Truman up the steps of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The casket lay in state in the lobby of the Library until the funeral on December 28, 1972. The pallbearers are identified, front to rear right side: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

Also present is Under Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett (bald man in back row, fourth from left). Others are unidentified.

Truman (left) presents First Lieutenant Henry Commiskey (right) of the United States Marine Corps with the Medal of Honor for heroism in Korea in a Rose Garden ceremony.  Commiskey's family looks on. Also present is Under Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett (bald man, third row, second from left). Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Receives Rock of Corregidor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (2nd from right) receives a rock from the Fort Corregidor as a gift from the people of the Philippines in ceremonies at the White House. Also present is Ambassador of the Philippines Joaquin Elizalde (right), and Colonel Harry Peck (foreground, left) and Major Manuel Acosta (third from left), both survivors of the Bataan Death March. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Receives Rock of Corregidor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) in the Oval Office, accepting as a gift from the people of the Philippines a rock from Corregidor. The Rock was presented by a delegation including the Ambassador from the Philippines to the United States, Joaquin Elizalde (fifth from left); Colonel Harry Peck, a survivor of the Bataan Death march (second from left); and Major Manuel Acosta, a Filipino veteran who lost his arm (third from right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Receives Rock from Fort Corregidor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (facing camera, fourth from left) in the Oval Office, posing for photographers as he accepted as a gift from the people of the Philippines a rock from Corregidor. The Rock was presented by a delegation including the Ambassador from the Philippines to the United States, Joaquin Elizalde (facing camera, fifth from left); Colonel Harry Peck, a survivor of the Bataan Death march (second from left); and Major Manuel Acosta, a Filipino veteran who lost his arm (third from right). All others are unidentified.

Averell Harriman. All others are unidentified.

Foreground, from left to right: President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Director of Mutual Security W. Averell Harriman (slightly behind Acheson), Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (mostly obscured), and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. All other unidentified.

title: Dean Acheson and Others at Truman Speech

Truman from the Coast Guard cutter Courier.  President Truman gave a speech transmitted over the Voice of America and directed to countries behind the Iron Curtain. All others are unidentified.

title: Coast Guard Cutter Courier
Scopenote: Members of the Coast Guard with the cutter Courier, a floating radio transmitter used to air messages from the Voice of America.  President Harry S. Truman gave a speech that was transmitted in part through the Courier.

title: Dean Acheson Speaking From the Deck of the Courier
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson speaking from the deck of the Coast Guard cutter Courier.  The Courier is a floating radio transmitter, used to broadcast messages over the Voice of America.

title: President Truman Speaking Aboard the Courier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking from the deck of the Coast Guard cutter Courier, a floating radio transmitter used by the Voice of America.  President Truman's speech regarding the Soviet Union and Communism was broadcast over the Voice of America and translated into 45 different languages.

title: President Truman Speaking Aboard the Courier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking from the deck of the Coast Guard cutter Courier, a floating radio transmitter used by the Voice of America.  President Truman's speech regarding the Soviet Union and Communism was broadcast over the Voice of America and translated into 45 different languages.

title: President Truman with Captain of Courier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with the captain of the Coast Guard cutter Courier, Captain Oscar C. B. Wev (right).  The Courier is a floating radio transmitter used by the Voice of America.  The man on the left is unidentified, but may be Dr. Wilson Compton, Administrator of the U. S. International Information Administration.

title: Truman and Acheson Depart Airport

Truman (center, partially obscured, back to camera) greets dignitaries traveling with British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (foreground) upon their arrival at Washington National Airport. Behind Eden and to the right is British Ambassador to the United States Oliver Franks. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), Mrs. Bess Truman (foreground, second from left) and Margaret Truman (foreground, left) greet Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (foreground, second from right) and her husband, Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh (foreground, right), upon their arrival at Washington National Airport. In the background on the far left are Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder and Mrs. Evlyn Snyder. All others are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth and Prince Philip Arrive at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center right, partially obscured), Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center), and Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh (center left) greet Cabinet members upon their arrival at Washington National Airport. Prince Philip is shaking hands with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman. Margaret Truman (foreground left) and Mrs. Bess Truman (foreground right) look on. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman and Princess Elizabeth Address Crowd
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (left) address the crowd gathered for the Princess's arrival at Washington National Airport. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman, Princess Elizabeth, and Prince Philip at Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center), and Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh (right) receive a salute from members of the armed forces at Washington National Airport.

title: President Truman and Princess Elizabeth Review Troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center right) are followed by Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh (directly behind Princess Elizabeth) during a review of troops at Washington National Airport.  All others unidentified.

title: Arrival of the Hearse at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of the military and a camera crew await the arrival of the hearse at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth and President Truman Ride in Motorcade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) rides with Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (left) in an open limousine upon the princess's arrival at Washington National Airport. Others are unidentified.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman Ride with Prince Philip
Scopenote: From left to right in the back seat, Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh , First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Margaret Truman ride in an open limousine after the arrival of Princess Elizabeth and Prince Philip at Washington National Airport. Others are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth Leaves Mount Vernon
Scopenote: Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom and her husband, Prince Philip, exit George Washington's Mount Vernon home into a waiting car during their visit to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd at Mount Vernon for Princess Elizabeth's Visit
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on the lawn at George Washington's Mount Vernon estate on the occasion of Princess Elizabeth's visit. Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, is on the left in the foreground, with his back to the camera. Princess Elizabeth is second from the right in the foreground, back to camera. All others are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth and Truman at Gifts Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center) approach the platform for a presentation of gifts ceremony at the White House. They are followed by First Lady Bess W. Truman and Prince Philip. Others are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth Presents Truman with Overmantel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) receive an overmantel for the renovated White House presented by Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center right)on behalf of her father, King George VI. Prince Philip (right) looks on. The overmantel consisted of a English candelabra and a three-part mirror, with an oil painting of flowers set in a carved gilt frame. Also present is British Ambassador to the United States Oliver Franks (far left), Admiral Robert Dennison (left side of platform, fifth from right), and General Harry Vaughan (left side of platform, right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receives Gift from Princess Elizabeth
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) makes remarks during a Rose Garden ceremony in which Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center right) presented the president with a gift on behalf of her father, King George VI. First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) and Prince Philip (right) look on. The gift consisted of an overmantel paired with rare English candelabra, a three-part mirror, and oil painting of flowers set in a carved gilt frame. Also present is President Truman's Military Aide, Harry Vaughan (far left). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Receives Gift from Princess Elizabeth
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) speaks to Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (center right) during a presentation ceremony in the Rose Garden.  Princess Elizabeth presented the president with an overmantel paired with English candelabra and an oil painting of flowers set in a carved gilt frame on behalf of her father, King George VI. First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) and Prince Philip (right) look on. Also present are President Truman's Naval Aide, Admiral Robert Dennison (left side of platform, fourth from left), and Military Aide General Harry Vaughan (left side of platform, right). All others are unidentified.

title: Princess Elizabeth Leaves the White House
Scopenote: Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom (foreground, left) and her husband, Prince Philip (foreground, right) exit the White House to a crowd of onlookers during their visit to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Harriman Sworn in as Mutual Security Director
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) looks on as Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right) administers the oath of office to W. Averell Harriman (left) as the first Director of the Mutual Security Agency in an Oval Office ceremony. Also present are John Steelman (background, right), and Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (background, second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Arrival of the Hearse at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of the military line the front steps of the Truman Library awaiting the arrival of the hearse for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Congratulates Harriman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) congratulates W. Averell Harriman (left) upon his swearing-in as new Director of the Mutual Security Agency after an Oval Office ceremony. Chief Justice Fred Vinson looks on (right). Also present in the background are Under Secretary of State James Webb (second from left), Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (second from right), and John Steelman (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Harriman Sworn in as Mutual Security Director
Scopenote: Cameras gather in the Oval Office around President Harry S. Truman (center), W. Averell Harriman (left), and Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right) as Harriman takes the oath as new director of the Mutual Security Agency. Also present in the background are Under Secretary of State James Webb (fourth from left, partly obscured), Attorney General J. Howard McGrath (fifth from left), Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer (third from right), and John Steelman (second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Prime Minister Mossadegh of Iran exiting car
Scopenote: Prime Minister Mohammed Mossadegh of Iran (right) exits his car accompanied by an unidentified escort during his visit to the United States.

title: President Truman and Prime Minister Mossadegh of Iran at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Prime Minister Mohammed Mossadegh of Iran (right) wave from the front steps of Blair House.  Prime Minister Mossedegh is visiting the United States.

title: Truman Receives Gift from France
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) receives a gift from French Ambassador Henri Bonnet (second from right) presented on behalf of French President Vincent Auriol. The gift consisted of a musical clock and pair of candelabra, presented on the occasion of the renovation of the White House. First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) and Madame Helle Bonnet (right) look on.

title: President Truman Receives Clock from French Ambassador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a gift of a clock and two candelabra from the French Ambassador to the United States, Henri Bonnet (second from right). The clock is mounted on a white marble base and is supported by two cupids astride bronze animals. It is the work of sculptor Gouttiere. These gifts were sent on behalf of the President of France and especially meant as an addition to the newly renovated White House. First Lady Bess W. Truman (far left) and Madame Bonnet (far right) look on.

title: President Truman Receives Clock and Candelabra from the French Ambassador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) receives a gift of a clock and two candelabra from the French Ambassador to the United States, Henri Bonnet (second from right). The clock is mounted on a white marble base and is supported by two cupids astride bronze animals. It is the work of sculptor Gouttiere. These gifts were sent on behalf of the President of France especially for the renovated White House. First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) and Madame Bonnet (right) look on.

title: Crowd at the Dedication of AMVETS Headquarters
Scopenote: A view of the crowd of veterans and others looking on at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. The speaker is unidentified. Sitting on the left side of the speaker's stand are (from left to right) Secretary of the Army Frank Pace and Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett. All others are unidentified.

title: Dedication of the AMVETS Headquarters in Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: A view of the speaker's stand at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. The speaker and all others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Speaks at AMVETS Headquarters Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaks to veterans and others at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. Also present on the left side of the speaker's stand are, from left to right, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace and Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett. All others are unidentified.

title: Arrival of the Hearse at Truman Library
Scopenote: A view of the flag at half-mast as members of the military view the arrival of the hearse at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman Addresses Crowd at AMVETS Headquarters Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaks to veterans and others at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. Also present on the left side of the speaker's stand are, from left to right, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace and Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Speaks at the Dedication of AMVETS Headquarters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaks to veterans and others at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. Also present on the left side of the speaker's stand is Secretary of the Army Frank Pace. The military officer seated behind President Truman is General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at AMVETS Headquarters Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) poses for a picture after his speech at the dedication of the new AMVETS headquarters at 1710 Rhode Island Avenue in Washington, D.C. Standing on the left are, from left to right, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace and Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Opening the Baseball Season at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman saluting the flag at the opening of the baseball season at Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. Standing behind the Presidential flag are, from left to right: Chief Justice Fred Vinson, President Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. Standing the second row of the Presidential box are, from left to right: unidentified, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, and Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Opening the Baseball Season at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff attending a baseball game between the Washington Senators and the Boston Red Sox. First row, from left to right are: Vice President Alben Barkley; Chief Justice Fred Vinson; President Truman; Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators; Admiral William D. Leahy (between Griffith and Harris); Bucky Harris, manager of Senators; Lou Boudreau, manager of the Red Sox. In the second row, from left to right: unidentified; General Harry Vaughan; General Robert Landry; Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: A view of the crowd gathered for the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Military band playing during the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. Also present are General Robert Landry (second from left) and General Harry Vaughan (third from left). All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Members of the Daniel family are escorted into the Truman Library to receive guests attending the viewing of former President Harry S. Truman prior to his funeral. Behind Mr. Daniel are his two oldest sons, Clifton T. Daniel (left) and William W. Daniel (right). All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in dark suit) watches as General Robert Landry (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right) carry a wreath into the Jefferson Memorial as part of the ceremonies celebrating Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Attending Ceremonies at Jefferson Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. Descending the stairs of the Memorial are General Harry Vaughan (left) and General Robert Landry (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Jefferson Memorial Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. Behind him are General Robert Landry (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Ceremonies Inside the Jefferson Memorial
Scopenote: Statue of Thomas Jefferson inside the Jefferson Memorial, during wreath laying ceremonies celebrating Jefferson's 209th birthday. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman With McGranery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sits and talks in the Oval Office with his nominee for Attorney General, James P. McGranery (right).

title: President Truman With James McGranery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sits and talks in the Oval Office with his nominee for Attorney General, James P. McGranery (right).

title: President Truman Talks with Attorney General Nominee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sits and talks in the Oval Office with his nominee for Attorney General, James P. McGranery (right).

title: Preparations for Visit of the Queen of the Netherlands
Scopenote: A view of the reviewing stand before the start of the ceremonies celebrating the arrival of Queen Juliana and Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of the Truman and Daniel families are escorted into the Truman Library for part of the funeral ceremonies for former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Members Awaiting the Queen of the Netherlands
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet await the arrival of Queen Juliana of the Netherlands at Washington National Airport. From left to right: Nell (Mrs. Jesse) Donaldson; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; two unidentified people.

title: President Truman Welcomes the Queen of the Netherlands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, partly obscured) welcomes Queen Juliana (right, wearing fur) of the Netherlands to the United States. Bess Truman (in front of Truman) is part of the welcoming party. Also present is Queen Juliana's husband, Prince Bernhard (standing behind Queen). All others unidentified.

title: President Truman with the Queen of the Netherlands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (middle left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (far left) at Washington National Airport welcoming Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (right) and her husband Prince Bernhard Leopold (middle right). All others unidentified.

title: Queen of the Netherlands Being Welcomed to the United States
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, back to camera) stands with Queen Juliana (right of Truman with fur coat) and Prince Bernhard Leopold (right of Juliana in military garb) as they greet members of Truman's Cabinet at Washington National Airport. Standing in line from left to right: two unidentified people; Director of Mutual Security Administration W. Averell Harriman; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (shaking hands with Queen Juliana); Nell (Mrs. Jesse) Donaldson (between Queen Juliana and Prince Bernhard); Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson (to the right of Prince Bernhard). On the extreme right, back to camera in pinstriped suit is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Makes Address to Welcome Queen of the Netherlands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium, right) giving an address at Washington National airport upon Queen Juliana's (at podium, left) arrival. This was part of the ceremonies of welcoming the Queen to the United States. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Stands with Queen Juliana at Welcoming Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) stands with Queen Juliana (foreground, second from left) of the Netherlands as they review the troops at Washington National Airport. Also present are (foreground, third row, left to right): Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and General Harry Vaughan. All others unidentified.

title: President Truman and Queen Juliana Ride from Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back driver's side seat) and Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (next to Truman) leaving Washington National Airport upon the Queen's arrival in the United States. Also present is General Harry Vaughan (middle seat). All others unidentified.

title: President Truman and Queen Juliana at Welcoming Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from left)sitting next to Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (sixth from left). They are attending the ceremonies welcoming the Queen and her husband Prince Bernhard Leopold to the United States. Also present is Secretary of State Dean Acheson (third from left) and Washington, D.C. Commissioner John Russell Young (second from right). All others unidentified.

title: Visit of Queen Juliana of the Netherlands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from left) sits with Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (sixth from left) at the ceremonies welcoming her to the United States.  Also present is Secretary of State Dean Acheson (third from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Ceremonies Welcoming Queen Juliana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, left) and Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (front row, second from left) standing at attention during welcoming ceremonies in the Queen's honor. Also present is Washington, D.C. Commissioner John R. Young (second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of the Daniel family are escorted into the Truman Library to receive guests attending the viewing of former President Harry S. Truman prior to his funeral. Coming up the stairs first is Margaret Truman Daniel, followed by her husband, E. Clifton Daniel, and two sons, Thomas Daniel (left) and Harrison Daniel (left). Behind Mr. Daniel are his two oldest sons, Clifton T. Daniel (left) and William W. Daniel (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Listens to Speech Welcoming Queen Juliana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) sits with Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (left). They and First Lady Bess W. Truman (right of podium) listen to an address that is part of the ceremonies welcoming the Queen and her husband Prince Bernhard Leopold to the United States. The man speaking is Washington, D. C. Commissioner John R. Young. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Stands with Queen Juliana at Welcoming Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) stands with Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (front row, left) at the ceremonies welcoming her and her husband, Prince Bernhard Leopold (front row, right) to the United States. Also with them is Washington, D.C. Commissioner John R. Young (front row, second from right). Also present is Admiral Robert Dennison (background, second from left). All others unidentified.

title: Ceremonies Welcoming Queen Juliana to the United States
Scopenote: A view of the ceremonies welcoming Queen Juliana of the Netherlands and her husband Prince Bernhard Leopold to the United States. All unidentified.

title: President Truman and Queen Juliana Arriving at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) helps Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (exiting car in center) out of the car as they arrive at the White House. Also present is General Harry Vaughan (second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman and Queen Juliana in Front of White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcoming Queen Juliana of the Netherlands and her husband, Prince Bernhard Leopold, to the White House. Foreground, from left to right: President Truman, Queen Juliana, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Prince Bernhard. Also present is General Harry Vaughan (next to door, fourth from left) and Admiral Robert Dennison (second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Grandstand for Gift Giving Ceremony
Scopenote: The grandstand being set up in Meridian Hill Park, Washington, D.C., for a gift giving ceremony in which the Queen of the Netherlands presented a carillon to the United States. All are unidentified.

title: Secretary Chapman With Carillon
Scopenote: From left to right: Conrad L. Wirth, Director, National Park Service; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Mrs. Ann Chapman; and Edward J. Kelly, Superintendent of National Capital Parks pose in front of the carillon given to the United States by the Netherlands after the dedication ceremony in Washington's Meridian Hill Park.

title: President Truman Shakes Hands With Children
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with a group of children at Meridian Hill Park in Washington, D.C., during ceremonies marking the acceptance of a carillon as a gift from the Netherlands to the United States, presented by Queen Juliana. Also present is Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at Carillon Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) at Meridian Hill Park, Washington, D.C. They are there for a ceremony in which Queen Juliana of the Netherlands presented a carillon to the people of the United States. Standing between them is Edward J. Kelly, Superintendent of National Capital Parks. All others unidentified.

title: Queen Juliana of the Netherlands Talks to Children
Scopenote: Queen Juliana (right) of the Netherlands with a group of children at Meridian Hill Park in Washington, D.C., during ceremonies marking the acceptance of a carillon as a gift from the Netherlands to the United States, presented by Queen Juliana. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of the Daniel family are escorted into the Truman Library to receive guests attending the viewing of former President Harry S. Truman prior to his funeral. Coming up the stairs first is Margaret Truman Daniel, followed by her husband, E. Clifton Daniel, and two sons, Thomas Daniel (left) and Harrison Daniel (left). Behind Mr. Daniel are his two oldest sons, Clifton T. Daniel (left) and William W. Daniel (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Greets Queen Juliana of the Netherlands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Queen Juliana of the Netherlands at Meridian Hill Park in Washington, D.C. They are at the park for a ceremonial presentation of a carillon to the people of the United States from the Netherlands. On the ground, from left to right: National Capital Parks Superintendent Edward J. Kelly, President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Queen Juliana, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (back to camera, in pinstriped suit), Prince Bernhard Leopold (wearing glasses), and Secretary of State Dean Acheson (back to camera). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman and Queen Juliana at Gift Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Queen Juliana of the Netherlands at Meridian Hill Park, Washington, D.C., for a ceremony at which the Queen will present a carillon to the people of the United States from the people of the Netherlands. Truman, Queen Juliana, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right side of podium), and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: A view of the crowd at Meridian Hill Park, Washington, D.C., attending the ceremony at which Queen Juliana of the Netherlands presented a carillon to the people of the United States. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: View of the crowd watching Queen Juliana of the Netherlands (standing at podium) speak at Meridian Hill Park, Washington, D.C., during a ceremony at which she presented a carillon to the people of the United States from the people of the Netherlands. All others are unidentified.
