title: Trumans Attending Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, second from right) and his wife, First Lady Bess W. Truman (foreground, third from right) being greeted on their way into the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner, held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Bess shakes hands with Frank McKinney, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee. President Truman shakes hands with Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan, wife of the Secretary of Agriculture.

title: Trumans Arriving at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from right) being greeted upon their arrival at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. They were attending the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner. They are greeted by Frank McKinney, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee (left) and Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan, wife of the Secretary of Agriculture.

title: President Truman at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with two other unidentified men attending the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with two other unidentified men attending the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: View of the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. during the 1952 Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Members of President Nixon's Secret Service arrive at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: View of the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. during the 1952 Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner.

title: Table of Guests at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: A group of unidentified guests attending the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) smiles as he receives applause at the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Conversing at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) talking with an unidentified female guest at the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: President Truman at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, right) talking to other guests at the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: Guests at Main Table of the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Guests at the main table at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. Among those present are Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right) and Secretary of State Dean Acheson (fourth from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Secretary Chapman at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (seated, second from right) and unidentified others at the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner, held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: Head Table Guests at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Guests talking at the main table at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner, held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. From left to right: unidentified woman, Attorney General J. Howard McGrath, and Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson.

title: Bess Truman at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (center) at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: Bess Truman Talking to Guests at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Chairman of the Democratic National Committee Frank McKinney (left) and First Lady Bess Truman (center) talk to 6.5 year old Bettye Ann Bullard, a young guest at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner, held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and First Lady Patricia Nixon arrive at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Guests at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Unidentified guests talking at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: President and Bess Truman at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (right of Harry) at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C.

title: President Truman Giving Address at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: A view of President Harry S. Truman (at podium) giving an address at the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. In this address Truman officially announced he would not be a candidate for the Presidency for the next election. All others unidentified.

title: President and Bess Truman at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) at the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner held at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. At which the President announced that he would not be a candidate for reelection in 1952. Also present is Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson, wife of Secretary of State Dean Acheson (third from right). Others unidentified.

title: Band Performing at Department of Agriculture Awards Ceremony
Scopenote: A band performing as part of the Sixth Annual Honor Awards of the Department of Agriculture. This even was at the Sylvan Theater on the grounds of the Washington Monument. All unidentified.

title: Crowd at Department of Agriculture Awards Ceremony
Scopenote: A view of the crowd at the Sixth Annual Honor Awards program of the Department of Agriculture. This even is at the Sylvan Theater on the grounds of the Washington Monument. All unidentified.

title: Truman Addressing Crowd at Department of Agriculture Awards
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) addressing the crowd in attendance at the Sylvan Theater on the Washington Monument for the Sixth Annual Honor Awards Program of the Department of Agriculture. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Giving Address at Department of Agriculture Awards Program
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) addressing the crowd in attendance at the Sylvan Theater on the Washington Monument for the Sixth Annual Honor Awards Program of the Department of Agriculture. Also present is Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan (seated, front row, seventh from left) and his wife, Eda Brannan (seated, front row, fifth from left). All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Addresses Crowd At Awards Program
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) delivering a speech at the Sixth Annual Honor Awards Program of the Department of Agriculture, held at the Sylvan Theater on the Washington Monument grounds. Also present is Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan (front row, second from right) and his wife, Eda Brannan (front row, left). All others unidentified.

title: Secretary Brannan at Department of Agriculture Awards Ceremony
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan (at podium) delivering a speech at the Sixth Annual Awards Program of the Department of Agriculture. He delivers this at the Sylvan Theater on the grounds of the Washington Monument. Also present is his wife, Eda Brannan (front row, second from left) and President Harry S. Truman (front row, fourth from left). All others unidentified.

title: President and Mrs. Richard Nixon Arrive at the Truman Library
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and First Lady Patricia Nixon arrive at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman.

title: Prince Faisal Al Saud of Saudi Arabia
Scopenote: Prince Faisal Al Saud of Saudi Arabia (foreground, second from right) during his visit to the United States. All others unidentified.

title: Prince Faisal Al Saud at Washington Monument
Scopenote: Prince Faisal Al Saud of Saudi Arabia (foreground, fourth from left) and his party standing in front of the Reflecting Pool and the Washington Monument, during the Prince's visit to Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: Prince Faisal of Saudi Arabia in Washington
Scopenote: Prince Faisal Al Saud (center) of Saudi Arabia and his party at the base of the Washington Monument in Washington, D.C. during his visit to the United States. All others unidentified.

title: Prince Faisal During Visit to the United States
Scopenote: Prince Faisal Al Saud of Saudi Arabia (second from left) and his party inside the Washington Monument in Washington, D.C. during his visit to the United States. All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Posing for A Bust of Himself
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman posing in the Cabinet Room of the White House for a bust of himself being sculpted by Nison Tregor.

title: President Truman Posing for Sculptor Nison Tregor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right) posing in the Cabinet Room of the White House for sculptor Nison Tregor (second from right), who was preparing a bust of the President. All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Poses for Bust of Himself
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman posing next to his bust, sculpted by Nison Tregor. This sitting session took place in the Cabinet Room of the White House.

title: President Truman Poses for Bust in Cabinet Room
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for a bust of himself in the Cabinet Room of the White House. The bust is being made by sculptor Nison Tregor.

title: President Truman Poses for Sculptor Nison Tregor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for sculptor Nison Tregor who is making a bust of the President. This session is taking place in the Cabinet Room of the White House.

title: President Truman Posing Next to His Bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) posing for sculptor Nison Tregor (right) in the Cabinet Room of the White House for the bust that Tregor is creating.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and First Lady Patricia Nixon arrive at the Truman Library for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman Posing for Bust in Cabinet Room
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) posing in the Cabinet Room of the White House for sculptor Nison Tregor (right). Mr. Tregor is preparing a bust of the President.

title: Sculptor Nison Tregor with President Truman's Bust
Scopenote: Sculptor Nison Tregor putting the finishing touches on the clay model for a bust of President Harry S. Truman in the Cabinet Room of the White House.

title: Sculptor Works on President Truman's Bust
Scopenote: Sculptor Nison Tregor works on the bust of President Harry S. Truman in the Cabinet Room of the White House.

title: Nison Tregor Works on Truman Bust
Scopenote: Sculptor Nison Tregor (center) finishing the clay model of a bust of President Harry S. Truman in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Others unidentified.

title: Nison Tregor With Truman Bust
Scopenote: Sculptor Nison Tregor stands back and looks at his clay model for a bust of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Benjamin Fairless at the White House
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) stands with Benjamin Fairless, U.S. Steel executive (right) on his visit to the White House in 1952.

title: Murray and Fairless at the White House
Scopenote: Philip Murray, leader of the Congress of Industrial Organizations (left) shakes hands with Benjamin Fairless, U.S. Steel executive (right) at the White House.

title: President Truman Leaving for the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) leaves for Chicago, Illinois to attend the Democratic National Convention.

title: Truman Leaves for Chicago
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the steps of his plane as he prepares to depart Washington, D.C. for the 1952 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Trumans Leave for 1952 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), First Lady Bess W. Truman (center), and Treasury Secretary John Snyder prepare to board their plane to depart Washington, D.C. for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: President and Mrs. Nixon at Truman Viewing
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and Patricia Nixon step out of the Presidential Limousine at the Truman Presidential Library to pay their respects before the funeral of former president Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Trumans Leave for 1952 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (center) speak with Treasury Secretary John Snyder (right) as they prepare to depart Washington, D.C. for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Truman Meets with 1952 Democratic Nominees
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Governor Adlai Stevenson of Illinois (right) and Senator John J. Sparkman of Alabama (center) in the Oval Office. Governor Stevenson had just accepted the Democratic nomination for President and Senator Sparkman the Democratic nomination for Vice President.

title: Stevenson and Sparkman Visit the White House
Scopenote: Governor Adlai Stevenson of Illinois (center) and Senator John Sparkman of Alabama (right) visit the White House just after accepting the nominations of the Democratic Party for President and Vice President, respectively. Others unidentified.

title: Truman Meets with 1952 Democratic Nominees
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Illinois Governor Adlai Stevenson (right) and Alabama Senator John Sparkman (standing) in the Oval Office.  Stevenson and Sparkman had just accepted the Democratic nominations for President and Vice President, respectively.

title: Nixon Greets Eisenhower at Airport
Scopenote: Republican presidential candidate General Dwight D. Eisenhower (center right) is greeted by Senator and Republican vice presidential candidate Richard Nixon (center left) among a crowd of others on his arrival at Washington National Airport. All others are unidentified.

title: Eisenhower and Nixon Leave Airport
Scopenote: General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Republican nominee for President (left), and Senator Richard M. Nixon, Republican nominee for Vice President (right), leave Washington National Airport in the back of a limousine. Other man in car is unidentified.

title: Nixon Family Greets Eisenhower
Scopenote: Senator Richard M. Nixon (third from left), Republican nominee for Vice President, and his family greet General Dwight D. Eisenhower (center), Republican nominee for President, upon his arrival amongst a crowd of well-wishers at Washington National Airport. The woman next to Mr. Nixon on the left is his wife, Pat. All others are unidentified.

title: President-elect Eisenhower Addresses Reporters
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower addresses reporters during his visit to the White House. Also with him is Senator Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr. (center left, in pinstripe suit) and Joseph Dodge (center, behind Lodge's shoulder). All others are unidentified.

title: President-elect Eisenhower Visits the White House
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower (center) acknowledges the crowd of bystanders during his visit to the White House. Also present is Senator Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr. (left, in pinstripe suit) and Joseph Dodge (immediately right of Eisenhower). All others are unidentified.

title: President-elect Eisenhower Visits the White House
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower (center) stands in the middle of a crowd of police, photographers, and reporters during his visit to the White House. Also present is Senator Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr. (center, left, in pinstripe suit) and Joseph Dodge (center, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President and Mrs. Richard Nixon Arrive at Truman Library
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and Patricia Nixon approach the Truman Presidential Library to pay their respects to former president Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: President-elect Eisenhower Waves from Car
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower (backseat, left) gives a hearty wave from the back of his open limousine following his visit to the White House. Also with him is Senator Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr. (backseat, right). Joseph Dodge (wearing hat) stands behind the car, facing left. Others unidentified.

title: Mrs. Truman and Muscular Dystrophy Poster Boy
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) meets with Michael Danna of South Ozone Park, New York (left), the 1952-1953 Muscular Dystrophy Appeal Poster Boy. Danna holds a cocker spaniel named Buttons, Jr., his gift to the Truman family.

title: Mrs. Truman with Muscular Dystrophy Poster Boy
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (center) accepts a certificate from an unidentified man during her meeting with Michael Danna of South Ozone Park, New York (left), the 1952-1953 Muscular Dystrophy Poster Boy. Danna's visit marked the official opening of the Muscular Dystrophy Appeal Campaign. Danna holds in his lap a cocker spaniel named Buttons, Jr., his gift to the Trumans.

title: Mrs. Truman Meets Muscular Dystrophy Poster Boy
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) visits with Michael Danna of South Ozone Park, New York (left), the 1952-1953 Muscular Dystrophy Appeal Campaign Poster Boy.  Mrs. Truman pets a cocker spaniel named Buttons, Jr., Danna's gift to the Trumans.

title: Truman with Army-Navy Football Captains
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with the captains of the Army and Navy football teams before they square off in Philadelphia. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others enjoy the Army-Navy Football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Front row, left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. In the second row, between Mrs. Chapman and Mr. Truman is Admiral Robert Dennison, President Truman's Naval Aide. In the second row between Truman and Margaret Truman is General Robert Landry, President Truman's Air Force Aide. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) smiles as daughter Margaret Truman (right) waves pennants supporting both teams at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Seated in the front row, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. In the second row, behind Secretary Chapman is General Wallace Graham, unidentified woman (mostly obscured), and Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: Guests at Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: Unidentified guests of President Harry S. Truman enjoy the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Truman Chats with Guests at Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated fourth from left) chats with his guests at the 1952 Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In the front row, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. Standing behind Secretary Chapman is Admiral Robert Dennison. Seated behind President Truman is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Applauds Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, third from left) applauds at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In the front row, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. Standing behind Secretary Chapman is Admiral Robert Dennison. Seated behind President Truman is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President and Mrs. Nixon Leaving Truman Library
Scopenote: President Richard M. Nixon and First Lady Patricia Nixon (center) leave the Truman Presidential Library after paying their respects to former president Harry S. Truman, whose casket lay in the lobby of the Truman Library. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) reads through his program with daughter Margaret (third from left) at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Also present are Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, wife of the Secretary of the Interior (left); Admiral William Leahy (right); Admiral Robert Dennison (second row, left); and General Robert Landry (second row, third from left, partly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Guests at Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and daughter Margaret pose with guests at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. From left to right: In the front row, from left to right are: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Guests at Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and daughter Margaret pose with guests at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. From left to right: In the front row, from left to right are: unidentified man, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Aboard Train At Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) is shown with unidentified guests on the platform of his train during his trip to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to watch the Army-Navy football game. On the right is Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: President Truman and Margaret on Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves beside daughter Margaret Truman (right) from the back of a train during a trip to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to watch the Army-Navy football game.

title: President Truman and Margaret on Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves from the back of a train while daughter Margaret (right) looks on during a trip to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to watch the Army-Navy football game.

title: Truman Presents Distinguished Service Medal to Souers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents the  Distinguished Service Medal to Rear Admiral Sidney Souers, U.S. Naval Reserve (right). Souers had served as the first Director of Central Intelligence (1946) and the first Executive Secretary of the National Security Council (1947-50).

title: Mamie Eisenhower Visits White House
Scopenote: Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower, wife of President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower, poses for cameras at the North Entrance to the White House.

title: Bess Truman and Mamie Eisenhower
Scopenote: Visit between Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower (right) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) at the White House.

title: First Lady Bess W. Truman Receives Gift from Girl Scouts
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from right) receives a glass paperweight in honor of her service as honorary president of the Girl Scouts since 1945.  The girls presenting the gift as two unidentified Girl Scout leaders look on: (left to right) Loretta Gallegos, 8; Susan Schneider, 11; Joanna Rodman, 8; Marion East, 16.

title: President Richard M. Nixon's Limousine Pulls In
Scopenote: Secret Service agents survey the scene as the Presidential Limousine pulls up to the Harry S. Truman Library, so that President Richard M. Nixon can pay his respects to former President Truman, whose casket lay in state in the lobby of the Library. All are unidentified.

title: First Lady Bess W. Truman Hosts Girl Scouts
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from right) poses with a delegation of Girl Scouts who presented her with a glass paperweight in honor of her service as their organization's honorary president since 1945. The girls presenting the gift as two unidentified Girl Scout leaders look on: (left to right) Susan Schneider, 11; Loretta Gallegos, 8; Joanna Rodman, 8; Marion East, 16.

title: President Truman with Adlai Stevenson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Governor Adlai Stevenson at the White House.

title: Truman with Walter Reuther
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets in the Oval Office with labor leader Walter Reuther, president of the Congress of Industrial Organizations.

title: Truman Meets with Walter Reuther
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with labor leader Walter Reuther (right), president of the Congress of Industrial Organizations, in the Oval Office.

title: Truman Meets with Reuther
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with labor leader Walter Reuther (right), president of the Congress of Industrial Organizations, in the Oval Office.

title: Vinson Speaking at Archives Ceremony
Scopenote: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Fred Vinson (standing) addresses the audience at the dedication of the new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights at the National Archives in Washington, D.C. Also present is President Harry S. Truman (seated facing crowd, fourth from left) and Archivist of the United States Wayne C. Grover (seated facing crowd, second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Archives Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) admires the new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights at a dedication ceremony at the National Archives in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman at Archives Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands before the new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights at the National Archives in Washington, D.C. Also present is Archivist of the United States Wayne Grover (left) and Fred Vinson, Chief Justice of the United States (right). Others are unidentified.

title: New Archives Shrine Unveiled
Scopenote: Guests at the dedication ceremony for the new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights look on as the shrine is unveiled. President Harry S. Truman is seated in the second row, near the left corner of the cases on the floor. Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Fred Vinson is standing nearest the podium on the right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Archives Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated front row, second from left) looks on during the dedication ceremony for the new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights at the National Archives in Washington, D.C. Also pictured are Chief Justice Fred Vinson (immediately behind podium) and Archivist of the United States Wayne C. Grover (second row, left, partly obscured). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Speaks at Archives Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing) delivers an address during ceremonies at the National Archives dedicating a new shrine for the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights. Also pictured are Chief Justice Fred Vinson (directly behind podium) and Wayne C. Grover, Archivist of the United States (second row, left, partly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Members of United States Marine Band
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) poses in the White House with leaders of the U.S. Marine Band, Colonel William F. Santelmann (right) and Captain Albert F. Schoepper (left). The men hold a piece of sheet music by Richard Wagner. Above them is a portrait of First Lady Angelica Van Buren.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with Marine Band Leaders
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) poses in the White House with leaders of the U.S. Marine Band, Colonel William F. Santelmann (right) and Captain Albert F. Schoepper (left). The men hold a piece of sheet music by Richard Wagner. Above them is a portrait of First Lady Angelica Van Buren.

title: Truman Poses with Little Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, fifth from left) poses outside the North Entrance of the White House with his "Little Cabinet," the top officials of the Cabinet-level Departments in his administration below the rank of Secretary. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Churchill Leave White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (right) smile as they step outside the White House during the Prime Minister's visit.

title: Winston Churchill Arrives to Washington D.C
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (center) arriving at the airport in Washington and being greeted by a number of dignitaries, including W. Averell Harriman (second from left), Director of the Mutual Security Agency, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson (foreground, second from right). All others unidentified.

title: Winston Churchill Shakes Hands with Acheson in Map Room
Scopenote: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (left center) shaking hands with Secretary of State Dean Acheson (right center) in front of a large map of the world. Director of the Mutual Security Agency, W. Averell Harriman (right) and an unidentified man look on.

title: President Truman with 4-H Paperweight
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in the Oval Office with a paperweight shaped like a cloverleaf, a gift to him from a 4-H group.

title: President Truman in Oval Office with 4-H Paperweight
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in the Oval Office with a paperweight shaped like a cloverleaf, a gift to him from a 4-H group.

title: President Truman Receiving Honorary Badges
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) on the White House grounds receiving honorary badges from the Washington Metropolitan Police, the U.S. Park Service Police, and the White House Police from Robert Murray, Chief of the Washington Metropolitan Police Department; Mark Raspberry, Chief of the U.S. Park Service Police; and Francis W. Hobart, Inspector, White House Police. All others unidentified.

title: Honor Guard with Former President Harry S. Truman's Casket
Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman in the lobby of the Truman Presidential Library. There is a TV camera in the foreground. All are unidentified.

title: President Truman Receiving Badges of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) on the White House lawn receiving honorary badges from (foreground, left to right) Robert V. Murray of the Washington police force, Mark H. Raspberry of the U.S. Park Service police, and Francis W. Hobart of the White House police. All others unidentified.

title: President Truman Being Given Badges of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) receiving badges of honor on the grounds of the White House. The badges are being presented by (foreground, left to right) Robert V. Murray of the Metropolitan Police, Mark H. Raspberry of the United States Park Service, and Francis W. Hobart of the White House Police. All others unidentified.

title: Guests at the Eisenhower Inauguration
Scopenote: A picture of guests at the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower is in the center (facing left), and President Eisenhower is standing behind her. All others are unidentified.

title: Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: A view of the inaugural platform and the ceremonies at the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower at the United States Capitol building. All unidentified.

title: Inaugural Platform at Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential Inauguration
Scopenote: Dwight D. Eisenhower (at podium) delivering his Inaugural Address after taking the oath of office as President. Seated in the front row on the left are, from left to right: Margaret Truman (partly obscured by column), former First Lady Bess W. Truman, Pat Nixon, First Lady Mamie Eisenhower, unidentified man, and former President Harry S. Truman. In the second row, next to the podium is former President Herbert Hoover. Seated in the front row, on the right side of the podium is Vice President Richard Nixon. All others are unidentified.

title: Far View of The Ceremonies of Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential Inauguration
Scopenote: A view of the crowd, the band, and the Inaugural Platform as President Dwight D. Eisenhower (at podium) delivers his Inaugural address.

title: Dwight D. Eisenhower Taking Oath of Office
Scopenote: Dwight D. Eisenhower (right of podium) taking the oath of office as President of the United States from Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left of podium). In the front row, from left to right are First Lady Bess W. Truman (right side of column), Pat (Mrs. Richard) Nixon, First Lady Mamie Eisenhower, unidentified man, and former President Harry S. Truman. Visible between Mr. Truman and Chief Justice Vinson is former President Herbert Hoover. On the right side of the podium is Vice President Richard Nixon. All others are unidentified.

title: Richard Nixon Taking Oath of Office as Vice President
Scopenote: Richard M. Nixon (at podium, right) taking the oath of office as Vice President of the United States from Senator William Knowland of California (at podium, left). Also present are, from left to right in first row: First Lady Bess. W. Truman (right side of column), Pat (Mrs. Richard) Nixon, Mamie (Mrs. Dwight) Eisenhower, unidentified man, President Harry S. Truman. Standing behind President Truman is former President Herbert Hoover. The man on the right in the judicial robe is Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Fred M. Vinson. All others unidentified.

title: Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: A view of the Inaugural platform at the Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. Eisenhower is at the front of the group descending the steps. Also present are, left to right on right side of column: First Lady Bess W. Truman, Pat (Mrs. Richard) Nixon, Mamie (Mrs. Dwight D.) Eisenhower, and President Harry S. Truman, Richard M. Nixon, and Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson. Standing immediately behind President Truman is former President Herbert Hoover. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Arrives at Eisenhower Inauguration
Scopenote: A view of the Inaugural platform at the Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. President Harry S. Truman is at the front of the group descending the steps on the left. In the center of the group descending the steps is Vice President Alben Barkley. Also present are, left to right in the first row on the right side of column: First Lady Bess W. Truman, Pat (Mrs. Richard) Nixon, and Mamie (Mrs. Dwight D.) Eisenhower. Standing on the left side at the end of the second row, near the podium is former President Herbert Hoover. Standing on the right side in judicial robes is Chief Justice Fred Vinson. All others are unidentified.

title: Honor Guard Watching Over Casket
Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman in the lobby of the Truman Presidential Library. All are unidentified.

title: Ceremonies at Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential Inauguration
Scopenote: A view of the ceremonies at the Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. Included in the shot is the crowd, the band, and the inaugural platform in from of the Capitol Building. All are unidentified.

title: Festivities at Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: A view of the crowd, the band, the choir, and the inaugural platform at the Capitol Building for the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower. All are unidentified.

title: Guests Leaving Church in Washington on Presidential Inauguration Day
Scopenote: Guests leaving church in Washington, D.C. on the morning of the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. All are unidentified.

title: Dwight D. Eisenhower Leaving Church in Washington
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower (center, wearing hat) and his wife Mamie (left) leaving church in Washington, D.C. on the morning of his Inauguration as President. All others unidentified.

title: Dwight D. Eisenhower and Wife Exiting Car
Scopenote: President-elect Dwight D. Eisenhower (center) and his wife Mamie (left) exit their car as they attend church services on the day of Eisenhower's inauguration. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd at Inauguration Day Church Services
Scopenote: A crowd looks on as Dwight D. Eisenhower and his wife Mamie attend church services prior to Eisenhower's inauguration as President. All are unidentified.

title: Motorcycle Police Squad Practicing Parade Formations
Scopenote: A group of policemen of the motorcycle squad practicing formations for the parade in celebration of Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential inauguration. All unidentified.

title: Policemen of Motorcycle Squad Making Parade Formations
Scopenote: A view of the formation practice for the motorcycle police that are in the parade celebrating the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. All unidentified.

title: Parade Formations of Motorcycle Police
Scopenote: A front view of the parade formations of the motorcycle police. They will be in the parade celebrating Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential inauguration. All unidentified.

title: United States Park Police in Parade Formation
Scopenote: The United States Park Police in formation with their motorcycles for the parade to celebrate the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. All unidentified.

title: Honor Guard Watching Over Casket
Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman in the lobby of the Truman Presidential Library. All are unidentified.

title: Media Coverage of the Eisenhower Inauguration
Scopenote: A view of the news media arriving to cover the inauguration and Inaugural Parade of Dwight D. Eisenhower. All unidentified.

title: Back of the Stands to View the Parade Route
Scopenote: A view of the back of the stands for those watching the inaugural parade. The parade is part of the ceremonies in celebration of Dwight D. Eisenhower's Presidential Inauguration.

title: Viewing Stands Before the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A view of the stands to view the parade in celebration of the Dwight D. Eisenhower's and Richard M. Nixon's inaugurations as President and Vice President respectively. All people unidentified.

title: Aerial View of Stands for Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: An elevated view of the stands for viewing the parade in celebration of the Presidential Inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: Stands for Inaugural Parade of Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: The completed stands for viewing the parade in celebration of the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: The Parade Stands and Street
Scopenote: A view of the grandstands and the street prior to the parade that will take place in celebration of the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower. All unidentified.

title: Men Working on Stands for Parade Route
Scopenote: Workers painting the grandstands for the parade in celebration of the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower. All are unidentified.

title: Stands for Presidential Inauguration Parade
Scopenote: A view of the grandstands for the parade in celebration of the Presidential inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: View of the Stands for Eisenhower Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A view of the completed stands for the viewing of the parade in celebration of the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: The Presidential Stands for Viewing the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A view of the presidential box in the reviewing stand for the inaugural parade. Standing in the front on the extreme left is President Dwight D. Eisenhower. Seated behind him are former President Herbert Hoover and First Lady Mamie Eisenhower. Standing on the right is Vice President Richard Nixon. Seated behind him on the left is Mrs. Pat Nixon. All others are unidentified.

title: Honor Guard with the Casket of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman. They are in the lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library, where President Truman lay in state. All are unidentified.

title: A Cowboy Lassos President Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: A cowboy lassos President Dwight D. Eisenhower at the Inaugural Parade. Also present are former President Herbert Hoover (seated behind Eisenhower), First Lady Mamie Eisenhower (standing next to chair on right), and Vice President Richard Nixon (standing, right). All others are unidentified.

title: Mounted Police in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A troop of mounted police in the parade honoring the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. Standing in the Presidential box are President Eisenhower (left) and Vice President Nixon (right). Seated in the first row of the Presidential box are, from left to right former President Herbert Hoover, First Lady Mamie Eisenhower, and Pat (Mrs. Richard) Nixon. All others are unidentified.

title: Motorcycle Police of the United States Park Police in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Representatives of the United States Park Police in formation on their motorcycles. They are part of the Inaugural Parade that is celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. All are unidentified.

title: Dignitaries in the Inaugural Parade of Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: Various Cabinet members designate ride in automobiles in the Inaugural Parade for President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard Nixon. In the back seat of each car, from left to right: Attorney General designate Herbert Brownell, Postmaster General designate Arthur Summerfield, and Secretary of the Interior designate Douglas McKay. All others are unidentified.

title: Dignitaries in President Eisenhower's Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Various Cabinet members designate ride in automobiles in the Inaugural Parade for President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard Nixon. In the back seat of each car, from left to right: Secretary of State designate John Foster Dulles, Secretary of the Treasury designate George Humphrey, and Secretary of Defense designate Charles E. Wilson. All others are unidentified.

title: Former President Hoover in Dwight D. Eisenhower's Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover (seated, holding hat) riding in the parade in celebration of the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All others are unidentified.

title: Richard M. Nixon in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Richard M. Nixon (standing and waving in car) and his wife, Pat Nixon (seated in car, waving, partly obscured) in the parade in celebration of his inauguration as Vice President and Dwight D. Eisenhower as President. All others unidentified.

title: Dwight D. Eisenhower in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Dwight D. Eisenhower (standing and waving in car) and the First Lady Mamie Eisenhower (seated in car, waving) riding in a car in the parade celebrating his inauguration as President and Richard M. Nixon's as Vice President. All others unidentified.

title: Dignitaries in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Dignitaries riding in a car in the parade celebrating President Dwight D. Eisenhower's and Vice President Richard M. Nixon's inauguration. All unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from South Carolina in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. An unidentified band is marching behind the float. All unidentified.

Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman. A wreath brought by President Richard Nixon sits at the foot of the casket. All are unidentified.

title: North Carolina Float in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float from North Carolina in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. An unidentified band is following behind. All are unidentified.

title: New Hampshire Float in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float from New Hampshire in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. All unidentified.

title: Dignitaries in President Dwight D. Eisenhower's Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Dignitaries riding in an automobile in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower and Richard M. Nixon as President and Vice President respectively. All are unidentified.

title: New York's Float in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float from New York state in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. All unidentified.

Scopenote: Governor of New York Thomas E. Dewey waves to the crowd from his automobile in President Dwight D. Eisenhower's inaugural parade, as a band follows along behind. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Dignitaries riding in cars as part of the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower and Richard M. Nixon as President and Vice President respectively. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Mounted police in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

title: Cadets in Dwight D. Eisenhower's Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Military cadets marching as part of the parade in celebration of the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Soldiers marching in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: A group of mounted men in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: The Honor Guard watches over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman in the lobby of the Truman Presidential Library. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Vice President Richard M. Nixon (standing in light colored car) and his wife Pat (seated in back seat) riding in a car in the parade celebrating his inauguration at Vice President. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (standing in white car) and his wife, Mamie (siting right of Dwight) riding in the parade celebrating Eisenhower's inauguration as President. In the fourth car back, Vice President Richard M. Nixon is standing up. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (standing in center white car) riding in the inaugural parade celebrating him being sworn into office as President. In the fifth car back, Vice President Richard M. Nixon is standing up. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Motorcycle police in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: A view of the crowd and the news media at the oath of office ceremony swearing in Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: A view of guests at the reception celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower and Vice President Richard M. Nixon. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: A view of the guests at the reception celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower and First Lady Mamie Eisenhower (front row, eighth and ninth from the right, in the center) at their Inaugural Ball, with other unidentified people.  A photo of Vice President Richard Nixon is on the wall on the right.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (front) waving to the guests at the reception celebrating his inauguration. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (third from right)and his wife Mamie (center shaking hands) being greeted at the reception celebrating Eisenhower's inauguration as President. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from California in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower as President and Richard M. Nixon as Vice President. All unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from Indiana in the parade celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower (in presidential box in front of left pillar) as President and Richard M. Nixon (in presidential box in front of right pillar) as Vice President. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from Vermont in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in presidential box in front of left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in presidential box in front of right pillar). All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from Arkansas in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in presidential box in front of left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in presidential box in front of right pillar). All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The Honor Guard stands watch over the casket of former President Harry S. Truman in the lobby of the Truman Presidential Library. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Cadets from the Virginia Military Institute marching by the reviewing stands in the inaugural parade. President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar) look on. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar) watch as an elephant walks by in the parade celebrating their inauguration. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (center left) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (center right) posing for pictures on the reviewing stand of the parade celebrating their inauguration. Scopenote: A group of soldiers marching in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar). Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Governor of Kansas Edward Arn (standing in back of car) riding in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (shaking hands with man in back) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar). All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from Georgia in the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar). All others unidentified.

Scopenote: A marching band as part of the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar). All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Military cadets marching past the reviewing stand of the inaugural parade as President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar) look on. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: The float from New Jersey as part of the parade celebrating the inauguration of President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of center left pillar) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of center right pillar). All others unidentified.

title: President Eisenhower and Vice President Nixon in Reviewing Stands
Scopenote: President Dwight D. Eisenhower (in front of left pillar) standing at attention with his wife Mamie (right of Dwight in fur coat) and Vice President Richard M. Nixon (in front of right pillar) during the parade celebrating their inauguration. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Honor Guard members guard the casket in the lobby of the Truman Library during the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Vice President Nixon Being Greeted at Reception
Scopenote: Vice President Richard M. Nixon (center shaking hands) and his wife Pat (left of Richard) being greeted at the reception celebrating his inauguration. All others unidentified.

title: Guests at Reception Honoring President Eisenhower and Vice President Nixon
Scopenote: Guests at the reception celebrating the inauguration of Dwight D. Eisenhower and Richard M. Nixon as President and Vice President respectively. President Eisenhower and First Lady Mamie Eisenhower are seated in the balcony, just behind the presidential seal. All unidentified.

title: President Kennedy with Former President Truman
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (center left) with former President Harry S. Truman (center right) in front of the White House. All others unidentified.

title: President Kennedy with Former President Truman at White House
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy stands with former President Harry S. Truman in the West Wing Lobby, White House, Washington, D.C. (L-R) President Kennedy; Secret Service agent William "Bill" Duncan; President Truman; Special Assistant to President Kennedy Dave Powers; Washington Correspondent for the Guy Gannett Publishing Company of Maine, May Craig.

title: Former President Truman Visiting White House
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) smiling at the West Wing entrance during his visit to the White House. President John F. Kennedy (left of Truman) confers with an aide in the background. Special Assistant to President Kennedy Dave Powers stands in background at center. All others unidentified.

title: Former President Truman Visiting the White House
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) being greeted during his visit to the White House. All others unidentified.

title: Former President Truman at Dinner at National Guard Armory
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) in attendance at a dinner held by President John F. Kennedy at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others unidentified.

title: Former President Truman at Banquet with Mrs. Kennedy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) greets an admirer during an Inaugural Anniversary Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. He is seated beside First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy (right of Truman) and Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy (right of Mrs. Kennedy). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Banquet with Jacqueline Kennedy and Robert Kennedy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy (right) during an Inaugural Anniversary Dinner at the National Guard Armory in Washington. Also in attendance is Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy (right of Mrs. Kennedy). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman meets with President Kennedy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from the right) meets at the White House with President John F. Kennedy (second from right). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Honor Guard members guard the casket in the lobby of the Truman Library during the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: President Kennedy with Former President Truman in Oval Office
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (left) talking with former President Harry S. Truman (right) in the Oval Office, on Kennedy's first full day in the White House.

title: President Kennedy in Oval Office with Former President Truman
Scopenote: President John F. Kennedy (left) sitting and talking with former President Harry S. Truman (right) in the Oval Office. This is Kennedy's first full day as President.

title: Former President Truman Walking on White House Grounds
Scopenote: Cameraman films former President Harry S. Truman (with cane) as he arrives at White House for meeting with President John F. Kennedy. President Truman is accompanied by naval aide, Captain Cooper B. Bright (third from left), and an unidentified aide. The grounds of the White House are covered in snow. Washington, D.C.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman Vote for Baseball All Stars
Scopenote: Former First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (center) cast their votes for the 1953 All Star baseball players. Standing on the right in the foreground is Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. All others unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at Baseball Game
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second from left) and Bess Truman (second from right) attend a baseball game with Margaret's friend, Drucie Snyder Horton (left), daughter of former Treasury Secretary John Snyder, and Drucie's husband John Horton (third from left). Also present is Clark Griffith (right), owner of the Washington Senators. All others unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Vote for Baseball All Stars
Scopenote: Bess Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (center) cast their votes for players to appear in Major League Baseball's All-Star Game.  Also present is Clark Griffith (right), owner of the Washington Senators. All others unidentified.

title: President Johnson Places Wreath at Kennedy Casket
Scopenote: President Lyndon B. Johnson places a wreath at the flag-draped casket of President John F. Kennedy during funeral services in the U.S. Capitol rotunda.

title: Cars and Crowds at Kennedy Funeral
Scopenote: Cars and crowds fill Washington, D.C. during the funeral services for President John F. Kennedy.

title: Kennedy Casket Enters Capitol
Scopenote: The casket of President John F. Kennedy is carried into the U.S. Capitol followed by members of the Kennedy family for funeral services. Leading the group of family members is Jacqueline Kennedy and her children, John F. Kennedy, Jr. and Caroline Kennedy.

title: Kennedy Casket Enters U.S. Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the armed services carry President John F. Kennedy's casket into the U.S. Capitol for funeral services.  The president's casket is followed by his widow, Jacqueline Kennedy, children John and Caroline Kennedy, brother Robert F. Kennedy and other members of the Kennedy family.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Changing of the Guard in the lobby of the Truman Library during the funeral for former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket Approaches Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family (right) and other members of the public look on as servicemen carrying the casket of President John F. Kennedy approach the steps of the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Attorney General Robert Kennedy, Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), and John F. Kennedy, Jr. Also present next to Mrs. Kennedy is President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket at Capitol Steps
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family (right) and the public look on as President John F. Kennedy's funeral procession reaches the steps of the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Attorney General Robert Kennedy, Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), and John F. Kennedy, Jr. Also present next to Mrs. Kennedy is President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket Prepares to Leave Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family and the public watch as servicemen lift President John F. Kennedy's casket onto the carriage for departure from the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Attorney General Robert Kennedy, Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), and John F. Kennedy, Jr. Also present next to Mrs. Kennedy is President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket Leaves Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family and the public watch as President John F. Kennedy's casket is placed on the carriage for departure from the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Attorney General Robert Kennedy, Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), and John F. Kennedy, Jr. Also present next to Mrs. Kennedy is President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket Leaves the Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family (right) and the growing crowds watch as the casket of President John F. Kennedy is placed on the carriage for departure from the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Attorney General Robert Kennedy, Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), and John F. Kennedy, Jr. Also present next to Mrs. Kennedy is President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Casket Leaves Capitol
Scopenote: Members of the Kennedy family (right) and the growing crowds watch as servicemen place the casket of President John F. Kennedy on the carriage for departure from the U.S. Capitol. Members of the family on the right include Caroline Kennedy, Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy (standing between and behind children), John F. Kennedy, Jr., and Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy. Also present on the extreme right are President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife, Lady Bird Johnson. All others are unidentified.

title: Kennedy Funeral Procession Departs Capitol
Scopenote: The funeral procession carrying the casket of President John F. Kennedy leaves the U.S. Capitol after funeral services in the rotunda.

title: Kennedy Funeral Procession Departs Capitol
Scopenote: The funeral procession carrying the casket of President John F. Kennedy departs the U.S. Capitol.

title: Crowd at Capitol Following Kennedy Funeral
Scopenote: The crowd left at the U.S. Capitol stays largely in place after the departure of the funeral procession of President John F. Kennedy.

title: Kennedy Funeral Procession in Washington
Scopenote: Law enforcement officers watch as the funeral procession carrying the casket of President John F. Kennedy makes its way down Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Funeral at Truman Library
Scopenote: Honor Guard members guard the casket in the lobby of the Truman Library during the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. All are unidentified.

title: Riderless Horse in Kennedy Funeral Procession
Scopenote: The riderless horse follows the Presidential standard past the crowds as the funeral procession of President John F. Kennedy travels down Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C.

title: Kennedy Funeral Procession in Washington
Scopenote: The funeral procession carrying the casket of President John F. Kennedy passes the Hotel Washington on Pennsylvania Avenue after departure from the U.S. Capitol.

title: Kennedy Funeral Procession in Washington
Scopenote: Servicemen surround the casket of President John F. Kennedy as Kennedy's funeral procession makes its way through Washington, D.C.

title: Jacqueline Kennedy Leaves the White House for Kennedy Funeral
Scopenote: Jacqueline Kennedy (center) exits the White House with her children, John F. Kennedy, Jr. and Caroline Kennedy (obscured by Mrs. Kennedy) toward a waiting car on the day of President John F. Kennedy's funeral.  Other members of the Kennedy family follow. title: Priest Walks to Former President Harry S. Truman's Grave Site
Scopenote: Father John H. Lembcke, Jr. (in white robes), walks out to the grave site for former President Harry S. Truman in the courtyard of the Truman Library. Military personnel are lined up on the left. Invited guests are standing behind ropes on the right. Other invited guests are lined up in front of wreaths and floral tributes in the foreground.

title: Father Lembcke Leads Procession to Grave Site of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Father John H. Lembcke, Jr. (in white robes), walks out to the grave site for former President Harry S. Truman in the courtyard of the Truman Library. title: Father Lembcke Leads Procession to the Grave Site of Former President Harry S. Truman

Other invited guests are lined up in front of wreaths and floral tributes in the foreground.

title: Procession to Grave Site of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Father John H. Lembcke, Jr. (in white robes) walks out to the grave site for former President Harry S. Truman in the courtyard of the Truman Library. Military personnel are walking behind Father Lembcke, carrying Mr. Truman's casket. Former First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and other family members follow behind the casket. Invited guests are standing behind ropes on the right. Other invited guests are lined up in front of wreaths and floral tributes in the foreground.

title: Arrival of the Casket
Scopenote: Father John H. Lembcke, Jr.(in white robes), walks out to the grave site for former President Harry S. Truman in the courtyard of the Truman Library. Military personnel are walking behind Father Lembcke, carrying Mr. Truman's casket. The pallbearers are identified, front to rear right side: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Front to rear left side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army. Invited guests are standing behind ropes on the right. Other invited guests are lined up in front of wreaths and floral tributes in the foreground.

title: Presentation of the Colors at the Truman Funeral
Scopenote: The military pallbearers finish folding the flag that draped on the casket of former president Harry S. Truman. The pallbearers are identified, left to right, near side: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Left to right, far side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army (holding flag). The burial of former President Truman was in the courtyard of the Truman Library. Father John H. Lembcke, Jr.(in white robe) presides as the officiating minister.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman's Interment Services
Scopenote: The burial service of former President Harry S. Truman takes place in the courtyard of the Truman Presidential Library. Father John H. Lembcke, Jr., presides as officiating minister. Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman Daniel are seated near the head of the casket. The pallbearers are in the process of folding the flag. They are identified, left to right, near side: casket bearer team leader Sgt. Lyle Gray, Army; Seaman Richard Seid, Navy; S/Sgt. Bill Taylor, Air Force; Sgt. Tim Phillips, Marines. Left to right, far side: Sgt. Juan Escobar, Marines; Seaman James Brainard III, Coast Guard; Seaman David Elmendorf, Navy; Sgt. Greg Kulick, Army.

title: 35th Division Floral Tribute
Scopenote: The members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery, sent this floral tribute to the Harry S. Truman Library for former President Harry S. Truman's funeral, with the design of their unit insignia.

title: Truman leaving the hospital
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right, partly obscured by car door) being moved from a wheelchair into his car upon his release from Research Hospital in Kansas City, Missouri. Mr. Truman had been in the hospital for 15 days. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Hearse Carrying the Body of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The hearse from George C. Carson Funeral Home carries the body of Former President Harry S. Truman from the funeral home to the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. The casket holding Mr. Truman laid in state in the lobby of the Truman Library prior to burial in the courtyard of the Library. All people are unidentified.

title: Hearse Carrying the Body of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The hearse from George C. Carson Funeral Home carries the body of Former President Harry S. Truman from the funeral home to the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. The casket holding Mr. Truman laid in state in the lobby of the Truman Library prior to burial in the courtyard of the Library. Police and United States Army soldiers are standing in the foreground. All people are unidentified.

title: Wreath by Truman's coffin
Scopenote: A wreath, given by President and Mrs. Nixon, sits at the foot of the casket of the late former president Harry S. Truman, as a contingent of soldiers looks over the body in the background.

title: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson and family at the funeral of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson bows his head in respect before the casket of the late former president Harry S. Truman.  With former President Johnson are his wife, Lady Bird Johnson (center), his daughter Lynda Bird Johnson Robb and her husband Charles Robb, and his other daughter Luci Baines Johnson Nugent with her husband Patrick J. Nugent.

title: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson paying his respects just prior to Truman's funeral
Scopenote: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson at the casket of the late former president Harry S. Truman.  With him is his wife, Lady Bird Johnson.  In background is his daughter, Luci Johnson Nugent.

Scopenote: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson and his family leave the Truman Library after paying their respects to the late Former President Harry S. Truman.
